name: Aruba
notes_H1: "ORANJESTAD – In connection with the COVID-19 pandemic, the Department of Public Health launched its website www.arubacovid19.org. The website provides: Information on the latest developments on the COVID-19; Decisions and instructions by the government to contain the spread of the virus and to flatten the curve; Ads and video’s on precautionary measures you can take to protect yourself and others against the coronavirus". Retrieved from: /web/20200406202057/https://www.overheid.aw/news/news_47033/item/department-of-public-health-launched-its-website-for-coronavirus-updates_48638.html
notes_H3: Contact tracing was noted a few times in the daily update.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200521213219/https://www.visitaruba.com/news/general/corona-virus-and-travel-to-aruba/
notes_C7: No data found
notes_C8: "The country is welcoming visitors with open arms and they can stay in Aruba from one week to 90 days. Also the program does not require any visas, but those who come are not allowed to work for a person or company in Aruba. The country is offering accommodations at special rates and free internet connectivity, among others.    As of now, the country is asking US travellers to fill a self-health declaration form and bring a negative Coronavirus test report along. Travellers also have the option to choose pre-pay for a test that will be done upon arrival. Also, they need to buy the Aruba Visitors Insurance.    According to the Aruba Tourism Authority, visitors from other countries need to upload a COVID-19 negative test report taken within 72 hours before departure and uploaded at least 12 hours before the flight."    Web Link: https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/travel/travel-news/all-those-working-from-home-can-do-the-same-from-arubas-gorgeous-islands-instead/as78249484.cms
notes_C4: Starting November 24, more than six persons are allowed to gather at home. Facemasks and a social distance of 1.5 meters are required. It is at the discretion of each family to decide how many people can be in proximity to each other and they have to make sure the rules are abided at all times. As of November 24, restaurants are allowed to have a maximum of 14 diners per table when dining inside and a maximum of 20 diners at each table when dining outdoors. However, diners must follow the rules. Everybody should be seated, while standing at the bar or dancing remains prohibited. https://web.archive.org/web/20201201023825/https:/www.government.aw/news/news_47033/item/relaxation-of-measures-starting-november-24_55282.html
notes_C1: Opening up preconditions educational institutions with regard to preventive measures COVID-19.   Definitely Target group: Demarcated educational institutions: nursery, primary and secondary schools, secondary vocational education, universities, special education institutions that  provide classroom education. Other educational institutions, including crèches,  pre- and after-school care, homes and other special education institutions  (Pasadia Bibito Pin, Pasadia Briyo di Solo y Centro Man na Obra from Foundation before  Mentally Handicapped Aruba (SVGA)) are outside the scope of this document.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201214112702/https://8f39937c-2835-4a9d-b0e9-4a8971f34620.filesusr.com/ugd/1a09f9_3681d33b16ce4da3b97cdc3877b21349.pdf
notes_H6: https://web.archive.org/web/20201214113655/https://www.arubacovid19.org/ddg
notes_C2: Previous measures do not appear to be renewed.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210113044225/https://www.arubacovid19.org/ddg
notes_E2: No evidence found of measures in place to freeze financial obligations.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210114030731/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#A
notes_E1: I cannot find evidence that the programs in place were extended beyond 01 Jan 2021.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210114030613/https://www.svbaruba.org/covid-19/   https://web.archive.org/web/20210114030731/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#A
notes_C3: From 07 Jan 2021 to 31 Jan 2021, "No activity permits will be granted until January 31 2021".     https://archive.is/dqTZz
notes_C6: The curfew valid from 11:00 pm - 5:00 am is valid until January 31, 2021    https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.government.aw/news/news_47033/item/new-measures-and-recommendations-announced-valid-until-january-31_55570.html

name: Afghanistan
notes_H1: While journals like Lancet and official embassy websites of US and UK provide updated information on COVID-19 situation in Afghanistan, there seems to be no coordinated initiative by the Afghan government.
notes_H3: Note: In November, the ministry developed a national emergency response plan for the second wave of COVID-19. The plan has six objectives, including increasing testing capacity and strengthening contact tracing through enhancing community surveillance (this suggests that there is already some, albeit limited, contact tracing). See https://web.archive.org/web/20201130224201/https://www.thelancet.com/action/consumeSharedSessionAction?SERVER=WZ6myaEXBLGG9BXOtoLGog%3D%3D&MAID=Y8sZIZUJ%2Fxh%2B1hNZe9K65A%3D%3D&JSESSIONID=aaa6qrk-F0rxrgd7JOvyx&ORIGIN=915081995&RD=RD
notes_H2: There is currently no policy on "who can get tested". A testing lab was established by FMIC: The testing laboratory is a sampling facility, meaning that samples will be received by MoPH, will be tested at FMIC and the results will be shared back with MoPH after processing. The laboratory will help process over 100 tests per day – during a period when Covid-19 positive cases are on the rise in Afghanistan. The testing lab was established away from the main facilities of the hospital so normal operations at the hospital could continue without Covid-19 restrictions.    See News Article, archived: http://web.archive.org/web/20200826130518/https://www.akdn.org/project/laboratory-services-accelerate-covid-19-testing-afghanistan
notes_C7: Lockdown measures are no longer enforced, provincial borders have opened again https://web.archive.org/web/20200904195409/https://www.humanitarianresponse.info/sites/www.humanitarianresponse.info/files/documents/files/afghanistan_covid-19_access_impediment_report_01_jul_-_25_aug_2020.pdf
notes_C8: According to the UK foreign office:    "Everyone arriving in Afghanistan needs to have their temperature checked at the airport. If your temperature is high, the government will advise you to quarantine and will offer you medical attention at two hospitals in Kabul."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201120094516/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/afghanistan/entry-requirements
notes_C4: According to the IMF report, there are currently no restrictions on gatherings. See report, archived: http://web.archive.org/web/20200825172817/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: Afghanistan reopened schools at all levels on Saturday after health authorities claimed the country surmounted the first wave of the novel coronavirus outbreak.    Education Ministry spokeswoman Nooria Nuzhat announced that all public school students from grades 1 to 10 would again start going to their schools, where hygiene measures will be ensured to avoid contracting COVID-19.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201026120914/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/asia-pacific/covid-19-afghanistan-finally-reopens-all-schools/1994551
notes_H6: "Afghanistan on Monday made the use of face masks mandatory in public places across the country in a bid to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus.  Speaking at a news conference in the capital Kabul, Ahmad Jawad Osmani, Afghanistan’s acting health minister, said the virus situation in the country is “satisfactory” compared to neighboring countries."
notes_C2: No government mandated restrictions seem to be in place since lock down restrictions started easing in Afghanistan.    According to news reports (https://web.archive.org/web/20201108205026/https://apnews.com/article/399dd046ff9c9f5693210d60f58b55ab):     "Desperate for relief from endless war combined with the pandemic, Afghans are rushing back to public recreation as the government eases the lockdown it imposed to fight the coronavirus. Since mid-July, Afghans can once again frequent parks, swimming pools and gyms, shop in malls and celebrate marriages in wedding halls. Universities and private schools have reopened, and at government schools, the 11th and 12th grades have restarted.     Few wear masks or take other precaution — and authorities are left trying to remind the public of the danger of a second wave of the pandemic."
notes_E2: Since there are no new updates on this, this is coded to a 0 again (assuming this was a policy implemented in May only).
notes_C3: AW Updated: Press release on 15 August in Pashto from the Ministry of Public Health regarding the Ashura ceremony indicates that authorities are promoting social distancing precautions, along with "the provision of masks, spraying of antimicrobials in mosques", etc., while not cancelling the event.  As a major religious event, it is likely the government is no longer cancelling events, but recommending precautions, therefore coding a 0   http://archive.fo/wip/aSspx
notes_C6: Lockdown measures are no longer enforced, and people can go about their daily lives again https://web.archive.org/web/20200904195409/https://www.humanitarianresponse.info/sites/www.humanitarianresponse.info/files/documents/files/afghanistan_covid-19_access_impediment_report_01_jul_-_25_aug_2020.pdf
notes_C5: Lockdown measures are no longer enforced, hence public transport can also resume https://web.archive.org/web/20200904195409/https://www.humanitarianresponse.info/sites/www.humanitarianresponse.info/files/documents/files/afghanistan_covid-19_access_impediment_report_01_jul_-_25_aug_2020.pdf

name: Angola
notes_H1: Angola has set-up a central COVID platform with current legal information about what is allowed, as well as statistics and new developments...    source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200715000000*/https://www.covid19.gov.ao/
notes_H2: Government is testing those with suspected symptoms:  "COVID diagnosis test are reserved for suspected cases, i.e people with symptoms or anyone in contact with positive cases."    Outside of governmental tests, private tests are available:      source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200715000000*/https://www.covid19.gov.ao/perguntas-respostas.php
notes_C7: For boarding on domestic flights, it is compulsory to serological test presentation with negative result, carried out in the 72 hours preceding the journey, no authorisation being required    "1. It is recommended that all citizens refrain from circulating on public and similar spaces and roads, and who remain at their homes, except for necessary and unavoidable journeys.    2. Abstaining from movement is particularly recommended or stay on the public highway from 10 pm to 5 am."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201202150415/https://governo.gov.ao/fotos/frontend_1/gov_documentos/2020_dri_169__medidas_excepcionais_e_temporarias_3742179835f96a3aa662f8.pdf  (Official decrete regarding Covid-19 restrictions)
notes_C8: Is a negative?COVID-19 test (PCR and/or serology)?required for entry?? Yes Anyone arriving in Angola must present proof of a negative RT-PCR COVID-19 test; passengers may take the test up to 72 hours prior to travel. Arriving passengers must re-test within seven days of arrival and be released by the health authorities in order to leave quarantine.  Travelers will generally be allowed to quarantine at home. Are?health screening procedures in place at airports and other ports of entry?? Yes The Angolan Ministry of Interior extended the validity of all work, residence, and?temporary visas through December 31, 2020. International flights have resumed in a limited capacity. The following reasons for travel are permitted:  Angolan citizens and foreign residents returning to their home; foreign professionals doing work in Angola; foreigners with a work visa; foreigners returning to their home country; official travel; cargo; humanitarian aid; medical emergencies; technical stops; and diplomatic personnel. The Angolan government requires a negative COVID test 72 hours prior to leaving the country; see below for information on testing. Land borders remain closed for all but commercial transport. Domestic flights between Luanda and the remainder of the country’s provinces resumed on September 14, 2020.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201117170900/https://ao.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: Angola renewed a Public Calamity Status on the 12th November ("Estado de Calamidade Pública"), as mentioned by ANGOP (Official News Agency, link below).  Amongst other, the following measures were implemented:    - Christmas and New Years gatherings in salons and similar places are cancelled.    - Gatherings are limited to 15 people (bubbles) when inside.    - Gatherings are limited to 10 people in public spaces.    source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201218213433/https://www.angop.ao/noticias/politica/covid-19-angola-com-novo-periodo-de-calamidade-publica/
notes_C1: Schools have been permitted to hold in-person classes as of October 5, 2020.  It is however not clear if this means all schools. See: https://ao.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/ [accessed 8 October 2020, web archive unavailable]
notes_H6: "Without prejudice to the provisions of this Order at specific areas, the correct use of masking is mandatory in closed public access spaces, in public transport, in educational establishments, in the street and market sales."    "The use of a face mask in vehicles is compulsory.of school transport by all users, regardless of age"    "It is not compulsory to engage in sporting activities with the use of a face mask."
notes_C2: Certain sectors are allowed to operate. There are time limits on restaurants and supermarkets.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://ao.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: No statement of national debt relief to be found
notes_E1: Cannot find any evidence of further income support beyond last update.
notes_C3: The state of Public Calamity , from the stricter State of Emergency, has now been extended from 9th of October to 7th of November. Public gatherings, a maximum of 10 people in public areas and 15 people at home. Activities and meetings in premises must not exceed 50% of the premise’s capacity and a maximum 150 people. The use of mask is compulsory.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201020155537/https://www.swedenabroad.se/en/embassies/angola-luanda/current/news/observations-on-the-state-of-emergency-that-has-been-in-place-in-angola-since-00.00-on-march-27-2020/
notes_C6: According to the US embassy website, there is no curfew in place. Also domestic flights between Luanda and the remainder of the country’s provinces resumed on September 14, 2020.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200927024309/https://ao.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: Public transportation is limited to 50 percent capacity and is only available until 6p.m  https://web.archive.org/web/20200810203539/https://ao.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Albania
notes_H1: First official government communications aimed at raising awareness among the wider public dated 10 March 2020 Source: Institute of Public Health of Albania  https://web.archive.org/web/20200529111706/http://www.ishp.gov.al/?s=koronavirusi&paged=18
notes_H3: I don't think evidence listed by previous coders constitutes "comprehensive contact tracing". No specific policies are found in the government's website.
notes_H2: 'Currently, in order to be tested for COVID-19 one must have symptoms.'      http://web.archive.org/web/20201108140404/https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/
notes_C7: No evidence of a policy change, no restrictions on internal movement or interstate travel.  source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210102231838/https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/
notes_C8: As of December 21, the Albanian government banned all flights to and from England until January 6, 2021.   source:  https://archive.vn/fuCc5
notes_C4: Gatherings are restricted to no more than 2 citizens - see: https://web.archive.org/web/20200427212500/https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/
notes_C1: Schools are open on a rotation system providing three days of tuition to one group, and two days of tuition to another group. Universities have postponed reopening.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210111235448/https://a2news.com/2021/01/11/universitetet-ende-mbyllur-zhapaj-vendim-politik-ne-rmv-studentet-jane-ne-auditore/
notes_H6: Starting October 15, wearing a mask in all indoor and outdoor areas is mandatory for any individual 11 years old and above. Non-compliance with this rule may result in a fine up to 3,000 ALL.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201108140404/https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/
notes_C2: Order no. 680- For closing bars, restaurants, fast food and restaurants  In the order no. 615, dated 9.11.2020, "On the closure of bars, restaurants, fast food and bars", as amended, the following change is made:  1. Item 1 3 The order is reworded as follows:  "Limiting the activity of bars, restaurants, fast food, bars that provide service to customers throughout the country, from 20:30 to 06:00 starting from 24.12.2020 until 04.01.2021."  This order enters into force immediately and takes effect on 24.12.2020. After the date 04.01.2021 the restriction of the activity of bars, restaurants, fast food, premises that provide service to customers throughout the country will be in the time range from 22:00 to 06:00 until a second order    https://web.archive.org/web/20210123122535/https://new.shendetesia.gov.al/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/Urdher-Nr.680-1.pdf
notes_E2: Limited tax deferrals, however no other debt/contract relief found for households     https://web.archive.org/web/20200817081551/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: Support to salaries and firm liquidity: USD 100 million, through the instrument of a sovereign  guarantee, was allocated to companies that have difficulties in paying employee salaries. The  government will support businesses who stopped working due to the COVID-19 pandemic with a  benefit of not more than USD 14 000 by paying their employees the minimum wage, ALL 26 000.  The self-employed will also receive the same amount.    Median monthly salary in Albania is ALL 92, 300; Average salary as of Q4 2019 is ALL 53458 (http://web.archive.org/web/20201108183838/http://www.salaryexplorer.com/salary-survey.php?loc=3&loctype=1 ; https://web.archive.org/web/20200604191537/http://www.instat.gov.al/en/themes/labour-market-and-education/wages/publications/2019/wage-statistics-q4-2019/)    Coding All workers because of the point around 'self-employed'    https://web.archive.org/web/20200604183631/https://www.oecd.org/south-east-europe/COVID-19-Crisis-in-Albania.pdf
notes_C3: On 8 March, the Albanian Council of Ministers stopped all flights and ferries with quarantined areas of northern Italy until 3 April, halted all schools for two weeks, ordered cancellation of all large public gatherings, and asked sports federations to cancel scheduled matches.  Sources:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200528143137/https://tvklan.al/ndalohen-fluturimet-me-10-destinacione-drejt-italise/ https://web.archive.org/web/20200528143219/https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-health-coronavirus-albania/albania-halts-schools-italy-flights-ferries-over-coronavirus-idUKKBN20W01E?il=0
notes_C6: Public movement is restricted during the hours between 10:00pm and 6:00am; except for work reasons, health care emergencies, or urgent needs. e-Albania portal must be used for special permission to move during this time.  https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/ (Wayback Machine giving errors when saving)
notes_C5: "Public transport and taxis are operating as normal." It no longer appears that the government is recommending any closure of public transport. Masks are required.     http://web.archive.org/web/20200817080741/https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200817080250/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/albania/staying-during-coronavirus
notes_H7: A:    Vaccination begins in Albania for frontline medical workers and personnel.    The Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine is being used.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210118105529/https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/health/albania-carries-out-1st-vaccinations-with-donated-doses/

name: Andorra
notes_H1: The government's  website has regular updates. They also have a Twitter account with regular updates. As well as a Facebook account. Cannot find information about traditional media.    https://archive.vn/Z1BuN  https://archive.vn/Zp9l5
notes_H3: The portfolio holder recalled that the country's strategy is rapid screening - anyone suspected of having been in contact with the disease can ask for a diagnostic test on 821955 - and tracking. In this regard, he confirmed that about 300 diagnostic tests are currently being performed daily and the number of available trackers continues to increase and now exceeds one hundred.  https://web.archive.org/20200729111541/https://www.govern.ad/comunicats/item/11752-salut-realitza-300-proves-diagnostiques-diaries-per-cribrar-positius-per-la-covid-19
notes_H2: In addition to the diagnostic tests performed in labs, citizens can be tested for antigens in private pharmacies and laboratories. In this case, "the tests check if you are infected at that precise moment and have a shorter validity than the lab test, of one or two days" according to the Minister of Health. The advantage is that the result is known in a few minutes.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201124035502/https://www.govern.ad/comunicats/item/12098-la-pressio-al-sistema-sanitari-baixa-arran-del-seguiment-per-part-de-la-ciutadania-de-les-mesures-decretades
notes_C8: According to German foreign office guidance, citizens and residents from EU countries as well as Island, Liechtenstein, Monaco, Norway, UK, San Marino, Switzerland and the Vatican are allowed to enter without a special reason and without any quarantine requirements.  https://archive.vn/0cTzA    According to the Andorran government’s official tourism webpage:  The Andorran, Spanish and French authorities have taken no measures to close the borders and movement into the country.  The Government of Andorra is therefore currently applying no restrictions on entering the country, nor on the movement of people and vehicles around its territory.    Everyone travelling to Andorra is exempt from having to complete a period of quarantine on arrival there.    •	From 9 December, the Government of Andorra has decreed that all tourists who spend 3 or more nights in the country and who are over 6 years of age, will be asked to prove they have tested negative (in a PCR or TMA) in the 72 hours before they arrive in Andorra. Admission to tourist accommodation will therefore also be conditional upon showing a negative result.    The supporting document must be the original, it can be written in Catalan, Spanish, French and/or English and can be submitted either in paper or electronic format. The document must contain at least the following information: the name of the tourist, their passport or identity card number (which must match the one used in their travel documents), the date on which the test was carried out, the identification and contact details of the centre which carried out the analysis, the test technique used and its negative result.     •	Visitors coming from France, Spain and Portugal are exempt from submitting a test due to the health agreements between Andorra and these countries. Similarly, tourists coming from countries considered as being in the ‘green zone’, or from countries whose test ratio for the population of their territory is greater than 5,000 tests carried out per 100,000 inhabitants per week or with less than 9% of their total number of tests being positive, will also be exempt.     •	However, residents of Spain, France or Portugal are advised to obtain a travel document from their Social Security office. People of other nationalities are advised to take out private travel insurance to provide coverage against COVID-19 or other possible incidents during their stay in Andorra.    https://archive.vn/0a76u    It is worth noting that in effect travel restrictions in place in France and Spain determine who can travel to Andorra, since all travel into Andorra requires transit via neighbouring France or Spain.  https://archive.vn/ybv4u
notes_C4: "On September 18, "The Minister of Health, Joan Martínez Benazet, has presented the Decree approved today by the Government in relation to the health emergency situation due to the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus and which will enter into force on Monday 21 September. Martínez Benazet has advanced that the new text will limit family groups and also social activities to a maximum of 10 people, given the importance of reducing social interaction and not leaving cohabiting nuclei. In leisure, cultural and sports activities, the limit is maintained at 50 people and, when this figure is exceeded, it will continue with the activation of specific protocols."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200927103231/https://www.govern.ad/comunicats/item/11886-les-autoritats-sanitaries-demanen-reduir-la-interaccio-social (official press release)
notes_C1: Schools are fully open.   https://archive.vn/5jXic  With various safety measures in place.  https://archive.vn/iOrmB
notes_H6: On 15 July 2020 Andorran authorities made it a legal requirement for anyone over the age of 10 to wear a mask in public spaces, and those who don't comply with the new rules could face a €100 fine, and up to €1,001 for repeated offenses.     "Així doncs, tenint en compte que les mascaretes són una mesura eficaç a l’hora d’evitar la transmissió del nou coronavirus, es decreta la seva utilització obligatòria en la via pública i en espais –tant tancats com oberts– d’ús públic amb independència del manteniment de la distància mínima de seguretat d’1,5 metres. L’obligatorietat concerneix a totes les persones d’edat igual o superior als 10 anys, si bé és recomanable en infants de 6 o més anys."    Web Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200914133747/http://www.radioseu.cat/noticies/el-govern-dandorra-decreta-l2019us-obligatori-de-mascaretes-com-a-mesura-preventiva-davant-la-covid-19
notes_C2: On 20 April the government will begin a pilot test of "phase 1" of their exit strategy, which involves re-opening some non-essential sectors such as real estate and textile making.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200427174636/https://www.govern.ad/comunicats/item/11440-el-govern-preveu-una-represa-progressiva-de-l-activitat-amb-una-primera-fase-que-incloura-aquells-sectors-que-facilitin-el-confinament-i-la-venda-en-linia
notes_E2: Under certain conditions and if eligible, people can request:  - 20% reduction in the amount of rent of their home   - grant of the instalments corresponding to the mortgage or personal loans or an extension of the term repayment of these loans in order to finance the acquisition of their home or the acquisition of their own vehicle.  - 100% reduction in rent for commercial activities that are suspended   - 80-100% discount in electricity bills  See "MESURES ECONÒMIQUES I SOCIALS EXCEPCIONALS I URGENTS PER  PAL·LIAR LA CRISI PROVOCADAPER L’EMERGÈNCIA SANITÀRIA". Pages 10, 11 and 13.  https://www.govern.ad/mesures-economiques-laborals-i-socials/assalariats  (Apologies, the website cannot be archived)
notes_E1: Government has a comprehensive policy for the broad protection of income through employment regulations, unemployment and social security during the pandemic. "(i) Half of these hours will be paid by the company as paid leaves. (ii) The other half will be paid as well, but the worker will have to offset them as it is indicated below:  (a) With extra hours and days-off during the working year. In this case, the consent of the worker is not necessary. (b) With extra hours and days-off from the working year, within 3 months from the first day of the next month when the suspension is over. In this case, the consent of the worker is necessary; and (c) With a maximum of 50%of holidays generated during the current year."  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.caseslacambra.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/CL-Monographic-Act-of-exceptional-and-urgent-measures_Covid-19.pdf
notes_C3: On September 18, "The Minister of Health, Joan Martínez Benazet, has presented the Decree approved today by the Government in relation to the health emergency situation due to the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus and which will enter into force on Monday 21 September. Martínez Benazet has advanced that the new text will limit family groups and also social activities to a maximum of 10 people, given the importance of reducing social interaction and not leaving cohabiting nuclei. In leisure, cultural and sports activities, the limit is maintained at 50 people and, when this figure is exceeded, it will continue with the activation of specific protocols."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200927103231/https://www.govern.ad/comunicats/item/11886-les-autoritats-sanitaries-demanen-reduir-la-interaccio-social (official press release)
notes_C6: Previously coded as 1G on 7th July, due to restrictions around the elderly:  Restrictions on elderly and nursing homes: "the departures of residents are restricted to once a week, which must be done with a single family member and with a maximum duration of two hours. During these outings it will not be possible to have a meal outside or to go to spaces with a high concurrence of people. Visits by relatives to users of assisted living facilities are permitted in accordance with exceptional measures." https://web.archive.org/web/20200716090024/https://www.govern.ad/comunicats/item/11716-el-govern-decreta-l-us-obligatori-de-mascaretes-com-a-mesura-preventiva-davant-la-covid-19    Moving this elderly related restriction to H8.     Cannot find information that recommends for people to stay at home after 7th July (previous coding date) nor have there been any curfews, so changing to 0.
notes_C5: public transport is operating at a reduced capacity ie. 33% capacity and also with a reduction in regular hours. https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.govern.ad/preguntes-coronavirus

name: United Arab Emirates
notes_H1: the UAE launches a website dedicated to awareness of the COVID-19 crisis  http://archive.fo/9oRXW
notes_H3: When did the UAE start contact tracing Covid-19 cases?  Since the very first four cases of coronavirus were detected in the Emirates in late January.  - exact date unknown therefore, coded as 1st February  https://web.archive.org/web/20200430175534/https://www.thenational.ae/uae/health/coronavirus-the-contact-tracing-method-explained-1.1004887
notes_H2: Initially, you had to have symptoms and a travel history to be tested (https://gulfnews.com/uae/health/when-and-where-to-take-a-coronavirus-test-in-the-uae-1.70405120) and this is still stated as conditions on the Ministry of Health's website: https://www.mohap.gov.ae/en/AwarenessCenter/Pages/COVID-19.aspx. However, recently the UAE has been opening up a lot of drive through test centers and while priority is still given to certain segments, it seems the general public is now able to get tested by booking through an app or calling a hotline: https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.thenational.ae/uae/health/coronavirus-how-to-get-tested-in-the-uae-and-how-much-does-it-cost-1.1006284
notes_C7: It is not advised for people over the age of 70 or for those with chronic diseases to travel due to the increased risks associated.    http://archive.fo/npJ2i
notes_C8: ABU DHABI, 3rd July 2020 (WAM) - The United Arab Emirates, represented by the National Emergency, Crisis and Disasters Management Authority, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation and the Federal Authority for Identity and Citizenship, has today announced that all citizens and residents in the UAE are now able travel in accordance with the health preventive and precautionary requirements enforced within the UAE’s airports and the destinations’ regulations.    The UAE’s national carriers, as well as international carriers, will operate their flights according to a classification system, based on several health and safety standards.    The UAE’s travel protocol will apply in accordance with the destination and will be dependent on factors such as public health, health checks upon arrival at the destination and when returning back to the UAE, quarantine and self-monitoring of the health of the traveller. In addition to this precautionary guidelines and procedures will apply.    http://archive.fo/npJ2i
notes_C4: On 18 Sep the ministry of health announces new guidelines on social events which limit to 10 the number of attendees at weddings:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201004205829/https://u.ae/en/information-and-services/justice-safety-and-the-law/handling-the-covid-19-outbreak/guidelines-related-to-covid-19/safety-protocols-for-social-events
notes_C1: Schools across the United Arab Emirates will resume for their second semester on Sunday (3rd January) with two weeks of online distance learning measures in place, according to the Ministry of Education, as the country sees a hike in COVID-19 cases.    “The Ministry of Education has clarified that it was decided in principle that all students will follow distance education system (e-learning) for the first two weeks, and according to the health situation and developments, necessary measures will be taken in the interest of students,” the ministry said in a statement published on the Emirates news agency.  /web/20210118222549/https://english.alarabiya.net/en/coronavirus/2021/01/02/Coronavirus-Coronavirus-UAE-schools-to-start-second-semester-with-2-weeks-of-online-learning
notes_H6: During the COVID-19 pandemic, wearing masks in the UAE is mandatory for all in public places, public transportation or commercial centers, when walking outside in high-density public areas and in private transportation. However, on 31 May 2020, Dubai Government issued new guidelines under which certain people under certain situations would be exempted from wearing a mask even in public areas.       Individuals who have been exempted from wearing a face mask  The individuals have been exempted from wearing a face mask in public are:  children under six years of age  people of determination - those with cognitive, intellectual or sensory disorders or any impairments that prevent their ability to breathe or communicate, normally  those for whom masks can lead to sensory triggering (a medical report is needed to confirm the condition)  the individuals who require supplemental oxygen or have severe respiratory issues or have difficulty breathing with a mask (medical report is needed to confirm the condition).       Conditions under which masks can be removed  Masks can be removed under the following situations:  when driving alone, or with your family members  while eating or drinking in indoor and outdoor settings, that is at restaurants  when engaging in strenuous indoor and outdoor physical exercise  while being alone in a certain setting, like your office and no one is around  while undergoing specific treatments such as dental work, eyes, nose and throat examinations, and other treatments related to hair and beauty.     However, physical distancing must be observed at all times.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207160732/https://u.ae/en/information-and-services/justice-safety-and-the-law/handling-the-covid-19-outbreak/tips-to-stay-safe-from-covid-19
notes_C2: Employers are also permitted to implement the following measures in the DIFC free zone:  Reduced working hours  Imposed vacation  Imposed unpaid leave  Temporary remuneration reduction  Restricted workplace access  Remote working requirements  Extended residency visas where employees are made redundant  In addition, the DIFC is maintaining a “DIFC available employee database” of all employee terminations since 01/03  Sick leave for Covid-19 has special requirements in the DIFC, and is not considered towards an employee’s sick leave balance  Further, Emirates Airlines announced that staff salaries will be returned to 100% from October, despite layoffs in July.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207150245/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/united-arab-emirates-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_E2: Under directive from Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, banks have come together to offer relief to consumers. Among the relief offered:   • Retail loan customers placed on unpaid leave can ask their bank for a repayment holiday of up to three months with zero interest and fees.  • Customers with personal loans, car loans or mortgages can apply for a one-month repayment holiday with zero fees.  (https://web.archive.org/web/20200502084637/https://www.thenational.ae/business/money/how-your-bank-will-help-if-you-are-affected-by-covid-19-1.997187)
notes_C3: Public events are prohibited, only private weddings and funerals are to be permitted with measures published subsequently on the 18th (see C4 indicator):  By Elaine Fung:  "The government published a list of violations and fines pertaining to containing the spread of COVID-19. In it, it specifies that inviting or organising “gatherings, meetings, private and public celebrations or being present in groups at public places or private farms” will be punishable by AED 10,000. It does not specify the crowd size cutoff. See government website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200815112336/https://u.ae/en/information-and-services/justice-safety-and-the-law/handling-the-covid-19-outbreak/enforcement-of-law-to-contain-the-spread-of-covid-19 "
notes_C6: UAE announced it would shorten the night time curfew bye two hours.  https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-emirates/uae-to-shorten-covid-19-prevention-curfew-by-two-hours-idUSKBN23524U
notes_C5: No change.
notes_H7: The United Arab Emirates has lowered the minimum age requirement to receive a COVID-19 vaccination to 16, from 18 previously, the ministry of health said on Sunday.    Coded as a 4 now as Our World in Data shows that 1.8 million doses have been administered- nearly 25% of the population, which justifies this coding    https://archive.vn/9Fduz    https://web.archive.org/web/20210118112140/https://ourworldindata.org/covid-vaccinations?country=~ARE

name: Argentina
notes_H1: https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/tenemos-la-capacidad-de-reaccion-y-estamos-en-vigilancia-absoluta-ante-situacion-mundial-de
notes_H3: The sources cited (here and all the subsequent entries) suggest that contact tracing is being done for every confirmed case. So it can be considered as a comprehensive contact tracing. Applies to all the entries from 4 March till 12 April.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200408152354/https://www.sadi.org.ar/boletines-y-reportes/item/913-actualizacion-epidemiologica-ministerio-de-salud-de-la-nacion
notes_H2: While Argentine government authorities may only test symptomatic patients, citizens may obtain COVID-19 tests at many private labs (diagnósticos/laboratorios). Appointments are generally required, citizens must pay for the cost of their own test.     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201009214732/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/
notes_C7: From October 25 to November 8, some provinces will be under ASPO (Aislamiento social, preventivo y obligatorio = Social, Preventive and Compulsory Isolation) and some others will be under DISPO (Distanciamiento Social, Preventivo y Obligatorio = Social, preventive and mandatory distancing). Under DISPO, internal movement is allowed.    Provinces under ASPO: City of Buenos Aires, Buenos Aires, Chaco, Chubut, Córdoba, La Rioja, Mendoza, Neuquén, Río Negro, Salta, San Luis, Santa Cruz, Santa Fe, Santiago del Estero, Tierra del Fuego and Tucumán.    Provinces under DISPO: Misiones, Corrientes, Formosa, Entre Ríos, Catamarca, Jujuy, La Pampa and San Juan.     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201028220922/https://argentina.as.com/argentina/2020/10/25/actualidad/1603627708_473148.html
notes_C8: "Argentine authorities are implementing a “tourism pilot program” for citizens and residents of bordering countries traveling to the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area for tourism.  This program does not apply to the United States.  In addition to the sworn statement required of all passengers entering Argentina, persons entering under this pilot program must also present a negative COVID-19 PCR test within the 72 hours before travel and proof of medical insurance for COVID-19 that covers hospitalization or isolation for the duration of their stay in Argentina. Travelers under the program  must enter Argentina at Ministro Pistarini Ezeiza International Airport, San Fernando International Airport, or the Buquebus Ferry Terminal in Buenos Aires.  As Argentine authorities are still finalizing the details of this pilot program, persons who believe they meet its requirements should contact Argentine immigration directly."  https://web.archive.org/web/20201116171330/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/
notes_C4: Gatherings under 10 people are allowed in the provinces of La Pampa, Entre Ríos, San Juan, San Luis, Mendoza y Jujuy only. Gatherings are forbidden in the rest of the country. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201020131954/https://www.pagina12.com.ar/299764-dia-de-la-madre-en-que-provincias-estan-permitidas-las-reuni
notes_C1: Ministry of Education is actively working on the "Seguimos Educando" plan, considering remote and hybrid schemas for education for 2021. In the meantime education remains remote.  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/educacion/seguimos-educando-en-las-escuelas
notes_H6: "Argentina made face masks obligatory for everyone using public transport and out in public on April 14."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200907231620/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/04/countries-wearing-face-masks-compulsory-200423094510867.html
notes_C2: Gyms, discos and other non-essential workplaces are allowed to open in some provinces. A general lockdown is in place until October 25. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201020131736/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/alberto-fernandez-extendio-el-aislamiento-social-preventivo-y-obligatorio-hasta-el-25-de
notes_E2: The services of electrical energy, running water, gas through networks, fixed and mobile telephony and Internet and cable television may not be suspended due to non-payment (up to 3 consecutive or alternate bills) during a period of 180 calendar days (from 25 March to September 21, 2020).  This measure includes both the MSMEs described in Resolution 173/2020, Worker Cooperatives or Recovered Companies registered in INAES and Public Entities that contribute to the preparation and distribution of food in the framework of the food emergency; as well as to the residential users detailed in Decree 311/2020, including monotributistas enrolled in a category whose annualized monthly income does not exceed 2 times the Minimum Vital and Mobile Salary.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200603182118/https://www.latinfinance.com/daily-briefs/2020/5/7/argentina-says-there-s-time-to-reach-a-debt-restructuring-deal    Webpage back-archived from previous note, but a copy of the page from 21st April 2020:   https://web.archive.org/web/20200421114329/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/produccion/medidas-pymes-covid
notes_E1: 495/5000  The Family Emergency Income (IFE) is established for informal workers and monotributistas, between 18 and 65 years old, with the highest degree of vulnerability, who in mid-April will collect $ 10,000 one-time, although it could be repeated in May if circumstances so require. merit.    The IFE joins the package of measures already in place that reach formal workers in the critical, informal, monotributistas, retired, pensioners, allowance beneficiaries and companies sectors.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200603182807/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/covid-19-el-gobierno-implementara-el-ingreso-familiar-de-emergencia-ife-para-aliviar-la
notes_C3: During the period of "social, preventive and compulsory isolation", no cultural, recreational, sporting, religious, or any other type of event involving the attendance of persons may take place. This period has been extended to the 12 of April.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200603183936/https://www.boletinoficial.gob.ar/detalleAviso/primera/227042/20200320    'It will run from March 20 to 31'
notes_C6: 5th June    The Government of Argentina has announced that the national quarantine that began on March 20 has been extended through June 28, with greater restrictions in the greater Buenos Aires area under DNU 297/2020. President Alberto Fernández on Thursday night announced the extension of Argentina's mandatory lockdown in selected large cities, especially Buenos Aires and its surroundings, until June 28.     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200611100938/https://www.batimes.com.ar/news/argentina/lockdown-extended-until-june-28-with-two-types-of-quarantine.phtml    Regional variations remain in place: “Considering that the epidemiological situation is not homogeneous within the national territory, the administration of isolation will adopt a modality that contemplates the reality of the various jurisdictions of the country.  Provincial and local authorities may request exceptions to isolation from personnel affected by certain activities and services” Source:   https://web.archive.org/web/20200620154857/https://www.boletinoficial.gob.ar/detalleAviso/primera/228261/20200426    https://web.archive.org/web/20200622180219/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/    https://web.archive.org/web/20200614231327/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/medidas-gobierno
notes_C5: Still current
notes_H7: A:    Argentines will be vaccinated with the Russian Sputnik V coronavirus vaccine beginning on Tuesday 29 December.    "The doses of the Sputnik V vaccine that arrived from Russia will be available in each province and on Tuesday Dec. 29 at 9 am the simultaneous vaccination will begin throughout the country," President Alberto Fernandez said Sunday in a tweet.    Argentine medical workers began receiving the vaccine and officials insisted it was safe. President Alberto Fernández called it the largest vaccination campaign in the country’s modern history.    The vaccine  will be free and voluntary.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210104125537/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/americas/argentina-covid-19-vaccinations-with-sputnik-v-start/2090879    https://web.archive.org/web/20210104125657/https://apnews.com/article/belarus-coronavirus-pandemic-latin-america-auto-racing-glance-russia-fcddcc286f8295421c0ff301c242dad0

name: Australia
notes_H1: 25th January- Information at ports after first cases confirmed, but no national campaign as yet. Information is on display at all major international ports around Australia, with instructions on what to do if travellers have symptoms or if symptoms develop.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200413093831/https://www.health.gov.au/ministers/the-hon-greg-hunt-mp/media/first-confirmed-case-of-novel-coronavirus-in-australia
notes_H3: First case in Australia confirmed on 25 January 2020. Health Minister's announcement says contact tracing will be undertaken. https://web.archive.org/web/20200402211239/https://www.health.gov.au/ministers/the-hon-greg-hunt-mp/media/first-confirmed-case-of-novel-coronavirus-in-australia
notes_H2: Recommendation for testing if showing a symptom of coronavirus, or for other reasons such as working in a high-risk environment or if having received an organ transplant.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201106223200/https://www.health.gov.au/sites/default/files/documents/2020/09/coronavirus-covid-19-guidance-for-people-tested-for-covid-19_0.pdf    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201117175657/https://www.health.gov.au/news/health-alerts/novel-coronavirus-2019-ncov-health-alert/what-you-need-to-know-about-coronavirus-covid-19
notes_C7: "- New South Wales: anyone can enter NSW. The Queensland-NSW border will be open to all travellers from NSW as of Tuesday 1 December 2020. Anyone travelling into NSW who has been to South Australia in the last 14 days must complete a NSW entry declaration form before entering NSW.    - Victoria: a permit system is in place in Victoria for people who have travelled through certain areas designated green, orange or red zones. People travelling from red zones will be denied entry, with some exemptions. The Northern Beaches of NSW are a red zone and from 11.59pm on Sumday 20 December, all of Greater Sydney will be a red zone.    - Queensland: the Queensland border is open to all of New South Wales and Victoria. You will only be required to complete a Queensland Border Declaration Pass if you have been in a hotspot in the last 14 days, or overseas and didn’t fly into Queensland when you arrived in Australia. The NSW Northern Beaches region was declared a hotspot from 1am on 19 December 2020. From 1am 20 December, anyone who has been in NSW from 11 December must complete a border pass declaration.    Tasmania: all travellers from ACT, NSW, NT, QLD, VIC and WA need to register via the Tas e-Travel system at least three days before entering Tasmania but can otherwise freely enter. Anyone travelling from South Australia must quarantine for 14 days in Tasmania (but may be able to do so at home). The intended quarantine location must be registered through the G2G PASS system.    - Western Australia: travellers from ACT, NT, QLD and TAS will not be required to quarantine or present for Day 11 testing. However, they will need to complete the G2G PASS registration and declaration process. From Sunday 20 December, WA will be closed to travellers from NSW.    - South Australia: anyone travelling to SA must complete a cross-border travel registration, with travel open to everyone. SA has declared Greater Sydney a high-transmission zone, requiring people to self-quarantine and get tested on day one, five and 12. People from the Northern beaches area will not be allowed to enter SA from    - Northern Territory: you can enter provided you fill out a border entry form up to 72 hours before arrival and present it upon entry. You will be required to legally declare you have not been in an area the state considers a Covid-19 hotspot in the past 28 days. Penalties of up to $5,000 and up to three years in prison apply for providing misleading information. Arrivals from a hotspot area must go into 14 days supervised quarantine at the traveller’s expense.From 18 December 2020, NSW’s Northern Beaches area was declared a hotspot.    - ACT: anyone can enter the ACT, however, the territory may declare areas as “Covid-affected” requiring 14 days of self-quarantine. From 19 December ACT declared the NSW Northern Beaches a Covid-affected area."    "From 11.59pm on Sunday 20 December, residents in greater Sydney, which includes Central Coast and Blue Mountains area, can only have up to 10 visitors to their home. That rule is set to stay in place until 11:59pm Wednesday 23 December. People living outside the northern beaches are also not permitted to enter the LGA unless the above reasons apply.    Queensland, Victoria, Tasmania and the Northern Territory have implemented travel restrictions barring entry to residents of the northern beaches, while Western Australia is requiring all residents of NSW to quarantine."    Note: Since Sydney is a NSW capital I have upgraded the code to 2G - since now all Australian states have travel restrictions.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201223001046/https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2020/dec/07/australia-covid-19-lockdown-rules-coronavirus-restrictions-by-state-nsw-victoria-vic-queensland-qld-western-south-australia-wa-sa-nt-act-travel-border-social-distancing-masks
notes_C8: "Passengers from New Zealand will be able to travel to Australia, quarantine-free, from Friday, 16 October, provided they have not been in an area designated as a COVID-19 hotspot in New Zealand in the preceding 14 days."    Link:  http://archive.today/2020.10.19-181332/https://www.pm.gov.au/media/safe-travel-zone-new-zealand    The opening of the border to passengers from New Zealand indicates that the borders are not closed to all regions, hence change of code to "3".
notes_C4: "New South Wales: people in greater Sydney can only have up to 10 visitors in their home from 11.59pm on Sunday 20 December. In the rest of the state, people are allowed a maximum of 50 visitors in their homes at a time. However NSW Health strongly recommends having no more than 30 visitors at a time if the residence has no outdoor area. If there are more than 50 visitors at a home, every person can be held individually responsible for a breach of the public health order.  - Victoria: people are allowed to have up to 30 visitors in their homes each day. The government advised people to keep a record of visitors where possible.  - Queensland: you are allowed up to 50 guests inside your home.  - Tasmania: you can have up to 40 visitors in your home.  - Western Australia: there is no limit to the number of guests you are allowed as long as there is no more than one person per 2 sq m.  - South Australia: gatherings in private homes are limited to 10 people, regardless of age. All gatherings must observe the density requirements of one person per 4 sq m.  - Northern Territory: there is no limit on how many people can gather indoors or outdoors, but you must keep 1.5 m between you and anyone with whom you don’t live. Gatherings of more than 100 will require the completion of a Covid-19 checklist.  - ACT: there is no limit on visitors, but physical distancing should be maintained."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201223001046/https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2020/dec/07/australia-covid-19-lockdown-rules-coronavirus-restrictions-by-state-nsw-victoria-vic-queensland-qld-western-south-australia-wa-sa-nt-act-travel-border-social-distancing-masks
notes_C1: "Schools across all states have reopened to face-to-face learning.    In NSW there are some restrictions on activities, including requiring physical distancing for choirs, musical ensembles and class activities which involve group chanting.     In Victoria, students over 12 must wear a face mask if they are learning or doing onsite supervision unless they attend a primary school."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201223001046/https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2020/dec/07/australia-covid-19-lockdown-rules-coronavirus-restrictions-by-state-nsw-victoria-vic-queensland-qld-western-south-australia-wa-sa-nt-act-travel-border-social-distancing-masks
notes_H6: In an easing of restrictions to the Greater Brisbane area QLD  "from 6pm AEST 11 January 2021 to 1am 22 January 2021, the Greater Brisbane region will be subject to new restrictions".  This required individuals to carry a face mask at all times and wear them: on public transport infrastructure or at public transport infrastructure; in a commercial passenger vehicle or waiting in a designated outdoor space that is not a residence for a commercial passenger vehicle; in an indoor space.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210113003355/https://www.qld.gov.au/health/conditions/health-alerts/coronavirus-covid-19/current-status/public-health-directions/restrictions-impacted-areas  https://web.archive.org/web/20210113004212/https://www.health.qld.gov.au/system-governance/legislation/cho-public-health-directions-under-expanded-public-health-act-powers/restrictions-impacted-areas    In a tightening of restrictions from Sunday 3 January 2021 (restriction still current) the NSW govt made facemasks in Greater Sydney (including Wollongong, Central Coast and Blue Mountains) face masks are mandatory in the following indoor settings:  shopping (retail, supermarkets and shopping centres)  on public/shared transport and waiting areas for public/shared transport  indoor entertainment (including cinemas and theatres)  places of worship  hair and beauty premises  visiting an aged care facility.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210113092916/https://www.nsw.gov.au/covid-19/face-masks    In an easing of restrictions the VIC govt From 5pm on 31 December 2020 direct that you must wear a fitted face mask when you are in public indoor spaces unless you have a lawful reason not to. This includes places such as:  shopping centres, supermarkets, retail outlets and markets  when visiting hospitals and aged care facilities   restaurants and cafes, when you are not eating or drinking  libraries  cinemas  churches and places of worship  entertainment facilities  recreational facilities and gyms  indoor workplaces.  Face masks continue to be mandatory on public transport and when in taxis or ride share vehicles.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210113093135/https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/face-masks-when-wear-face-mask    On the 8th Jan 2021 the National Cabinet met and all state and territory representatives agreed to make directions such that All passengers, excluding children 12 and under or those with particular exemptions, and air crew must wear masks on flights and in airports. https://web.archive.org/web/20210113093456/https://www.pm.gov.au/media/statement-national-cabinet
notes_C2: In an easing of restrictions to the Greater Brisbane area QLD  "from 6pm AEST 11 January 2021 to 1am 22 January 2021, the Greater Brisbane region will be subject to new restrictions".  All businesses are now allowed to open with COVIDsafe restrictions including "All businesses may now have one person per 4 square metres on their premises indoors, or one person per 2 square metres outdoors. Businesses with a floor space less than 200 square metres can have one person per 2 square metres, up to 50 people at a time." Further no standing allowed at restaurants and cafes, dancing not allowed except at dance studios/classes and weddings, stadiums and theaters limited to 50% capacity.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210113003355/https://www.qld.gov.au/health/conditions/health-alerts/coronavirus-covid-19/current-status/public-health-directions/restrictions-impacted-areas  https://web.archive.org/web/20210113004212/https://www.health.qld.gov.au/system-governance/legislation/cho-public-health-directions-under-expanded-public-health-act-powers/restrictions-impacted-areas    COVIDsafe restrictions for businesses in Greater Sydney area NSW remain without any substantive changes.  All businesses (with the exception of nightclubs) can open with COVIDsafe restrictions in place (square meter rule, collection of client contact details, and maximum numbers of patrons allowed).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210113002155/https://www.nsw.gov.au/covid-19/what-you-can-and-cant-do-under-rules/greater-sydney   https://web.archive.org/web/20210113004827/https://www.legislation.nsw.gov.au/file/Public%20Health%20%28COVID-19%20Restrictions%20on%20Gathering%20and%20Movement%29%20Order%20%28No%207%29%202020_210108_5.27pm.pdf
notes_E2: On 25 March 2020, a 6 month temporary debt relief program came into effect to support individuals and businesses. The temporary debt relief measures include: Six month temporary debt protection Changes to bankruptcy notices Impacts to people who are currently bankrupt https://web.archive.org/web/20200723054416/https://www.afsa.gov.au/debtrelief
notes_E1: On 22 March 2020, the eligibility criteria for this payment was extended to new payment recipients who are eligible for their payment or card between 12 March 2020 to 13 April 2020 (inclusive). As long as someone had lodged a claim for an eligible payment and was eligible for that payment by 13 April 2020, they should have already received this economic support payment via Services Australia or the Department of Veterans’ Affairs. Payments were made from 31 March 2020 and would have been received by the majority of recipients by 17 April 2020.https://www.dss.gov.au/about-the-department/coronavirus-covid-19-information-and-support
notes_C3: In an easing of restrictions to the Greater Brisbane area QLD  "from 6pm AEST 11 January 2021 to 1am 22 January 2021, the Greater Brisbane region will be subject to new restrictions".  'Uncontrolled' public gatherings of up to 20 people allowed.  Indoor and outdoor events, Convention centres and show grounds, Concert venues, theatres, auditoriums and cinemas, Major Sports Stadiums all able to operate with COVID safe restrictions including limits on total numbers of people, 50% capacity restrictions, and square meter rules.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210113003355/https://www.qld.gov.au/health/conditions/health-alerts/coronavirus-covid-19/current-status/public-health-directions/restrictions-impacted-areas  https://web.archive.org/web/20210113004212/https://www.health.qld.gov.au/system-governance/legislation/cho-public-health-directions-under-expanded-public-health-act-powers/restrictions-impacted-areas    All other Australian states and territories have some restrictions on public gatherings/events in place (variously including limits on total numbers of people, 50% capacity restrictions, and square meter rules)     VIC: https://web.archive.org/web/20210113012347/https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/sites/default/files/documents/202101/Restricted%20Activity%20Directions%20%28Victoria%29%20%28No%205%29%20-%203%20January%202021%20signed.pdf    ACT:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210113013541/https://www.legislation.act.gov.au/View/ni/2020-801/current/PDF/2020-801.PDF    WA:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210113012948/https://www.wa.gov.au/sites/default/files/2020-12/241220-Closure-and-Restriction-Limit-the-Spread-Directions-No-10.pdf    SA:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210113014328/https://www.covid-19.sa.gov.au/documents/emergency-directions-covid-19/Emergency-Management-Public-Activities-No-16-COVID-19-Direction-2020.pdf    TAS:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210113014935/https://coronavirus.tas.gov.au/__data/assets/pdf_file/0018/133074/Direction-under-Section-16-Mass-Gatherings-No.-1-effective-from-1-December-2020.pdf    NSW:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210113004827/https://www.legislation.nsw.gov.au/file/Public%20Health%20%28COVID-19%20Restrictions%20on%20Gathering%20and%20Movement%29%20Order%20%28No%207%29%202020_210108_5.27pm.pdf    NT: https://web.archive.org/web/20210113024835/https://coronavirus.nt.gov.au/__data/assets/pdf_file/0010/951895/cho-directions-no57-directions-major-public-events.pdf
notes_C6: In an easing of restrictions to the Greater Brisbane area QLD  "from 6pm AEST 11 January 2021 to 1am 22 January 2021, the Greater Brisbane region will be subject to new restrictions".  While COVIDsafe restrictions on gatherings remain in place (variously total number of people, square meter rules, and need to wear a mask) all people in QLD are able to leave their homes for non-essential reasons.  So long as residents follow these restrictions it does not appear that they are being discouraged from leaving their homes.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210113003355/https://www.qld.gov.au/health/conditions/health-alerts/coronavirus-covid-19/current-status/public-health-directions/restrictions-impacted-areas  https://web.archive.org/web/20210113004212/https://www.health.qld.gov.au/system-governance/legislation/cho-public-health-directions-under-expanded-public-health-act-powers/restrictions-impacted-areas  https://web.archive.org/web/20210113030518/https://www.qld.gov.au/health/conditions/health-alerts/coronavirus-covid-19/current-status/easing-greater-brisbane-restrictions
notes_C5: 18 May  “Hundreds of thousands of Sydneysiders will have to give up their public transport commute and drive to the city under strict new social distancing measures announced by the NSW government. Capacity on trains, buses and ferries will be slashed, temporary car parking set up at Moore Park and six new pop-up cycleways rolled out across Sydney, Premier Gladys Berejiklian announced on Monday. Just 12 people will be allowed on a bus and 32 in a train carriage as the government works to maintain strict physical distancing of 1.5 metres on the network.  Trains will run at 24 per cent capacity and buses at 14 per cent for the foreseeable future, meaning Sydneysiders may be prevented from entering railway stations as they fill up or watch near-empty buses drive past their stops”  Source: http://archive.vn/zhhOo

name: Austria
notes_H1: Chancellor Kurz informs about measures against the Coronavirus, appeals to Austrians, launches info campaign and telephone hotline; http://web.archive.org/web/20200528142740/https://www.bundeskanzleramt.gv.at/bundeskanzleramt/nachrichten-der-bundesregierung/2020/bundeskanzler-kurz-zu-massnahmen-gegen-coronavirus-oesterreich-ruestet-sich-fuer-alle-szenarien.html
notes_H3: Once a case has been confirmed, contacts are determined, informed and may be put into quarantine depending on situation. https://web.archive.org/web/20200402195123/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Haeufig-gestellte-Fragen.html
notes_H2: Austria was to embark on a mass-testing scheme on the 15, 16 and 17 January with the obligation of a compulsory testing requirement in order to re-enter society after the lockdown. Those who received a negative test were to be allowed to leave the house and visit retail shops and hospitality (cafes and restaurants) from 18 January. Those who are not tested would be required to quarantine for another week until 25 January. For all those who were not willing to be tested, the lockdown rules were to apply a week longer. Since the lockdown has been extended until 7 February, the mass testing scheme has been scrapped.    https://archive.vn/y6WbB
notes_C7: In general and for the pre-qualified reasons people can still move within the country. But, movements must take place before 8pm or after 6am or be related to one of the scenarios as outlined in C6.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201109211208/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html
notes_C8: "Austria has suspended the entry by third-country nationals, including U.S. citizens, from outside the EU and the Schengen area since mid-March 2020."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200916160830/https://www.austria.info/en/service-and-facts/coronavirus-information/entry-regulations
notes_C4: From October 23, the following rules/measures go into effect:  - No more than six people are allowed to attend indoor meetings (outside of work), such as yoga courses, birthday parties, and weddings. Funerals are exempt from this order.  - Outdoor meetings are limited to 12 people. No further restrictions apply. At restaurants, the maximum number of people at a table is limited to six.  Link: https://archive.vn/zpRsC
notes_C1: Austria re-enters a new period of national lockdown on 26 December.    The lockdown measures include distance learning in all schools when they return on January 7th, with face-to-face lessons again allowed from January 18th.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201222174453/https://www.thelocal.at/20201218/austria-to-enter-third-lockdown-on-december-26th
notes_H6: Since September 14th, mouth and nose protection (MNS) must be worn in the following areas:    In public transport and taxis  In all business premises for customers and staff in the customer area in closed rooms (e.g. supermarket, car dealership, banks, insurance companies, hairdressers, pharmacies, etc.)  In administrative authorities and administrative courts for party traffic  In bathrooms for bathers and staff in contact with customers in closed rooms (with the exception of damp rooms such as showers and swimming pools)  In the catering industry for staff with customer contact in closed rooms  In accommodation establishments (hotel business) for guests and staff in contact with customers in generally accessible areas in closed rooms. The catering rules apply to catering operations  In sports facilities for guests and for staff in contact with customers in closed rooms (except for sports)  In museums, exhibitions, libraries, archives and other leisure facilities for guests and staff in closed rooms with customer contact  At events in closed rooms (except at the assigned seat, whereby an MNS must still be worn if the meter distance cannot be maintained despite keeping the adjacent seats free)  In the visitor area of ??trade and public fairs, if the 1 meter distance cannot be maintained.  In cable cars and cog railways, coaches and in the interior of excursion boats  If, due to the nature of the service, the minimum distance of one meter cannot be maintained (e.g. for care and health services)  For services, if the 1 meter distance cannot be maintained or no other protective measures (e.g. plexiglass) are available.  During demonstrations, when the 1 meter distance cannot be maintained.  The operators and their employees must wear an MNS when they come into contact with the customer, provided that there is no other suitable protective device between the people for spatial separation that guarantees the same level of protection.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200916160505/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/ampelfarben/hohes-risiko-orange/verbindliche-bundesweit-geltende-massnahmen-orange/
notes_C2: Austria re-enters a new period of national lockdown on 26 December.    In this period, non-essential businesses must close    https://web.archive.org/web/20201222174453/https://www.thelocal.at/20201218/austria-to-enter-third-lockdown-on-december-26th
notes_E2: Broad relief package with suspension on interest payments, partial release of obligation to pay rent etc. (http://web.archive.org/web/20200528142508/https://investinaustria.at/en/news/2020/03/corona-aid-package-economy-details.php;https://iclg.com/briefing/11275-consequences-of-the-current-situation-regarding-covid-19-for-tenants-and-landlords; http://web.archive.org/web/20200528142504/https://metropole.at/how-the-coronavirus-will-affect-your-business-in-austria/)
notes_E1: New, expanded form of short-time work for companies that are economically affected by COVID-19 introduced in spring 2020.   From October 1, 2020, working hours can only be reduced by at least 20 and up to a maximum of 70 percent for the entire calculation period.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201103001533/https://www.bmafj.gv.at/Services/News/Coronavirus/FAQ--Kurzarbeit.html  https://archive.vn/EziNK
notes_C3: Professional events, such as soccer games or opera performances, are required to have placed seating. Only 1,500 people are allowed outdoor and 1,000 indoor. Masks must be worn during the entire duration of the event. No drinks or food will be offered.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201103000933/https://www.vienna.at/verschaerfte-corona-massnahmen-ab-heute-in-kraft/6786417
notes_C6: Leaving your own private living area between 8 p.m. and 6 a.m. is only permitted under the following conditions: Avoidance of immediate danger to life, limb and property; Supervision of and assistance for people in need of support as well as exercise of family rights and fulfillment of family duties; Covering the basic needs of daily life; Professional and educational purposes, if necessary; Staying outdoors for physical and mental relaxation (e.g. going for a walk, jogging).  https://web.archive.org/web/20201109211208/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html
notes_C5: In general public transport and other means of transportation are running as normal. The minimum distance must be observed on public transport and on the plane. Mouth and nose protection is mandatory. It is also mandatory to wear mouth and nose protection in underground stations, platforms, stops, train stations and airports as well as their connecting structures. Carpooling, taxis and taxi-like operations can still be used if only two people are transported in each row of seats, including the driver. This also applies to training trips, such as driving schools. Mouth and nose protection is mandatory. Cable cars may not be used for leisure purposes.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201109211208/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html
notes_H7: After vaccinating residents and staff in nursing homes, 8,500 physicians in private practice and their office staff, 1,500 mobile caregivers and 1,000 paramedics will receive the first dose of Covid-19 vaccine in Vienna's first Covid-19 vaccination line by Monday, January 18, 2021.    All Viennese residents can pre-register for a Covid-19 vaccination starting January 18, 2021. As long as the vaccine is still in short supply, it is necessary to rank the appointments according to priority - for example, age or Covid-19 risk due to previous illnesses.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210118190430/https://www.vindobona.org/article/vienna-opens-first-covid-19-vaccination-line

name: Azerbaijan
notes_H1: 'Operational Headquarters' set up by Government under the Cabinet of Ministers to "prevent danger that the coronavirus pandemic could cause, to implement prophylactic and urgent measures." Other aims are to "regularly inform the population about the situation". (https://nk.gov.az/az/article/680/)
notes_H3: Active contact tracing is implemented in all cases immediately upon identification of a case. See WHO website, archived https://web.archive.org/web/20201219093015/https://www.covid19healthsystem.org/countries/azerbaijan/livinghit.aspx?Section=1.5+Testing&Type=Chapter#6Testing
notes_H2: Testing for asymptomatic was temporarily banned due to laboratory workload in Azerbaijan.   Link: https://archive.vn/CfuoW https://archive.vn/oE7MP
notes_C7: Entry and exit is prohibited to and from Sheki, Lankaran, Gakh, Zagatala, Bilasuvar, Jalilabad, Masalli, Ismayilli, Guba and Khachmaz until December 14, 2020.  Between December 14, 2020 and January 18, 2021, movement into and out of the following cities and regions is prohibited, unless one is working for an entity or organization that qualifies for an exception, and only if your information has been entered by your employer into the “icaze.e-gov.az” portal: Baku, Sumgayit, Ganja, Mingachevir, and Shirvan, as well as the Absheron region and the Lankaran, Masalli, Jalilabad, Sheki, Zagatala, Guba, Khachmaz, Yevlakh, Barda, Bilasuvar and Ismayilli district centers (except villages and settlements).  Link: https://archive.vn/w0iU5
notes_C8: "As of April 25, Azerbaijan has confirmed 1617 cases of COVID-19 within its borders. There have been 21 confirmed deaths.       All of Azerbaijan’s borders are currently closed to passenger traffic.  Flights into and out of Azerbaijan are no longer available."    http://web.archive.org/web/20200426025508/https://az.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-for-azerbaijan/
notes_C4: "public gatherings of more than 10 people are prohibited nationwide."  http://web.archive.org/web/20201231092918/https://crisis24.garda.com/insights/news-alerts/wip10011884326/azerbaijan-authorities-to-tighten-covid-19-related-restrictions-nationwide-from-dec-14-update-25
notes_C1: All schools have been closed once again, starting Oct 19th, due to quarantine measures.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201029005850if_/https://nk.gov.az/en/article/1131/
notes_H6: "The wearing of masks both outdoors and indoors in public places is mandatory. Failure to wear a mask could incur a 100 AZN fine."    http://web.archive.org/web/20201231100722/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/azerbaijan/coronavirus
notes_C2: Government agencies are limiting office staff to 30 percent of manpower, whilst other employees are required to work remotely.    Shopping centres are currently restricted to operating via delivery services and online sales. Personal care businesses, such as barbershops and beauty salons, are also closed.   All the above will re-open on 25 January 2021. Cinemas, theatres, religious rituals, and sports events remain closed or prohibited.     See security agency Garda World article, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210124071314/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/430716/azerbaijan-authorities-extend-national-quarantine-until-at-least-april-1-certain-restrictions-eased-update-26 AND state news agency APA article, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210124071910/https://apa.az/az/sosial_xeberler/Dovlt-qurumlarinda-iscilrin-say-hddinin-30-faizdk-azaldilmasi-bard-qayda-quvvd-saxlanilib-624955
notes_E1: The government of Azerbaijan stated that about 600 business representatives will receive a one-time payment of about 190 AZN as a result of the extension of quarantine measures until January 31. It should be noted that 190 AZN is less than 50% of the median salary in Azerbaijan whereas the government said that only business representatives will receive a payment which is more about formal workers.   https://archive.vn/dxEaB
notes_C3: "Non-compliance with the rules regarding social distancing, movement restrictions, mask mandates, and gathering in large groups can result in fines up to 200 AZN."    "public gatherings of more than 10 people are prohibited nationwide."  http://web.archive.org/web/20201231092918/https://crisis24.garda.com/insights/news-alerts/wip10011884326/azerbaijan-authorities-to-tighten-covid-19-related-restrictions-nationwide-from-dec-14-update-25    http://web.archive.org/web/20201231092737/https://az.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-for-azerbaijan/
notes_C6: In specific areas under strict quarantine measures, non-essential activities are banned. Exceptions are limited to the activities of grocery stores, pharmacies, security forces, healthcare providers, utility service providers, freight services, and financial services. Residents are required to seek permission to leave their house for specific purposes via a government SMS system.     See US embassy website, archived: https://archive.vn/lbsSC AND government Ministerial Cabinet decision: https://koronavirusinfo.az/files/3/78933e9d16f649ed659861358360f732.pdf
notes_C5: Public transport throughout the country will be suspected on Saturdays and Sundays until the end of the special quarantine regime until 1 April 2021. Passenger transportation in Baku metro has also been suspected.     See state news agency APA article, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210124133717/https://apa.az/az/sosial_xeberler/Hft-sonlari-ictimai-nqliyyatin-faliyytin-ttbiq-olunan-mhdudiyyt-davam-edck-624652
notes_H7: Mass vaccination campaign is launched on 18 January 2021 for health and technical workers working at the country’s medical institutions, law enforcement staff and servicemen.     From 1 February 2021, vaccination for people aged over 65 will begin.     Azerbaijan has purchased 4 million doses of Sinovac vaccine in total.     See Chinese new agency Xinhua News article, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210124065444/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2021-01/18/c_139677882.htm

name: Burundi
notes_H1: First advisory (communiqué) was issued with measures to reduce the risk of COVID contamination on 01 Feb. Ministry of health continued to issue covid-19 related communiqués post this.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200508170859/http://minisante.bi/?p=540  However, it seems like it was more of public health officials urging caution rather than a coordinated campaign.
