notes_H2: According to the Swiss government's website, only symptomatic people with a referral from their GP will have access to a free test.   https://archive.vn/wip/IuJaW
notes_C7: As of 6 June 2020, there are no more restrictions on workplaces.    The only remaining restrictions are on gatherings in public of more than 30 people, events or demonstrations with more than 300 people and sports competition involving close physical contact.  Keeping a distance, wearing a mask and observing hygiene rules still applies    (see http://web.archive.org/web/20200611185821/https://www.bag.admin.ch/bag/en/home/krankheiten/ausbrueche-epidemien-pandemien/aktuelle-ausbrueche-epidemien/novel-cov/massnahmen-des-bundes.html)
notes_C8: As of, June 15, Switzerland has lifted all COVID-19 related entry restrictions for travelers from other Schengen countries. The Swiss government has not announced a date when Switzerland will lift the current entry restrictions for U.S. citizens.    This is the updated information at the US embassy site. So, I am coding it to Ban.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201028171227/https://ch.usembassy.gov/covid-19-info/
notes_C4: Private gatherings can have a maximum of 10 people, preferably from no more than two households. Outdoors 'spontaneous' gatherings can have a maximum of 15 people.     In Geneva, Jura, Neuchâtel, Solothurn and Ticino public and private gatherings are limited to max 5 people.      http://web.archive.org/web/20201207170557/https://www.bag.admin.ch/bag/en/home/krankheiten/ausbrueche-epidemien-pandemien/aktuelle-ausbrueche-epidemien/novel-cov/massnahmen-des-bundes.html    http://web.archive.org/web/20201207195443/https://www.thelocal.ch/20201111/what-are-the-coronavirus-shutdown-measurers-in-every-swiss-canton
notes_C1: Higher education institutions switched to distance learning from Monday, 2 November 2020.     Classroom teaching is still permitted at compulsory school level and at upper secondary schools (baccalaureate and vocational schools).    This measure was announced on October 28, 2020, and applied on November 2, 2020, for an indefinite period of time.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201109173331/https://www.bag.admin.ch/bag/en/home/das-bag/aktuell/medienmitteilungen.msg-id-80882.html
notes_H6: The requirement for persons over the age of 12 to wear a mask on public transport has been in place since 6 July. From Monday 19 October this will be extended to railway stations including platforms, airports and other publicly accessible public transport areas. As before, persons who are unable to wear a mask for medical reasons are exempt from the requirement.  Masks are now also compulsory in publicly accessible indoor spaces including all shops, shopping centres, banks, post offices, museums, libraries, cinemas, theatres, concert venues, indoor areas of zoos and botanical gardens, restaurants, bars, discos, casinos, hotels (with the exception of guests’ rooms), entrance areas and changing rooms in swimming pools, sports facilities and gyms, doctor’s surgeries, hospitals and places of worship, advisory centres and neighbourhood centres. Masks must also be worn in publicly accessible areas of administrative buildings.  Face masks must also be worn in all schools and higher education establishments, in child-care facilities and in the training areas of sport and fitness centres if part of the centre’s precautionary measures.    https://archive.vn/2fyBb
notes_C2: Recoded from 3T to 2G because Geneva's local lockdown was softened with the reopening of various activities from 21 November: personal services involving physical contacts such as hairdressers, beauticians, barbers, tattoo artists and therapists.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201207191537/https://www.ge.ch/en/covid-19-restrictions-closures-and-other-measures
notes_E2: The measure to protect renters expired on 1 June 2020  "Extension of the deadline for payment arrears by the tenant from 30 today to at least 90 days. However, this only applies to payment arrears that arise in connection with the Federal Council's measures to combat the corona virus. It is also only about rents and ancillary costs that are due between March 13 and May 31, 2020."    (http://web.archive.org/web/20200710220151/https://www.bwo.admin.ch/bwo/de/home/mietrecht/coronavirus.html)    Other measures providing debt/contract relief to families are not known.
notes_E1: From 17th September, in certain situations it is possible to claim for income support:  •	Parents who have to stop working because their children are no longer being looked after via schools etc.  •	Income loss due to quarantine  •	Self employed who are forced to stop trading    The income support is 80% of the lost salary.    https://archive.vn/wip/gZQW7
notes_C3: Public events will be banned. Exceptions are made for religious services (for up to 50 people), funerals attended by family and close friends, parliamentary assemblies and political demonstrations.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201220075316/https://www.bag.admin.ch/bag/en/home/das-bag/aktuell/medienmitteilungen.msg-id-81582.html
notes_C6: From 18 Oct, working from home is explicitly recommended.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201207193013/https://www.bag.admin.ch/bag/en/home/das-bag/aktuell/medienmitteilungen.msg-id-80771.html
notes_H7: B,C: Pfizer/BioNTech      Vaccination was started in most cantons on 4 January 2021. Especially vulnerable people are being vaccinated first.   The following people are to be given access to vaccinations first:  * People age 75 and over  * People with chronic diseases of the highest risk, regardless of their age    https://web.archive.org/web/20210109120317/https://www.bag.admin.ch/bag/en/home/krankheiten/ausbrueche-epidemien-pandemien/aktuelle-ausbrueche-epidemien/novel-cov/impfen.html

name: Chile
notes_H1: Ministry of health announces COVID response has moved to Phase three, asks all citizens to take self-care measures, quarantines to be respected, handshakes, kisses and the most efficient measure, which is frequent hand washing, to be avoided. Launches government website; https://web.archive.org/web/20200331183753/https://www.gob.cl/noticias/covid-19-ministerio-de-salud-confirma-que-chile-paso-fase-3/
notes_H3: The law ruling the Ministry of Health of Chile establishes that any unforeseen disease (such as COVID-19) should be tested to anybody who is suspect of having it. They released the report with such information on March 30. It is not clear the exact day they started testing.  https://www.minsal.cl/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/INFORME_EPI_COVID19_20200330.pdf  Official Contact Tracing Guidelines published (6 March 2020): https://www.minsal.cl/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/2020.03.06_PROTOCOLO-SEGUIMIENTO-CONTACTOS-CASOS-CONFIRMADOS_COVID-19.pdf
notes_H2: "COVID-19 testing is available at all public and private hospitals/clinics. Anyone may request a test, whether symptomatic or not, though private hospitals and clinics may require an appointment beforehand."  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://cl.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Jaime Mañalich, Minister of Health, announced that the Chilean government decrees a total mandatory quarantine for the province of Santiago, the country's capital, and other neighboring communes. The decision will take effect at 10:00 p.m. on Friday, May 15 [/web/20200601192955/https://www.bbc.com/mundo/noticias-america-latina-52655289]
notes_C8: "On December 29, the Chilean government announced that starting on December 31, all travelers, including Chileans, foreign residents, accredited diplomats, and foreign tourists, must complete an obligatory 10-day quarantine upon their arrival to Chile.  They will be able to leave quarantine with a negative PCR result based on a test taken on or after the seventh day in quarantine.  Travelers must remain in quarantine while they await their result."    "ATTENTION Travelers coming from UK: Due to the information provided by the United Kingdom authorities, and its epidemiological situation, the Chilean Government has determined, as of Tuesday 22nd December:  - The cancellation of all direct flights between the UK and Chile.  - A ban on entry to all foreign non-legal residents who have been in the UK in the last 14 days.  - The obligation for all Chilean and legal foreign residents on a regular basis entering the country, and who have been in the UK for the last 14 days, to undertake a mandatory 14-day quarantine in Chile."    http://web.archive.org/web/20201221112951/https://cl.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: "All public events with more than 50 people are indefinitely prohibited." In certain regions that are in stage 1, they must stay at home, only leaving their house twice a week for purchases or essential procedures.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201113065927/https://www.gob.cl/coronavirus/plandeaccion/  https://web.archive.org/web/20201113163049/https://www.gob.cl/coronavirus/pasoapaso/
notes_C1: Since 1 July 2020, schools have reopened in COVID-19 free remote pacific islands of Easter Island and Juan Fernandez archipelago. All other schools remain closed. See UNICEF situation report https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/UNICEF%20Chile%20COVID-19%20Situation%20Report%20No.2-%2030%20July%202020.pdf AND local news agency Chile Today article, archived https://web.archive.org/web/20201129085624/https://chiletoday.cl/schools-reopen-on-easter-island-with-outbreak-under-control/
notes_H6: 'Its use is mandatory in public and private transport throughout the country, as well as in elevators and places where there are 10 or more people crowded together (for example, health centers, supermarkets, pharmacies, etc.).'  Link -  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221112227/https://www.gob.cl/coronavirus/plandeaccion/
notes_C2: Jaime Mañalich, Minister of Health, announced that the Chilean government decrees a total mandatory quarantine for the province of Santiago, the country's capital, and other neighboring communes. The decision will take effect at 10:00 p.m. on Friday, May 15 [/web/20200601192955/https://www.bbc.com/mundo/noticias-america-latina-52655289]
notes_E2: Still appears to be current   https://web.archive.org/web/20200827131007/https://www.gob.cl/coronavirus/plandeaccion/#v-pills-planeconoemergencia
notes_E1: "President Piñera signs a project that expands Emergency Family Income to benefit up to 5.6 million people: "It reaches far beyond vulnerable groups and includes the middle class." The initiative, which is part of the Agreement for Social Protection and Job Recovery, extends the benefit to up to $ 100,000 per person.    The program, part of the transversal agreement promoted by the President for social protection and job recovery, changes its design to act as a complement to the current income of the family group. This encompasses both households with no formal income and those with some formal income, and includes families with other benefits such as the employment protection law, unemployment insurance, support for independent workers and people who collect contributory pensions. and non-contributory.    The law adds a fourth month of payment, which will be 80% of income and may go up to 100% if sanitary conditions so warrant."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200702133937/https://prensa.presidencia.cl/comunicado.aspx?id=152600
notes_C3: "All public events with more than 50 people are indefinitely prohibited."  http://web.archive.org/web/20201113065927/https://www.gob.cl/coronavirus/plandeaccion/
notes_C6: Jaime Mañalich, Minister of Health, announced that the Chilean government decrees a total mandatory quarantine for the province of Santiago, the country's capital, and other neighboring communes. The decision will take effect at 10:00 p.m. on Friday, May 15 [/web/20200601192955/https://www.bbc.com/mundo/noticias-america-latina-52655289]
notes_C5: Transportation is running on a reduced schedule.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201113065927/https://www.gob.cl/coronavirus/plandeaccion/
notes_H7: A:    Starting December 24, the Chilean government has started vaccinating "medical personnel from the regions of La Araucanía, Biobío and Magallanes, some of the most affected by the pandemic. As of January 11, 2020, there have been 10, 699 first doses administered.    https://www.dw.com/es/chile-iniciar%C3%A1-la-vacunaci%C3%B3n-contra-la-covid-19-este-jueves-24-de-diciembre/a-56044566  https://web.archive.org/web/20210111201030/https://www.gob.cl/yomevacuno/

name: China
notes_H1: The National Health Commission maintains a dedicated website on prevention and control of covid-19 covering daily official notifications on the situation, news, policy announcements, public health education and Q&As.  Similar contents are also pushed through its official wechat account on the social media in different formats including videos and infographics.  Earliest archived links on 25 Jan: https://web.archive.org/web/20200125111315/http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/xxgzbd/gzbd_index.shtml ; https://web.archive.org/web/20200125131140/http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/xxgzbd/gzbd_index.shtml ; https://web.archive.org/web/20200125171110/http://www.nhc.gov.cn/xcs/xxgzbd/gzbd_index.shtml ; https://web.archive.org/web/20200515072508/https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s?__biz=MjM5NjI2ODA4Mw%3D%3D&amp=&mid=2653026291&amp=&idx=1&amp=&sn=30c83ca6019e9d72171b112ff37f4e02&amp=&chksm=bd3e86af8a490fb93b1b9d84fcb3981d4bed57f30e8b8e822eaef86f3552e178993e39db6028 ; https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://wemp.app/accounts/56c44cd4-9e6a-4aa1-aa0f-a1118c43d617?page=293
notes_H3: According to the notification of Wuhan health commission, serious contact tracing is being pursued.   163 close contacts have been traced and put under medical observation.  Source:   https://web.archive.org/web/20200514235719/http://wjw.wuhan.gov.cn/xwzx_28/gsgg/202004/t20200430_1199589.shtml
notes_H2: Chinas Joint Prevention and Control Mechanism announced efforts to intensify the screening of asymptomatic cases.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.chinadailyhk.com/article/126119
notes_C7: Unless for exceptional reasons, people are prohibited from entering or leaving Ruili urban areas.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200917220208/https://www.sohu.com/a/418681610_120207611
notes_C8: "Worried that international travelers might trigger a second wave of coronavirus infections, China announced late Thursday night that it was suspending practically all entry to the country by foreigners and was halting almost all international passenger flights as well." https://web.archive.org/web/20200326195009/https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/26/world/asia/china-virus-travel-ban.html
notes_C4: Communities in Kashgar are under total lockdown which excludes the possibility of any form of gathering.    https://archive.vn/UOCfm
notes_C1: A region in DongJiangGang District of Tianjian was classified as high-risk area since Nov. 20. Schools within the region were closed.  Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201121072659/http://www.tj.gov.cn/sy/tjxw/202011/t20201121_4099687.html  http://web.archive.org/web/20201121073113/http://bmfw.www.gov.cn/yqfxdjcx/index.html
notes_H6: Since Kashgar is in a total lockdown, when people leave for very limited reasons, they need to wear masks at all times, according to the police.     https://archive.vn/le3Zo    https://archive.vn/UOCfm
notes_C2: Many restaurants, beauty salons, pubs and night clubs are required to close, as a confirmed case had visited.   https://archive.vn/6E1g5
notes_E2: Loan relief policy: http://web.archive.org/web/20200924071933/http://www.gov.cn/zhengce/zhengceku/2020-02/01/content_5473639.htm  Guideline to prevent services such as electricity, gas and heating from stopping: http://web.archive.org/web/20201114104246/http://www.gov.cn/xinwen/gwylflkjz27/index.htm
notes_E1: As of April 11,  special measures have been introduced to facilitate access to unemployment insurance payments. These include relaxed application deadlines and certification requirements as well as new online application forms. (1.) However, benefits remain inaccessible to a large portion of the population without formal employment contracts or unemployment insurance policies. (2.)    (1.) https://web.archive.org/web/20200531120945/http://www.gov.cn/xinwen/2020-04/11/content_5501214.htm     (2.) https://p.dw.com/p/3aolH
notes_C3: Mass gatherings shall be reduced to the greatest extent.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200124234617/http://www.nhc.gov.cn/wjw/xwdt/202001/ad36526a13dd4c5e93ab9a9f8122ab7f.shtml
notes_C6: A region in DongJiangGang District of Tianjian was classified as high-risk area since Nov. 20. Residents within the region were required staying at home -- total confinement.    Local government staffs and community workers support the essential needs of residents living in the lock-down communities.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201121074150/https://m.gmw.cn/2020-11/20/content_1301822441.htm   http://web.archive.org/web/20201121072659/http://www.tj.gov.cn/sy/tjxw/202011/t20201121_4099687.html
notes_C5: public transport suspended in Manzhouli from 24 November until further notice.    https://archive.vn/rjloW
notes_H7: A:    China formally started to vaccinate group A - Key workers - and people who need to go to high-risk countries/regions to work and/or study on 15 Dec 2020. Key workers are those who work in frozen stuff-importing industry, border check, market for fresh meet and fish, public transportation, and hospital. Groups B and/or C will be the next to be vaccinated.    https://archive.vn/oG1an

name: Cote d'Ivoire
notes_H1: http://info-covid19.gouv.ci/
notes_H3: There is no data to support an extensive contact tracing campaign as I have seen in other countries. For example, in the guidance provided by the government, there is no detail about it. The closest language is around contacting your healthcare provider if you feel ill. http://info-covid19.gouv.ci/
notes_H2: On march 16, government announced that testing and care for suspected and confirmed cases of Covid-19 would be free:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200510115104/http://www.gouv.ci/doc/1584396935COMMUNIQUE-DU-CONSEIL-NATIONAL-DE-SECURITE-RELATIF-A-LA-SITUATION-DE-LA-PANDEMIE-DE-LA-MALADIE-A-CORONAVIRUS-2019-COVID-19-EN-COTE-D-IVOIRE.pdf
notes_C7: Domestic flights have resumed, no specific restrictions on domestic movement. https://web.archive.org/web/20200803232532/https://www.worldaware.com/covid-19-alert-cote-divoire-extends-state-emergency-through-july-30-easing-lockdown-greater-abidjan
notes_C8: Proof of negative COVID test required upon arrival. Temperature checks completed upon arrival. /web/20201116171946/https://ci.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: There is no data supporting restrictions on gatherings at this time.
notes_C1: Per the US State Department, all schools, including universities, are open. https://web.archive.org/web/20201221152046/https://ci.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Facemasks are required in public including the greater Abidjan area and all vehicles.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201230033209/https://ci.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: "As of July 31, 2020, bars, clubs, movie theaters, and other entertainment venues in Abidjan may now open, but must respect social distancing norms and patrons are expected to wear masks."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200804020937/https://ci.usembassy.gov/health-and-travel-alert-u-s-embassy-abidjan-cote-divoire-august-3-2020/Bars, nightclubs, cinemas and theatres reopen from 31 July." No mention of any other businesses that are closed.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200804015535/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cote-d-ivoire/coronavirus
notes_E2: https://web.archive.org/save/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/ivory-coast-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html    On 21 March 2020, the CBWAS took major measures, in order to mitigate the negative impact of the sanitary crisis:  A FCFA340bn financial help has been granted to commercial banks, so they can sustain the economy;  1,700 companies have been granted loans, while they were not eligible so far, so that they can benefit from further resources;  The West African Development Bank (WADB) will receive FCFA25bn from the CBWAS, in order to lower its interest rate and increase the amount of loans granted to WAMU members, so as to be able to fund the domestic economy;  To accept to delay financial debt reimbursements, especially for SMEs;  To decrease the cost of fund transfers through mobile money, in order to avoid a low in transactions;  To fund commercial banks with enough cash to guarantee a good working of cash machines;  If necessary, to reorganize the schedule of Treasury bills issuance.  The government announced several measures to preserve the key sectors of the economy:  The setting up of a private sector support fund for an amount of XOF 250 billion, in order to strengthen the SMEs with at least XOF 100 billion and the setting up of guarantee funds, in order to facilitate the access to bank credits;  The setting up of a specific support fund for informal sector enterprises affected by the crisis for an amount of XOF100 billion.  Support for the main sectors of the national economy, particularly cashew nuts, cotton, rubber, oil palm, cocoa and coffee with  XOF 250 billion;  Support for food, market gardening and fruit production for an amount of CFAF 50 billion, including CFAF 20 billion for inputs.
notes_E1: I do not show any additional support beyond the initial donation above, however Unicef is working in partnerships with locals to provide other support for children and families in need but I dont see any formal information.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210110223002/https://www.unicef.org/stories/cote-divoire-protecting-children-and-young-people-move-during-covid-19
notes_C3: In researching the topic, there is nothing to indicate a cancellation of public events. In reviewing past comments, there are around mask measures. To whit, public events are allowed and NOT being discouraged.
notes_C6: A State of Emergency remains in effect, Social distancing and a reduction in non-essential movements are encouraged, though not enforced.  Vulnerable populations, including the elderly, pregnant women, and those with chronic health conditions, are advised to remain at home.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201230033209/https://ci.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: Unable to find official guidance regarding public transport, however, current bus and train timetables appear to be available with multiple busses and some trains daily. Given the reduction in movement restrictions and opening of domestic travel, it seems public transport would be accessible. https://web.archive.org/web/20200804021829/https://www.rome2rio.com/map/Bouak%C3%A9/Abidjan

name: Cameroon
notes_H1: The website for the Ministry of Health with a webpage focused on COVID-19 is still up. Although unsafe with some outdated information. Please see: https://archive.vn/ntiPX
notes_H3: No data was found for this placeholder.
notes_H2: Testing campaign launched: https://www.cnbcafrica.com/africa-press-office/2020/04/06/coronavirus-cameroon-massive-testing-campaign-launched-in-cameroon/ ; https://www.businessincameroon.com/health/2403-10124-coronavirus-cameroon-plans-mass-testing
notes_C7: There is no restriction to movement in place according to the Embassy of the US in Cameroon. Please see:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201206224307/https://cm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: The Embassy of the US in Cameroon confirms that there is screening for passengers. Although quarantine is not required, travellers are encouraged to limit contact with others for 14 days after their trip. Please see:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201206224307/https://cm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: Gatherings of more than fifty persons are prohibited: https://web.archive.org/web/20200428102503/https://www.africanews.com/2020/03/18/cameroon-closes-all-borders-amid-raft-of-coronavirus-guidelines//  https://web.archive.org/web/20200428102625/https://www.journalducameroun.com/en/cameroon-closes-schools-borders-among-measures-to-contain-coronavirus/
notes_C1: Older students go back to school on 15 Oct with strict safety measures: masks, social distancing, frequent hand santiation, etc.     https://archive.vn/iZ55W
notes_H6: Wearing a mask in public became compulsory in Cameroon from 13 April.    https://archive.vn/V6RmP
notes_C2: According to the UK Government's website on travel to Cameroon, visits to public institutions, including government buildings, have been limited. Please see:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210117234822/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cameroon/coronavirus
notes_E2: No new information was found for this placeholder.
notes_E1: continued payment of family allowances was only from May to July to staff of companies which are unable to pay social security contributions or which have placed their staff on technical leave due to the crisis. No mention of continuing this policy in August. See: https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19 (web archive not working, but previous notes have captured the same statement)
notes_C3: Religious gathering are not prohibited but there is a restriction on gatherings. It is limited to 50 people according to the UK government on travel to Cameroon. Please see:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201206224531/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cameroon/coronavirus
notes_C5: Public transport open with mask requirements: https://archive.vn/7ckqR

name: Democratic Republic of Congo
notes_H1: WHO Congo starts social media campaign in Congo, informing on ways to prevent SARS-CoV-2 spread; https://web.archive.org/web/20200521230002/https://kivupress.com/fr/11608-la-communication-comme-principale-arme-de-lutte
notes_H3: Reports from government ministers that contact tracing is in place for a positive case (Belgian citizen) in Kinshasa. https://web.archive.org/web/20200402210143/https://www.monitor.co.ug/News/National/DR-Congo-confirms-first-coronavirus-case/688334-5486440-v42nor/
notes_H2: First case tested and confirmed https://web.archive.org/web/20200408194343/https://www.afro.who.int/news/first-case-covid-19-confirmed-democratic-republic-congo
notes_C7: Everything has been resumed since August in regards to COVID: https://web.archive.org/web/20201021163042/http://stopcoronavirusrdc.info/directives-prises-par-le-gouvernement
notes_C8: https://web.archive.org/web/20201222020649/https://cd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    Are U.S. citizens required to quarantine? No  Travelers entering the DRC, regardless of the origin of their travel, are not required to quarantine so long as they show a negative COVID-19 test taken within 7 days of departure from their point of origin and receive a negative COVID-19 test upon arrival.  Following the sample collection at the airport, travelers must self-quarantine until they receive a negative test result, generally within 24 hours.
notes_C4: The President announced that the state of emergency that had been in effect since March 24 due to COVID-19 ended on July 22nd. With the lifting of the state of emergency, as of 22 July large gatherings as are social gatherings, events and meetings.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200723083621/https://cd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200723084016/https://sante.cd/2020/07/21/rdc-ce-quil-faut-savoir-sur-les-mesures-levees-de-letat-durgence/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200723085906/https://www.rfi.fr/en/africa/20200722-drc-president-signals-end-of-covid-19-health-emergency-urges-continued-caution  http://web.archive.org/web/20200723090207/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/362081/drc-authorities-lift-covid-19-state-of-emergency-july-22-update-19
notes_C1: "schools, colleges and universities have reopened."    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/democratic-republic-of-the-congo/coronavirus
notes_H6: Masks are required in public spaces. https://web.archive.org/web/20210104170731/https://cd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: "social enterprises eg bars and nightclubs remain closed."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210119003054/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/democratic-republic-of-the-congo/coronavirus
notes_E2: Most of the relief measures ended in June (this information is also included in the last note for this indicator on May 6th 2020). For example, in April, the government granted, for 2 months, the supply of water and electricity free of charge to households, hospitals as well as micro & small and medium-sized enterprises which are affected by the closure measure as part of the response against COVID-19;  there was also a measure to prohibit the eviction of tenants who did not honour their commitments only from March to June 2020. No new relief measures have been evident since then. See: https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/drc-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html; Also, https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19 [accessed 8th October 2020, web archive unavailable]

notes_C6: Curfew in effect. In order to stop the spread of COVID-19, the government of the DRC announced a nationwide curfew from 9pm to 5am, beginning Friday, December 18, 2020.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210107122834/https://cd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: Everything has been resumed since August in regards to COVID: https://web.archive.org/web/20201021163042/http://stopcoronavirusrdc.info/directives-prises-par-le-gouvernement

notes_C1: According to the UNESCO website. The schools are fully open.    Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20201108145808/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse
notes_H6: From 30 April, the President of the Republic of Congo announced that the use of face masks would be compulsory in public spaces.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200911005454/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/338286/congo-government-extends-covid-19-lockdown-measures-until-may-15-update-4
notes_C2: According to the website of the US Embassy in  Congo, public markets are open on weekdays (except Wednesday) and Saturday.    Bars and nightclubs that were closed are now open.    Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20201129205003/https://cg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: According to the IMF website, the BEAC also reduced haircuts applicable to private instruments accepted as collateral for refinancing operations until end-2020, which it extended by 6 months from January 1, 2021 at its December 21, 2020 MPC meeting. Please see: https://archive.vn/po4Gk
notes_E1: Unable to find comprehensive information about income support since April 22nd: KPMG Insights stated: 'Creation of a fund (XAF 100 Billions) in order to help companies and vulnerable population.  No further details communicated as of 31st  March 2020.  Issuance of treasury bills and bonds to boost government budget revenue.  Free water and electricity for all households during the confinement period.  Financial aid of 4 billion FCFA granted to households and people experiencing poverty.' It can be assumed that main bulk of support for the population is coming from foreign governments and international organisations e.g. WHO, WFP, France, and UN agencies.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201123175722/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19    https://web.archive.org/web/20200611222509/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/republic-of-congo-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_C3: Due to the banning of public gatherings above 50 people (apart from public markets), public events are restricted by implication. However, due to no explicit mention that public events are banned, it is assumed that they are recommended not to be held (rather than required).   https://web.archive.org/web/20201021185847/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/congo/-coronavirus
notes_C6: Night-time curfew in Brazzaville and Pointe Noire.    Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210104114446/https://cg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: According to the US Embassy, public transport is operating.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://cg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Colombia
notes_H1: There’s an ongoing coordinated public information campaign through traditional channels and social media at least since March 9 onwards. Here’s some examples: Ministry of Health’s campaign, posted on March 9: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JYaA-k2g4Hs  Other videos from the Ministry of Health available here: https://www.youtube.com/user/MinSaludColPrensa/videos  Ministry of Education’s campaign, posted on March 9: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NPGBNjxJcGE Other videos from the Ministry of Education available here:  https://www.youtube.com/user/mineducacion/videos  Plus these: http://web.archive.org/web/20200603125610/https://www.minsalud.gov.co/English/Paginas/historico-noticias.aspx
notes_H3: Government Decree #1374 issued on October 19th  The government has created something called “El Programa de Pruebas, Rastreo y Aislamiento Selectivo Sostenible (PRASS)”. This directly translates to “The sustainable program for testing, tracking, and self isolation”     On page 2, the last paragraph says that the Ministry of Health created an information system called “SegCovid19” to hold he information about the health response, as well as any cases, or important information to do with the pandemic. This is where they capture all of their data.     On page 5, paragraph 3.5 it says that any person that has been exposed to a confirmed COVID-19 case, or a suspected case, will have to follow the instructions of the Ministry of Health.     Page 6, paragraph 4.1 states the structure and teams that make up PRASS. 4.1.2, 4.2, and 4.3 says that there are contract tracing teams. These teams are interdisciplinary and made up of individuals with different levels of technical and professional expertise. Additionally, the teams have support from individuals trained in telephone and in person tracing, as well as in tracking confirmed and suspected cases and their contacts.     Page 12, Article 17 outlines the responsibilities of the tracing teams:  -On a daily basis they have to track the confirmed and suspected cases, in addition to all of their contacts.  -They use an algorithm to determine the priorities for tracking.  -They follow-up with cases and contacts for a 14 day period.  -They ensure that those with positive or suspected cases are isolated and monitor their symptoms.     Page 13, Article 19 says that all of the data that is collected by the contact tracing team must be entered into the SegCovid19 database.      https://web.archive.org/web/20201109135635/https://www.minsalud.gov.co/Normatividad_Nuevo/Decreto%201374%20de%202020.pdf
notes_H2: The first version of the guidelines on the detection of COVID cases that all health providers must follow were issued and approved by the Ministry of Health on January 31, 2020. Since this version of the guidelines, anyone who "fits" the symptoms of COVID must be tested by the health provider.  Here's the link to the first version of the guidelines: http://eselavega-cundinamarca.gov.co/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/GIPS05-LINEAMIENTOS-IPS.pdf   The revised version of the guidelines was issued on March 19 and it included more details about the description of the types of cases, but maintained the policy of testing anyone who is symptomatic. Here's the link to the second version of the guidelines:  https://www.minsalud.gov.co/Ministerio/Institucional/Procesos%20y%20procedimientos/GIPS05.pdf
notes_C7: A 4-day strict quarantine is in effect since Thursday in the capital city of Bogota, which is now on "Red Alert".  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110055917/https://gestion.pe/mundo/capital-de-colombia-decreta-cuarentena-por-segunda-ola-de-covid-19-temen-presencia-de-nueva-cepa-noticia/
notes_C8: The Decree 412  issued on March 16  by the Presidency ordered the closure of all international frontiers (land, maritime and river) from March 17 and until May 30.  Here’s the link to the Decree: https://web.archive.org/web/20200603144410/https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%20412%20DEL%2016%20DE%20MARZO%20DE%202020.pdf Later, the Presidency issued Decree 439 of March 20, which suspended (between March 23 and April 23, international flights incoming to Colombia. Here’s the link of the decree:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200409082330/https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%20439%20DEL%2020%20DE%20MARZO%20DE%202020.pdf Finally, the Decree 569 issued on April 15, extended the suspension of international flights incoming to Colombia until the end of the “sanitary emergency status” (May 30).  Here’s the link of the decree:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200603144726/https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%20569%20DEL%2015%20DE%20ABRIL%20DE%202020.pdf [archived web version]
notes_C4: A 4-day strict quarantine is in effect since Thursday in the capital city of Bogota, which is now on "Red Alert".  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110055917/https://gestion.pe/mundo/capital-de-colombia-decreta-cuarentena-por-segunda-ola-de-covid-19-temen-presencia-de-nueva-cepa-noticia/
notes_C1: In Colombia, some schools have been opened with reduced and limited capacity (with 20-30% of the total capacity) and with an alternation model, in which in the same year, some students go to school and others see the class from home. In addition, the use of face masks, disinfection or frequent hand washing and temperature measurement upon admission is mandatory. However, the return to face-to-face classes was only for private schools, since the vast majority of public schools in the country continue with virtual classes.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201205234325/https://www.infobae.com/america/colombia/2020/10/15/esta-listo-el-piloto-de-regreso-a-clases-en-19-colegios-de-bogota/  https://web.archive.org/web/20201205234152/https://www.eltiempo.com/colombia/barranquilla/regreso-a-clases-clases-presenciales-en-colegios-de-barranquilla-551074  https://web.archive.org/web/20201205234152/https://www.eltiempo.com/colombia/barranquilla/regreso-a-clases-clases-presenciales-en-colegios-de-barranquilla-551074  https://web.archive.org/web/20201205235220/https://chequeado.com/el-explicador/como-es-la-vuelta-a-las-clases-presenciales-en-america-latina/
notes_H6: Recommended policies since September 1st: https://www.minsalud.gov.co/Normatividad_Nuevo/Resoluci%c3%b3n%20No.%201513%20de%202020.pdf
notes_C2: A 4-day strict quarantine is in effect since Thursday in the capital city of Bogota, which is now on "Red Alert".  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110055917/https://gestion.pe/mundo/capital-de-colombia-decreta-cuarentena-por-segunda-ola-de-covid-19-temen-presencia-de-nueva-cepa-noticia/
notes_E2: After the issuance of Decree 417, on March 17 2020,  the citizens that have to pay rent cannot be evicted from their homes during the emergency and up to two months after it. In addition, during the economic emergency, and for two months more, the leasing fees cannot be increased.  Here’s the links:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501012945/https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%20417%20DEL%2017%20DE%20MARZO%20DE%202020.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200429211423/https://www.lafm.com.co/colombia/duque-anuncia-que-queda-prohibido-el-desalojo-por-no-pago-de-arriendo  From March 18 onwards the government offered: i) free reconnection of the aqueduct service for those families who have the service suspended; ii) freeze the increase of the water and aqueduct services bills; and iii) suspension of the collection of tariffs for water purification.  Here’s the links:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501013557/https://id.presidencia.gov.co/Paginas/prensa/2020/MinVivienda-explico-nuevas-medidas-desde-el-sector-de-agua-potable-relacionadas-con-la-contencion-del-coronavirus-200318.aspx  https://id.presidencia.gov.co/especiales/200317-medidas-enfrentar-coronavirus/index.html  According to the IMF the following benefits have been granted by the Colombian government: “ a two-month suspension of pension contributions by both employees and employers, delayed tax collection for the tourism and air transportation sectors, an exemption of tariffs and VAT for strategic health imports and selected food industries and services, delayed utility payments for poor and middle income households, additional taxes for public sector workers (to help fund the response), and expanded transfers for vulnerable groups…. Superfinanciera [agency that supervises financial companies] has allowed supervised entities to reprofile all loans that were less than 30 days over-due on Feb 29. These new provisions can include grace periods or extended deadlines. Banks cannot increase interest rates on loans, charge interest on interest, or report entities to credit registries for availing themselves of any forbearance measures.” Here’s the links:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200429202626/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: Since April 7 the government started implementing different transfer schemes  through different national programmes (Colombia Mayor, Ingreso Solidario and Familias en Acción) the government has delivered financial assistance to 2 million elderly individuals (with an amount of $240,000 Colombian pesos), financial assistance to 2,600,000 families (with an amount of $330,000 Colombian pesos), and financial assistance to 1,200,000 families that were not registered in previous government programmes (with an amount of $160,000 Colombian pesos). The Solidarity Income transfers replace less than 50% of the median salary. Here’s the links that explain the transfers from the national government:    http://web.archive.org/web/20200501011226/https://ingresosolidario.dnp.gov.co/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501011226/https://ingresosolidario.dnp.gov.co//web/20200501011033/https://ingresosolidario.dnp.gov.co/documentos/ETAPAS.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200429202305/https://id.presidencia.gov.co/Paginas/prensa/2020/Gobierno-Nacional-presenta-balance-sobre-entrega-ayudas-economicas-durante-Aislamiento-Preventivo-Obligatorio-200428.aspx
notes_C3: A 4-day strict quarantine is in effect since Thursday in the capital city of Bogota, which is now on "Red Alert".  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110055917/https://gestion.pe/mundo/capital-de-colombia-decreta-cuarentena-por-segunda-ola-de-covid-19-temen-presencia-de-nueva-cepa-noticia/
notes_C6: A 4-day strict quarantine is in effect since Thursday in the capital city of Bogota, which is now on "Red Alert".  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110055917/https://gestion.pe/mundo/capital-de-colombia-decreta-cuarentena-por-segunda-ola-de-covid-19-temen-presencia-de-nueva-cepa-noticia/
notes_C5: A 4-day strict quarantine is in effect since Thursday in the capital city of Bogota, which is now on "Red Alert".  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110055917/https://gestion.pe/mundo/capital-de-colombia-decreta-cuarentena-por-segunda-ola-de-covid-19-temen-presencia-de-nueva-cepa-noticia/
notes_H7: A, C:    The first stage of vaccination will be for the priority population, i.e. frontline health personnel and 100% of the population over the age of 80. This comprises about 11 million people (7.6 million over the age of 60 and 1.2 million in health personnel) and would begin in January 2021.    In phase two it will focus on vaccination of 100% of the population from 60 to 79 years old and health personnel of the second and third hotlines. This comprises about 7.19 million. While in phase three, 2.95 million people will be vaccinated; phase four, 4.91 million; and in phase five, about 17.4 million.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201221215935/https://www.larepublica.co/especiales/mis-documentos-2020/conozca-como-sera-el-plan-de-vacunacion-contra-el-covid-19-en-colombia-desde-enero-3104233

name: Comoros
notes_H6: Presidential decree makes compulsory to wear face masks in all public spaces.    Archived web: https://archive.vn/LQsYf

name: Cape Verde
notes_H1: Cap Verde ministry of health produces Coronavirus Information video and shares it on Facebook (presumably also airing it on other media / in schools etc.); https://web.archive.org/web/20200514153616/https://www.facebook.com/ministeriodasaude.cv/posts/2467699946827763
notes_H3: Contacts traced for all positive cases. https://web.archive.org/web/20200716103342/http://www.capeverdetips.co.uk/news-cape-verde/cape-verde-flight-ban-and-news-links-17th-march-2020
notes_H2: Since May 12th mass actions of rapid tests in the population have been carried out: the National Director of Health, Artur Correia, "stressed that within the scope of the rapid testing massification activities that the health authorities have been carrying out - for two weeks - around 3500 rapid tests have already been carried out, covering some neighborhoods of the capital, which allowed some positive cases to be detected early through the PCR laboratory test. According to the National Director of Health, the fact of obtaining early diagnoses will allow to act proactively and faster, preventing the spread of the epidemic".    https://web.archive.org/web/20200527200013/https://www.governo.cv/garantia-seguros-disponibiliza-4000-testes-rapidos-para-ajudar-no-diagnostico-da-covid-19/    https://web.archive.org/web/20200527200125/https://www.governo.cv/ministro-da-saude-faz-balanco-positivo-da-visita-que-fez-hoje-ao-terreno-e-deixa-alerta-o-teste-nao-e-vacina-contra-covid-19/
notes_C7: For all inter-island travel you’ll need to present a COVID-19 test done in the last 72 hours before you travel. You’ll also need to complete an online health surveillance form before you board.    Tests are available locally at health centres and cost 1,000 CV Escudos (around £8-£10). You can also have the test done at a private laboratory. Make sure the fee you pay includes the test, the test results and a health declaration.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201102045453/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cape-verde/coronavirus
notes_C8: "Effective Monday, October 12, commercial flights and international maritime transportation of passengers resumed operation.  Travelers entering Cabo Verde must present results of a negative COVID-19 PCR-RT test that was administered within 72 hours of departure to gain entry to Cabo Verde.  Children under age seven are exempt from presenting a COVID-19 PCR-RT test result."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201020120212/https://cv.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: Taking into account the country's epidemiological situation, the government, through Resolution No. 169/2020 of December 14, published a set of new measures to prevent the spread of SARS-CoV-2.    Among the measures, there is the extension of the calamity situation on the island of Fogo, contingency situation on the island and Santiago and its extension on the other islands of the archipelago.    As part of the Christmas and New Year festivities, gatherings in private homes should take place in the intra-family context, preferably between cohabitants, not exceeding 15 people.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210103194659/https://covid19.cv/governo-aprova-resolucao-que-prorroga-a-situacao-de-calamidade-na-ilha-do-fogo-e-situacao-de-contingencia-em-santiago-e-demais-ilhas-2/
notes_C1: The Government of Cape Verde has decided to continue with online classes and delay the beginning of in-person classes in the capital city, Praia, until at least October 31, due to the evolution of the epidemiological situation.     Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201021215847/https://www.noticiasaominuto.com/mundo/1596255/salas-de-aula-em-cabo-verde-obrigadas-a-fechar-com-dois-casos-positivos
notes_H6: The use of a face covering is mandatory in enclosed spaces (supermarkets, shops, health centers, banks, schools, public services, airports and port, restaurants, public transport). Face coverings are also mandatory outdoors where social distancing cannot be maintained.      People who are practicing individual physical activity are exempt from this obligation to use masks, as long as they respect social distance and respiratory etiquette. Children under 10 years old, people with cognitive developmental disabilities or mental disorders are also exempt.    Anyone in violation of the law may be subject to a fine up to 15,000 CVE.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210105002414/https://covid19.cv/o-uso-de-mascaras-em-todos-os-locais-publicos-incluindo-via-publica-passa-a-ser-obrigatorio/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210103205242/https://cv.usembassy.gov/covid-19-tests-no-longer-needed-for-inter-island-travel-from-santiago-but-required-from-fogo-maio-sao-vicente-and-santo-antao/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210104234336/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cape-verde/coronavirus
notes_C2: Taking into account the country's epidemiological situation, the government, through Resolution No. 169/2020 of December 14, published a set of new measures to prevent the spread of SARS-CoV-2.    Among the measures, there is the extension of the calamity situation on the island of Fogo, contingency situation on the island and Santiago and its extension on the other islands of the archipelago.    The facilities are kept closed and recreational, cultural, sports and leisure activities are prohibited throughout the country. The opening hours of establishments that consume alcoholic beverages can go until 11:59 pm, on the islands in a contingency situation, and until 9:59 pm, on the islands in a calamity situation.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210103194659/https://covid19.cv/governo-aprova-resolucao-que-prorroga-a-situacao-de-calamidade-na-ilha-do-fogo-e-situacao-de-contingencia-em-santiago-e-demais-ilhas-2/
notes_E2: No policy change
notes_E1: Prime Minister announces a set of measures aimed at families that are economically dependent on informal work and who, due to the crisis, lose their livelihoods, and have no alternative to daily income.    It guarantees the attribution of Social Inclusion Income to 8,000 families in extreme poverty (10,000 escudos a month), and immediate food assistance is also guaranteed to 22,500 families, corresponding to about 90,000 people, whose income is below the minimum wage or without any source of income.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200716114342/https://www.governo.cv/medidas-ao-setor-informal-asseguram-as-necessidades-basicas-da-alimentacao-do-acesso-a-saude-do-rendimento-familiar-e-de-cuidados-primeiro-ministro/
notes_C3: From March 16, the government declared contingency situation and restricts public events with large gatherings of people.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200426210315/https://www.governo.cv/declarada-situacao-de-contingencia-em-todo-o-territorio-nacional/    "No dia 16 de março de 2020, o Governo declara a situação de Contingência, para todo o território nacional, com a adoção das seguintes medidas de carácter excepcional: f) Restrição à realização de eventos públicos que reúnam número significativo de participantes, em espaços abertos ou fechados, independentemente da sua natureza"
notes_C6: Social distancing measures are in force in Cape Verde, and the wearing of non-surgical masks is mandatory in enclosed public spaces, such as supermarkets, schools, restaurants, and public transport. Over-65s and those with chronic medical conditions are required to wear surgical masks at all times when outside their homes. Public gatherings are banned except for religious ceremonies such as funerals, with the latter being restricted to 20 people in attendance. Restaurants, cafes, and bars have been limited to 50 percent capacity. The government has declared that it is a civic duty to remain at home and only go outside for essential purposes, such as shopping for essential items, to seek medical care, exercise, and to work if unable to do so from home.
notes_C5: As the economy is re-opening, it is expected that public transport has re-opened.   From June 3, inter-island travel by sea has been permitted between all islands, except Santiago, provided those wishing to travel have been granted a permit from the National Civil Protection Service. The permit will be granted following a negative COVID-19 test. Travel to and from Santiago island is expected to resume from June 30, as are domestic inter-island flights. Cape Verde's borders remain closed, and international flights are suspended indefinitely.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200806203839/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/348566/cape-verde-authorities-announce-easing-of-travel-restrictions-june-3-update-5

name: Costa Rica
notes_H1: Since February 3rd, Ministry of health has been communicating on response and prevention measures - https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.ministeriodesalud.go.cr/index.php/centro-de-prensa/noticias/741-noticias-2020/1532-lineamientos-nacionales-para-la-vigilancia-de-la-infeccion-por-coronavirus-2019-ncov;  Daily briefings were active as of 24 April: https://web.archive.org/web/20200426074949/https://www.ministeriodesalud.go.cr/index.php/centro-de-prensa/noticias/741-noticias-2020/1532-lineamientos-nacionales-para-la-vigilancia-de-la-infeccion-por-coronavirus-2019-ncov
notes_H3: On 9 July, the WHO declared Costa Rica as one of the new countries entering the "Community transmission" phase of the COVID-19 pandemic. At this stage, contact tracing efforts are more difficult to maintain. On the week of 6 July, in more than 60% of the registered cases in the country, it was not possible to investigate the epidemiological links due to the collapse of the tracking systems, given the large number of infections being registered.    http://archive.fo/2I9qF
notes_H2: https://web.archive.org/web/20200411111628/https://www.ministeriodesalud.go.cr/sobre_ministerio/prensa/docs/lineamientos_coronavirus_2020.pdf
notes_C7: Vehicular restrictions are in place according to the US Embassy in Costa Rica from 7 pm on December 31 until 5 am on January 1, 2021. The restrictions will continue into Jan 1, 2, and 3rd from 8 pm until 5 am. "Emergency vehicles, registered taxis, and tourists with verified hotel reservations traveling to and from their hotel are exempt from the restriction. Public transportation will continue to operate normally."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210102220556/https://cr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Residents from all countries and all U.S. States will be allowed to enter starting November 1.  To enter, visitors will need to complete an online epidemiological form and carry specified travel insurance. A quarantine period is not required for tourists when entering. COVID-19 tests are also NO LONGER required (since October 26).     https://web.archive.org/web/20201101081718/https://www.twoweeksincostarica.com/costa-rica-coronavirus/
notes_C4: With the new measures implemented from 1 August, private gatherings are allowed in places of worship with mandatory use of a face mask, and a maximum occupancy capacity of 75 people. This number of people does not include the staff of the place (which must be the minimum), with distance measures of 1.8 meters respecting social bubbles.    Event rooms for activities of a maximum of 30 people (with seating separation measures of at least 1.8 meters, respecting social bubbles, and with lists of attendees with an identification number and contact number). The 30 people should include the event logistics staff and guests.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200806161050/https://www.elmundo.cr/costa-rica/estas-son-las-nuevas-medidas-que-regiran-a-partir-del-1-de-agosto/
notes_C1: "Suspend classes, both public and private schools and INA training centers, from March 17 to April 4, inclusive. Given that Semana Santa (April 5 to 12) the educations centers would be normally closed, schools will re-open on April 13.": https://web.archive.org/web/20200407173551/https://qcostarica.com/costa-rica-declares-national-emergency-bans-arrival-of-foreigners-and-closed-schools/
notes_H6: Facial coverings are required in all public spaces and in all indoor settings except when eating, while alone, or in a private home.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201116065025/https://cr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: Bars and casinos are allowed to open since October 5. The reopening of new businesses will be decided in the following days. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201006030357/https://www.infobae.com/america/agencias/2020/10/05/autoridades-de-costa-rica-anuncian-la-reapertura-de-bares-y-casinos/
notes_E2: Presidential directive asks to restore water services that have been suspended due to late payment and to reschedule payments if necessary for two months.  /web/20200501232649/https://www.elmundo.cr/costa-rica/lista-directriz-que-evita-cortes-de-agua-a-morosos-y-reestablece-suspensiones-por-falta-de-pago/
notes_E1: Bono Proteger, a three-month temporary financial aid that will be provided to people affected by the COVID-19 health emergency.    The amount of the Protect Bonus will depend on each particular situation. Those fired, with a suspended employment contract, with a workday reduced by 50% or more, independent and informal workers whose application has been approved will receive a bonus of ¢ 125 thousand per month for 3 months. Meanwhile, for those who suffered a reduction in their working hours by 50% or less, the amount will be ¢ 62,500 per month, for the same period.      The Government intends to allocate ¢ 296 billion for this program. With this amount, it is expected to help 612,000 people, as well as 68,000 households in poverty, for an approximate total of 680,000 beneficiaries.    /web/20200501233235/https://www.presidencia.go.cr/comunicados/2020/04/gobierno-lanza-bono-proteger-para-personas-trabajadoras-afectadas-por-covid-19/
notes_C3: mass events and football games cancelled: https://web.archive.org/web/20200407173315/https://www.voanoticias.com/a/costa-rica-coronavirus-cancel-eventos-/5322312.html
notes_C6: More restrictions for Easter, with the statement from President Alvarado: “Stay at home. Protect yourself. Follow protocols, and protect our country. Together, we can move forward from this.”  On 2 April, Ministry of Health also released a statement asking people to stay at home during Easter.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200617205610/https://ticotimes.net/2020/04/01/costa-rica-enacting-strict-measures-during-semana-santa-country-adds-28-new-coronavirus-cases
notes_C5: https://web.archive.org/web/20200510090547/https://www.ministeriodesalud.go.cr/sobre_ministerio/prensa/docs/lineamientos_generales_transporte_version_5_19032020.pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20200510090657/https://www.presidencia.go.cr/comunicados/2020/04/gobierno-avanza-en-medidas-para-el-servicio-de-transporte-publico-ante-emergencia-del-covid-19/
notes_H7: The current vaccine groups are as follows for Costa Rica, and the first vaccine shots have started becoming administered. Tico Times reports that the vaccine is free but not mandatory for citizens.   """    Staff and residents at retirement or nursing homes.  First responders, including health personnel.  Costa Rica’s older population, defined here as those ages 58 and up.  People with risk factors, including hypertension, diabetes, heart disease, respiratory illness, kidney disease and obesity, among others.  Teachers and other staff within the Education Ministry (MEP).  Imprisoned people and judicial staff.  Workers for the 911 service.  Health science students and related technicians in clinical fields.  People ages 40-57 without any of the aforementioned risk factors but whose work puts them in contact with others. This includes laborers in agriculture, construction, service industries, etc.  """    https://web.archive.org/web/20201231091456/https://ticotimes.net/2020/12/29/costa-rica-reports-no-adverse-effects-after-first-vaccine-shot

name: Cuba
notes_H1: "On January 28, the Cuban government announced the formulation of an interagency working group to direct host government response to COVID-19 chaired by the Ministry of Public Health (MINSAP)." Archived Source: /web/20200406214929/https://cu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: In the new protocol (May) it is stated that contacts from suspect cases will be admitted to an isolation centre for 14 days (see pages 13 and 15, 2.1.3) https://web.archive.org/web/20200514191153/http://files.sld.cu/editorhome/files/2020/05/MINSAP_Protocolo-de-Actuaci%25C3%25B3n-Nacional-para-la-COVID-19_versi%25C3%25B3n-1.4_mayo-2020.pdf  Also, in the daily report by the Ministry of Health, the new cases are individually identified, and the number of contacts being monitored for each of them is recorded. https://web.archive.org/save/https://salud.msp.gob.cu/?p=5248
notes_H2: No policy change
notes_C7: Travel and transport within each Province varies according to the measures in place. The suspension of inter-provincial transport was lifted on 19 October 2020. The current exceptions are to/from Sancti Spiritus and Pinar del Rio. Any change in the situation in a province or municipality may mean inter-provincial or municipal transport links also change.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201201181436/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cuba/coronavirus
notes_C8: The island, [...] again restricted travelers from the United States, Mexico, Panama, the Dominican Republic, the Bahamas and Haiti on January 1st.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210115203138/https://www.infobae.com/america/america-latina/2021/01/14/la-habana-limitara-el-transporte-publico-y-cerrara-las-escuelas-para-contener-el-avance-del-coronavirus/
notes_C4: See Art.3 and 10. https://web.archive.org/web/20200514152223/https://www.gacetaoficial.gob.cu/sites/default/files/goc-2020-ex25.pdf  Before mother's day the president insisted on the importance of respecting social distancing measures. https://web.archive.org/web/20200514155915/http://www.cuba.cu/sociedad/2020-05-09/felicita-diaz-canel-a-las-madres-de-cuba-e-insiste-en-la-disciplina-con-el-distanciamiento-social/51595
notes_C1: Authorities in the Cuban capital announced that from this Thursday schools, bars and restaurants will close and that public transport will be suspended at night, a measure seeking to contain a recent coronavirus regrowth, an official medium reported Wednesday.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210115203138/https://www.infobae.com/america/america-latina/2021/01/14/la-habana-limitara-el-transporte-publico-y-cerrara-las-escuelas-para-contener-el-avance-del-coronavirus/
notes_H6: Wearing a mask has become compulsory in public since at least 9 August.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200817201904/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cuba/coronavirus
notes_C2: Cuba is strengthening its measures after a peak in coronavirus cases  https://web.archive.org/web/20210109193328/https://www.prensa-latina.cu/index.php?o=rn&id=422571&SEO=cuba-refuerza-medidas-tras-repunte-de-contagios-con-covid-19
notes_E2: The collection of electricity, water and gas services is postponed. The monthly billing will remain in force with the same rates but payments will be deferred without penalty or cut of services.  In addition, the collection of fines for the government is temporarily suspended, extending the deadline. Due to the pandemic, the established surcharges will not be applied when the fine is not paid in the established period.   /web/20200503181135/https://www.cibercuba.com/noticias/2020-04-09-u157374-e157374-s27061-gobierno-cuba-aplaza-pago-facturas-luz-agua-gas
notes_E1: The Ministry of Work and Social Security established that workers who are in the high risk group due to their age or comorbidities, or workers who cannot be reallocated during the pandemic, should perceive 100% of their salary during the first month and 60% while measures against covid are in place.   See: Actualizacion de medidas aprobadas por el Gobierno" (30/4/20). 2-4 and 7. http://web.archive.org/web/20200514215725/http://www.mtss.gob.cu/  The Ministry of Finance established that the payments for workers wages have to be assumed by the entity to which they belong, with their own financial resources. Only if the entity cannot afford to cover wages, it can apply for Government support. (not the workers individually).   See Gaceta Oficial - NORMAS DEL MINISTERIO DE FINANZAS Y PRECIOS RELATIVAS AL ENFRENTAMIENTO DE LA COVID-19. Resolucion No. 148/2020, Art 3 and 4.
notes_C3: "Large gatherings and events are also suspended . Some are postponed or resized, and even the International Tourism Fair is suspended, which will be held when appropriate."  Archived Source: /web/20200406225645/http://www.cubadebate.cu/noticias/2020/03/20/gobierno-cubano-informa-nuevas-medidas-para-el-enfrentamiento-a-la-covid-19-video/
notes_C6: Cuba is strengthening its measures after a peak in coronavirus cases  https://web.archive.org/web/20210109193328/https://www.prensa-latina.cu/index.php?o=rn&id=422571&SEO=cuba-refuerza-medidas-tras-repunte-de-contagios-con-covid-19
notes_C5: Authorities in the Cuban capital announced that from this Thursday schools, bars and restaurants will close and that public transport will be suspended at night, a measure seeking to contain a recent coronavirus regrowth, an official medium reported Wednesday.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210115203138/https://www.infobae.com/america/america-latina/2021/01/14/la-habana-limitara-el-transporte-publico-y-cerrara-las-escuelas-para-contener-el-avance-del-coronavirus/

name: Cyprus
notes_H1: Date for start of information campaigns is unavailable. From this link, it could be gathered that the information campaign began from March 5: http://www.ucy.ac.cy/hr/en/covid-19-action-plan#Q-A  List of Public information campaigns: https://www.pio.gov.cy/coronavirus/en/info.html
notes_H3: Comprehensive testing https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.financialmirror.com/2020/04/22/covid19-cyprus-fighting-the-virus-through-contact-tracing/
notes_H2: Eligible to get tested are people who work in the public and wider public sector and the local government with priority being given to those who serve the public. It also includes the National Guard, police and fire service.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200430095651/https://cyprus-mail.com/2020/04/11/coronavirus-testing-begins-on-20000-workers-who-serve-the-public/  https://cyprus-mail.com/2020/04/11/coronavirus-testing-begins-on-20000-workers-who-serve-the-public/
notes_C7: From 5am on 10 January, until at least midnight on 31 January, all outings from your place of residence require permission granted either by sending an SMS to “8998” from a Cypriot mobile number, or by completing and carrying a written form if you do not have a Cypriot phone number (or are over 65 and prefer this method). You are also required to carry official identification at all times.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201214091800/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cyprus/coronavirus
notes_C8: The 3rd phase of reopening Cyprus started on 9 June. This included the re-opening of airports and ports. Flights to and from a 13 countries have resumed with flights to and from an additional 6 countries to resume as of 20 june. If persons test positive for Coronavirus after visiting, the Cypriot government will reimburse the travel costs. Initially all travellers will need to show proof of a negative COVID-19 test undertaken within 72 hours of travel, but from June 20, only those arriving from six countries in the second category, such as Poland and Romania, will need to do so.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200610194818/https://www.schengenvisainfo.com/news/cyprus-to-reopen-its-borders-for-several-eu-schengen-nationals-in-two-phases/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200610192955/https://www.pio.gov.cy/en/press-releases-article.html?id=14067  http://web.archive.org/web/20200610194633/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-06/04/c_139111920.htm
notes_C4: Restrictions back to normal after New Year's Eve - i.e. meetings other than two persons are prohibited.
notes_C1: High school and university students will complete the rest of the month’s lessons on line, while kindergartens and elementary schools will remain open, with virologists saying the infection risk among younger age groups is far lower.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201214092331/https://www.financialmirror.com/2020/12/09/covid19-elderly-deaths-a-concern-as-cyprus-opts-for-stricter-measures/
notes_H6: https://web.archive.org/web/20201214091800/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cyprus/coronavirus
notes_C2: From 10th Jan only essential shops are allowed to open  https://web.archive.org/web/20201214091800/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cyprus/coronavirus
notes_E2: Quote: Moving to give hard-pressed tenants a temporary respite, the Council of Ministers on Thursday approved a bill suspending evictions until May 31 for non-payment of rent. The bill will cover non-payment of rent after March 1.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200615214036/https://in-cyprus.philenews.com/coronavirus-freeze-on-evictions-for-non-payment-of-rent-until-may-31/
notes_E1: https://web.archive.org/web/20200515020204/https://www.activpayroll.com/news-articles/cyprus-covid-19-measures-for-small-and-medium-sized-businesses
notes_C3: changing back the indicator from Nov 12th based on:  on an island-wide basis for the period 12 - 30 November 2020:  - The holding of conferences, trade and visual exhibitions, assemblies and events is not allowed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201129162131/https://www.pio.gov.cy/coronavirus/uploads/11112020_YpYgeias_ENGLISH_revised.pdf
notes_C6: From 5am on 10 January, until at least midnight on 31 January, all outings from your place of residence require permission granted either by sending an SMS to “8998” from a Cypriot mobile number, or by completing and carrying a written form if you do not have a Cypriot phone number (or are over 65 and prefer this method). You are also required to carry official identification at all times.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201214091800/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cyprus/coronavirus
notes_C5: Following a decision by the Ministry of Transport, Communications and Works, as of 9 June, public transport (Cyprus only has buses and taxis) can ride with 100% fully capacity inside the buses. Since March the buses were only allowed to carry maximum 30% capacity (increased to 50% in May). The wearing of masks is obligatory.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200709114147/https://www.intercity-buses.com/?wp=news-details&id=1C88B7DCABFD13B13AE1D1FBDA910967&id=1C88B7DCABFD13B13AE1D1FBDA910967
notes_H7: over 80's and care home residents from 8th Jan  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118135336/https://www.financialmirror.com/2021/01/04/covid19-cyprus-launches-general-vaccination-rollout/

name: Czech Republic
notes_H1: Czech ministry of health starts information campaign with daily updates and extends Coronavirus hotline to 24/7 operations in response to meeting of Central Epidemiological Commission one day prior; https://web.archive.org/web/20200510172816/https://www.mzcr.cz/dokumenty/na-ministerstvu-zdravotnictvi-zasedla-kvuli-koronaviru-ustredni-epidemiologicka-_18596_1.html; https://web.archive.org/web/20200228210141/https:/twitter.com/ZdravkoOnline/status/1233495618913521672; https://web.archive.org/web/20200228210537/https://twitter.com/ZdravkoOnline/status/1233496226869514241
notes_H3: Infected are isolated in infectious clinics, and hygienists are now conducting the necessary epidemiological investigations, including tracing all those with whom the infected have come into close contact.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200414010140/https://www.mzcr.cz/dokumenty/v-ceske-republice-jsou-prvni-tri-potvrzene-pripady-nakazy-koronavirem_18605_4107_1.html
notes_H2: Testing requirements changed on 27th March to allow anyone displaying symptoms including a fever, dry cough, or shortness of breath to be eligible for a free test.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200419112751/https://www.idnes.cz/zpravy/domaci/koronavirus-testovani-covid-19-horecka-kasel-dusnost-doporuceni-pacient-nakazeny-mrtvi.A200327_170734_domaci_rapc
notes_C7: On the 21st October, the Prime Minister announced further restrictions following an extraordinary general meeting, to come into force on the 22nd from 6am. 'The free movement of persons throughout the Czech Republic is prohibited', although there are exceptions to this ban, including:  -trips to work and in connection with business  -trips to see family  -purchase of basic necessities and trips to healthcare facilities  -to go to parks/nature  -to go to holiday cottages if staying there  https://web.archive.org/web/20201027225925/https://koronavirus.mzcr.cz/en/government-decides-to-further-tighten-preventive-measures-against-the-spread-of-covid-19
notes_C8: As of 14 April, travelling abroad for "essential activities" will be allowed. This will include business trips, the assembly of a production facility, a visit to a doctor or to a relative. Each trip will be followed by 14 days of obligatory quarantine on return.    As of Monday April 27, the rules for crossing state borders have been changed. EU citizens arriving in the Czech Republic for business purposes and university students from EU countries may now come to the Czech Republic. Czech citizens are able to travel abroad, however on their return they must submit to  14 days’ quarantine or provide a test with a negative Covid-19 result.    As of Monday 11 May, the current rules for border crossing will be relaxed. All citizens will be able to cross the state border at selected border crossings, which were previously used only by commuters. Railway corridors to Germany and Austria will also be functional.    As of 26 May, the regime at the state borders will be eased. EU citizens and foreigners with the status of a long-term resident in EU Member State will be able to enter the Czech Republic in order to perform economic activities, to visit relatives or to study at a university. Everyone will have to prove themselves with a negative test for covid-19 upon entry.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200715165336/https://www.vlada.cz/en/media-centrum/aktualne/measures-adopted-by-the-czech-government-against-coronavirus-180545/
notes_C4: "mass events indoors up to 10 participants  mass outdoor events for up to 20 participants"    http://web.archive.org/web/20201008121940/https://koronavirus.mzcr.cz/aktualni-opatreni/
notes_C1: On December 21 and 22, all children attending elementary and secondary schools, conservatories, higher vocational schools, elementary art schools, language schools etc. will be off school. These days will be added to the Christmas holiday (ends January 3rd).   https://web.archive.org/web/20210101112055/https://koronavirus.mzcr.cz/en/the-government-has-decided-that-stricter-4th-tier-pandemic-measures-will-start-to-apply-on-friday-affected-businesses-will-be-helped-by-compensations/
notes_H6: The Ministry of Health announced that protective respiratory equipment such as a mask, scarf or other facial covering over the nose and mouth is required when stepping outside of the home.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201120194050/https://koronavirus.mzcr.cz/vlada-navrhne-prodlouzeni-nouzoveho-stavu-do-20-prosince-minimalni-mzda-se-ma-zvysit-o-600-korun/
notes_C2: As of the 18th of December, all bars, restaurants, zoos, museums, swimming pools and other indoor sports facilities will be closed. Shops and services can remain open if they ensure there is only 1 customer per 15 square metres.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210101121028/https://www.vlada.cz/en/media-centrum/aktualne/measures-adopted-by-the-czech-government-against-coronavirus-180545/
notes_E2: The companies as employers will be able to pay social insurance premiums in the amount of 24.8 % of wages for May, June, and July 2020 until October 20, 2020. The employers are still obliged to pay employee health insurance premiums in the amount of 6.5 % of wages. However, there is an obligation to pay a lower penalty of 0,01 % of the debt per day (this is a reduced penalty from a regular amount of 0.05 % of debt per day). Employers do not have to pay a penalty that does not exceed 1,000 CZK. The law entered into force recently.  https://news.expats.cz/prague-business/important-news-for-small-business-owners-impacted-by-coronavirus-closures-in-the-czech-republic/
notes_E1: Shareholders of small limited liability company (spolecnost s rucením omezeným) will be able to apply for a compensation bonus, currently, a one-time assistance provided at request for the period from March 12, 2020 to June 8, 2020 in the amount of CZK 500 per day. A shareholder can thus receive support up to CZK 44,500.
notes_C3: Public events can hold but a limit of 300 participants    https://koronavirus.mzcr.cz/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/123_EM_events_more-than-300-people_19052020.pdf
notes_C6: From the 3rd of November, third wave PES measures come into place. With the lifting of the night time curfew and opening of non-essential retail sectors, sports facilities, and allowing gatherings indoors, it is implied the shelter in place measures have been lifted.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201122224731/https://www.vlada.cz/en/media-centrum/aktualne/measures-adopted-by-the-czech-government-against-coronavirus-180545/
notes_H7: A, C:    Vaccination in Czech Republic began on the 27th of December. Healthcare workers and senior citizens will be prioritised. The vaccine used currently is the Pfizer/BioNTech inoculation.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210101213613/https://covid.gov.cz/en/situations/infection-and-general-measures/when-we-will-have-vaccine

name: Germany
notes_H1: German health ministry cooperates with Helmholtz Institut to produce series of videos on Coronavirus, including how to protect oneself from Coronavirus; https://web.archive.org/web/20200212103102/https:/twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227538838140047361, https://twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227535818237063168, https://twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227536321473761282, https://twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227536825000103936, https://twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227537328261881856, https://twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227537831473664000, https://twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227538838140047361, https://twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227540851389276166
notes_H3: Amid a decline in total caseload, RKI updates its guidelines and re-iniates more comprehensive contact tracing, including for individuals travelling by plane. RKI now differentiates contacts into three different categories (I,II,III) with close contacts (I) always being traced and ordered to isolate (with 14-day observation by health authorities) and medium contacts (II) being recommended certain preventative actions. Given that category I is quite extensive (all individuals with at least 15 mins of contact) and previous concerns about staffing are reduced to the lower number of cases, the coding is upgraded to 2 as the most likely fit.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200615203230/https://www.rki.de/DE/Content/InfAZ/N/Neuartiges_Coronavirus/Kontaktperson/Management.html
notes_H2: Tests are generally available.  The event here is the availability of a drive-through by a private practice in Berlin.  Other screening centers were available before this date.
