From public radio on April 29 2020: "Not only Berlin health authorities have set up test stations outdoors, a private doctor's office in Mitte will also offer corona tests via drive-in from Wednesday. "  http://web.archive.org/web/20200528140251/https://www.rbb24.de/panorama/thema/2020/coronavirus/beitraege_neu/2020/04/coronavirus-schnelltest-bluttest-corona-test-berlin-mitte.html
notes_C7: From the 5th of January, residents in hotspot districts (more than 200 per 100,000 cases) are not permitted to travel more than 15 km from their town without a valid reason. Day trips are not classified a valid reason.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210106175200/https://www.dw.com/en/coronavirus-germany-extends-covid-lockdown-until-january-31/a-56134498
notes_C8: In a press release of 13 May 2020, changes in the border regime were announced (see http://web.archive.org/web/20200528130558/https://www.bmi.bund.de/SharedDocs/pressemitteilungen/EN/2020/05/changes-in-the-border-regime.html) including    -"Restrictions at land borders will be relaxed. All cross-border traffic routes will be reopened. Checks will no longer be systematic, but rather flexible and risk-based"... "While travellers will still need a valid reason for entering Germany, more allowances will be made for travel for family-related and personal reasons.  -"Checks at the border with Luxembourg will end at midnight on 15 May 2020"  -"Regarding the EU’s external borders, the European Commission has recommended continuing restrictions on entry from non-EU countries until 15 June 2020. Germany is following this recommendation."  -" A 14-day quarantine should be ordered in future only for travellers entering Germany from countries outside of the EU."
notes_C4: Restrictions are now in place across the country, limiting the max of people meeting to be 2 households.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201101062313/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/975226/1805024/5353edede6c0125ebe5b5166504dfd79/2020-10-28-mpk-beschluss-corona-data.pdf?download=1
notes_C1: New Lockdown in place, starting on December 15th, provisional running until January 10th.    Contacts in schools, too, are to be drastically reduced between 16 December 2020 and 10 January  2021. During this period, children should be kept at home wherever possible. For this reason, all  schools will be closed or waive the obligation to attend during this period. Emergency childcare  services will be provided and remote learning offered. Special arrangements can be made for final  year classes. Nurseries will proceed similarly. Additional options will be created for parents to take  paid leave to look after their children during this period    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214202434/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1827686/e97802de12b5f6e60f41b73234e618b7/2020-12-14-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1
notes_C2: New Lockdown in place, starting on December 15th, provisional running until January 10th.    Retail shops will close from 16 December 2020 until 10 January 2021, with the exception of  grocery stores, open-air food markets, direct marketers of food products, food collection and delivery services, beverage shops, health food shops, specialist baby shops, pharmacies, medical supply stores, drugstores, opticians, hearing aid shops, petrol stations, garages, bicycle workshops, banks and savings banks, post offices, dry cleaning services, launderettes, newsagents, pet supply shops, animal feed shops, the sale of Christmas trees and wholesalers. The sale in grocery stores of non-food products that are not related to daily needs can also be restricted and must on no account be extended. There will be a blanket ban on the sale of fireworks before New Year’s Eve this year.    Businesses offering personal care services such as hairdressers, beauty salons, masseurs, tattoo  parlours and similar establishments will be closed, because physical proximity is unavoidable in these professions. Necessary medical treatments, such as physiotherapy, occupational therapy and speech therapy, as well as podiatry and chiropody, will still be permitted.    Employers are urgently requested to explore the possibility of either closing workplaces  completely holidays or offering employees generous opportunities to work from home from  16 December 2020 to 10 January 2021 in order to implement the principle of “We are staying at  home” throughout Germany.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214202434/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1827686/e97802de12b5f6e60f41b73234e618b7/2020-12-14-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1
notes_E2: Known measures terminated on 1 July 2020.      "Payment arrears from April 1 to June 30, 2020 do not entitle the landlord to terminate the contract for a period of 24 months. This limitation applies to cases where the backlog is due to the effects of the corona pandemic. The regulation is limited to the period from April 1 to June 30, 2020. ... These expired on July 1, 2020 and will not be extended. It has been shown that tenants and landlords were able to agree on a private basis in very many cases. For small businesses and solo self-employed, there were or are emergency aids and bridging aids, which can be used to offset operating costs such as rent or lease."    "The deferral of payments for consumer loan contracts and livelihood contracts such as telephone, electricity and gas expired on July 1, 2020."    (http://web.archive.org/web/20200619200735/https://www.bundesregierung.de/breg-de/themen/coronavirus/corona-informationen-miete-verbraucherschutz-1734914)
notes_E1: The measures mean that some sectors of the economy will still have to face significant restrictions on their business operations in the coming year. The Federal Government will therefore continue to provide financial support for the affected companies, self-employed individuals and selfemployed members of the independent professions. The improved interim financial help III package, which envisages subsidies for fixed costs, is available to this end. With improved conditions, in particular a higher monthly subsidy of up to a maximum of 500,000 euro for companies directly and indirectly affected by the closures, the Federal Government is doing what it can to safeguard businesses and employment.  Other than that, regular unemployment insurance is mandatory for all German workers, with 60% income replacement for 6-12 months following unemployment (depending on how long the individual was working in a formal job in the previous 36 months (24/36 months -> 12 months of 60% replacement, 12/36 months > 6 months). Only if individual was not working for more than 12 months in the previous three years, ALG II (fixed rate of 432€/month + other costs such as rents or heating) gets paid out instead.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201214202434/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1827686/e97802de12b5f6e60f41b73234e618b7/2020-12-14-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1
notes_C3: All states have banned social events, gatherings: "Meetings of small groups in public spaces are prohibited in all states"  https://web.archive.org/web/20200723095642/https://www.tagesschau.de/inland/laender-corona-103.html
notes_C6: New Lockdown in place, starting on December 15th, provisional running until January 10th.    The Federal Government and the Länder urgently appeal to all citizens to avoid all non-essential  movement and recommend to stay at home.    Individual federal states also impose specific exit restrictions. For example, in the southern states in particular, leaving the home is only permitted if there are valid reasons for doing so (sports, shopping, doctor's appointments, etc.). Local night-time curfew restrictions apply, which generally prohibit leaving the home except in emergencies.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214202434/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1827686/e97802de12b5f6e60f41b73234e618b7/2020-12-14-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1    https://web.archive.org/web/20201218085536/https://www.corona-katastrophenschutz.bayern.de/faq/index.php    https://web.archive.org/web/20201218085159/https://www.bundesregierung.de/breg-de/themen/coronavirus/corona-massnahmen-1734724
notes_C5: The federal and state governments call for unnecessary travel to be avoided in general. This also includes unnecessary journeys in public transport. Please wear an everyday mask on the S-Bahn and trains, in the train station, on the platform and at the stops as well as on the airport premises and on the plane. The minimum distance of 1.5 meters to travelers and staff should always be observed. Deutsche Bahn provides many tips on safe travel on its website. Unnecessary queues, e.g. B. in front of the on-board toilet can be avoided. The respective national hygiene regulations apply when getting on and off and at the airports. In general, please adhere to the rules of conduct that are summarized in the AHA formula (distance, hygiene rules, everyday mask). In this way, everyone can make a contribution while traveling to contain the spread of the new type of coronavirus. This formula is supplemented by A for app (the Corona warning app helps to break chains of infection) and L for ventilation.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207220918/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/informieren/alltag-gestalten/
notes_H7: Germany begins vaccinating on 27 December.      The government has said the over-80s and health care workers will be treated first.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210106172121/https://www.dw.com/en/covid-german-regulations-on-who-gets-vaccine-first/a-55987647

name: Djibouti
notes_H1: The objectives are to provide intersectoral coordination; strengthen surveillance, laboratory confirmation and reporting; take preventive and precautionary measures; correctly detect and treat suspect, probable and confirmed cases; limit the transmission of COVID-19 in the event of cases or epidemic clusters at country level, in particular by reducing secondary infections; and communicate the necessary information on the risks of the disease to the community as well as fight against misinformation.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201113133151/http://www.emro.who.int/media/news/djibouti-joins-global-action-to-prevent-covid-19-as-first-case-is-confirmed-in-the-country.html
notes_H3: https://web.archive.org/web/20200416143208/http://www.sante.gouv.dj/Covid-19%20%20FINI.pdf  Explanation such as following indicates policy on contact tracing: "Close contact is a person who, starting 24 hours before the onset of symptoms of a confirmed case, shared the same place of life (for example: family, same room) or had direct contact with him, face to face, within 1 meter of the case and / or for more 15 minutes during a discussion; flirt; close friends; class or office neighbors; neighbors of the case in a prolonged means of transport; person providing care of a confirmed case or laboratory staff handling samples biology of a confirmed case, in the absence of adequate means of protection."
notes_H2: https://web.archive.org/web/20210104112225/https://dj.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  COVID-19 Testing:      The Government of Djibouti offers COVID-19 tests at Bouffard Hospital. While the test itself is free, a negative COVID-19 test certificate costs 5,000 Fdj or $30.
notes_C7: Restrictions gradually being eased. https://web.archive.org/web/20200604203136/https://reliefweb.int/report/djibouti/republic-djibouti-covid-19-situation-report-7-10-may-2020
notes_C8: The Republic of Djibouti will reopen its air traffic on 17 July. According to the Government spokesperson, measures to prevent the transmission of COVID-19 will be taken within the airport, including systematic testing of passengers on arrival. The government will also work with neighboring countries to reopen land borders to allow Djiboutians to travel in the region during the summer.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200720204058/https://reliefweb.int/report/djibouti/iom-djibouti-covid-19-situation-report-9-12-july-2020
notes_C4: Have inferred a ban of public gatherings from the closure of all events and non essentials services with the Nation wide lockdown imposed on the 23rd March 2020.   Lockdown has been extetended to May 1, 2020.   http://archive.fo/P9CqP
notes_C1: High schools, technical and vocational schools have also reopened.    "More than 28000 general and technical and vocational students resumed this Wednesday, September 30th to school for a new 2020-2021. school year.  A school year under the sign of barriers against the spread of Covid-19...During this morning's trip, the Minister and the accompanying senior officials of his department including the Secretary General Mr. Mohamed Abdallah Mahyoub, have emphasized the barriers that will have to be scrupulously observed in all schools across the country."    http://web.archive.org/web/20201112162849/https://www.facebook.com/MENFOP.cripen/posts/1649293948577256
notes_H6: Face coverings must be worn in public and private spaces where social distancing is not possible.    Use of facial masks in all public or private spaces in which social distancing  cannot be observed is mandatory.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201028083936/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/djibouti/coronavirus    https://web.archive.org/web/20201028083548/https://www.tralac.org/documents/resources/covid-19/regional/4180-covid-19-measures-in-place-in-comesa-member-states-27th-edition-23-october-2020/file.html
notes_C2: Restaurants, nightclubs, and the movie theater at Bawadi Mall are currently open.  Hotels resumed normal operations on 30th June 2020.  Restaurants and cafes reopened on 16th June 2020 with social distancing and hygiene measures in place; Conference rooms, event halls, and cinemas are closed until 1st September 2020;    https://web.archive.org/web/20201028083548/https://www.tralac.org/documents/resources/covid-19/regional/4180-covid-19-measures-in-place-in-comesa-member-states-27th-edition-23-october-2020/file.html    https://web.archive.org/web/20201028083802/https://dj.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E1: "Article 4: During the period of partial activity, the employee receives compensation for his loss of salary up to 70% of his previous gross salary.  This compensatory compensation is financed by the State up to 30% of the gross remuneration of the employee placed in partial activity. The remaining 40% is funded by the employer. The compensation under this article must not, in any case, be less than the guaranteed minimum interprofessional wage (SMIG) provided for by law n ° 221 / AN / 17 / 8ème L amending and supplementing law n ° 133 / AN / 05 / 5th L of January 28, 2006 on the Labor Code."      http://web.archive.org/web/20201113122936/https://www.presidence.dj/texte.php?ID=2020-049&ID2=2020-04-29&ID3=Arr%EF%BF%BDt%EF%BF%BD&ID4=8&ID5=2020-04-30&ID6=n
notes_C3: Government offices and places of worship have reopened with social distancing in place.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201115085005/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/djibouti/coronavirus
notes_C6: The use of facial masks in all public or private spaces in which social distancing cannot be observed is now mandatory, so is the installation of hand-washing facilities in any public or private establishment open to the public    https://web.archive.org/web/20200604203136/https://reliefweb.int/report/djibouti/republic-djibouti-covid-19-situation-report-7-10-may-2020
notes_C5: As of 17 May, urban public transport vehicles (buses, minibuses, tricycles and taxis) will be authorized to resume their activity  https://web.archive.org/web/20200604203136/https://reliefweb.int/report/djibouti/republic-djibouti-covid-19-situation-report-7-10-may-2020

name: Dominica
notes_H1: Original:  This data point is copied from the previous contributor; I could not find a source confirming when the campaign might have started. /web/20200421013223/http://dominica.gov.dm/corona  Dowling:  Website does not have a launch date but does say "March 2020" near the footer
notes_H3: "It has been 28 days since Dominica had its last positive case. McIntrye says this is largely due to the closure of the country’s borders, effective contact tracing and isolation, an efficient primary healthcare team, the ability to have in-country testing, compliance by the public and the team effort involving all stakeholders." Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200510035220/https://dominicanewsonline.com/news/homepage/news/adjusting-restrictive-measures-does-not-mean-business-as-usual-says-health-minister/
notes_H2: According to the US Embassy in Dominica's website, The Dominican Republic has local capacity to diagnose COVID-19 through the National Public Health Laboratory and private laboratories.  The Dominican Republic created a national hotline for questions relating to COVID-19 if you have been exposed or are experiencing severe symptoms.  Call *462 for further instructions, but note that English-speaking operators are limited.    Please see:   https://web.archive.org/web/20201221134212/https://do.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/    The rapid tests are free and the PCR test costs $40. Please see:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221230041/https://discoverdominica.com/en/travel-advisory-for-dominica
notes_C7: Since businesses, shops, offices, churches, sports facilities and beauty salons are now operating normally without restriction, it could be implied that there are no longer restrictions in place. See: https://web.archive.org/web/20200706194429/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/dominica/coronavirus
notes_C8: The government has released a list of countries within the CARICOM travel bubble, low risk, medium risk, and high risk. Depending on the risk level there are different procedures that must be followed. The strictest protocol applies to those coming from high risk countries: These individuals must quarantine for 5 days and receive a PCR test on day 5, if positive they must continue quarantining.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201021161244/https://dominica.gov.dm/images/documents/Travelprotocols_Portrait_Aug25_Rev6b.pdf
notes_C4: "A maximum of 250 persons may gather together at any one time."   https://web.archive.org/web/20201205233138/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/dominica/coronavirus
notes_C1: Fully open under government safety guidance.   https://archive.vn/QR2yu
notes_H6: Required in public transportation.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201205233138/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/dominica/coronavirus  If you are healthy, you only need to wear a mask if you are taking care of a person with suspected 2019-nCoV infection.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118180555/http://dominica.gov.dm/wear-a-mask-to-protect-against-coronavirus
notes_C2: Businesses, shops, offices, churches, sports facilities and beauty salons are now operating normally without restriction, except for health protocols (physical distancing, hand sanitising, wearing face masks). Hotels and tour operators are not open in full capacity.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201205233138/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/dominica/coronavirus
notes_E2: No policy found.
notes_E1: "To mitigate the socio-economic impact authorities announced income transfers to the most vulnerable segments and tax relief programs for households and businesses." Source: https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#D
notes_C3: No restrictions found.
notes_C6: People are recommended by the Ministry of Health, Wellness and New Health Investment Response to COVID-19 to "keep the elderly home to reduce their risk of getting sick" and "limit visitors".  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118164837/http://dominica.gov.dm/tips-to-protect-self-family
notes_C5: I've seen no indication of bus closures; to the contrary, masks are required when riding the bus. Thus, I'm indicating "no measures" but would welcome seeing any reporting to the contrary, as I don't want to code this inaccurately.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201201151147/https://discoverdominica.com/en/island-transportation#:~:text=Dominica%2520has%2520a%2520reliable%2520public,%252410.25%2520according%2520the%2520specific%2520route.

name: Denmark
notes_H1: https://web.archive.org/web/20201020123535/https://coronasmitte.dk/en/entry-into-denmark
notes_H3: Press briefing by the Danish Health Authority about a man testing positive after returning from a ski trip in Italy. It was announced that contact tracing had begun to control the spread of the virus.    (source: https://www.thelocal.dk/20200227/breaking-denmark-announces-first-coronavirus-case)
notes_H2: An offensive testing strategy comprising the testing of both a cohort of healthcare staff and a cohort of the general population, the tracking and tracing of outbreaks of coronavirus and home isolation of people with coronavirus. A representative portion of the population will be tested at regular intervals based on a clear plan.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200521225925/https://politi.dk/en/coronavirus-in-denmark/controlled-reopening-of-denmark
notes_C7: The restrictions imposed in North Jutland were "significantly eased from 19 November 2020", with a few exceptions.     It seems there are no restrictions on internal movement elsewhere in the country.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201121062734/https://coronasmitte.dk/overblik
notes_C8: Citizens of all countries have been banned from entering Denmark from January 9 until January 18, as part of the country’s efforts to prevent the further spread of the Coronavirus pandemic, precisely due to the new mutation of the virus found in Britain and some other countries.    In addition, Denmark’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs has urged all its citizens to avoid travelling to other countries due to the disease’s rapid spread, SchengenVisaInfo.com reports.    The latest announcement of Denmark’s authorities clarified that the whole world would be “sharpened from being orange to red.”    Denmark’s Foreign Minister Jeppe Kofod has stressed that the new mutations of the Coronavirus pandemic, spread in several other countries pose a significant risk that Denmark’s infection rates may escalate.      “The safety and security of Danes is the government’s priority. We can see the finish line. The vaccine is here. We must not stumble on the run-up stretch. Not least in the light of the new mutations, we will have to – all of us – make an extra effort. And today’s package of travel initiatives is an expression of that,” says Foreign Minister Jeppe Kofod.    Recently Denmark announced plans to impose a digital ‘vaccine passport’ which would permit all vaccinated citizens against COVID-19 disease to travel to countries which oblige citizens to have such a document, in order to be able to enter these countries.    According to the Danish Health Ministry, the ‘vaccine passport will be rolled out in early 2021,” and all those vaccinated would be eligible to obtain the document through Denmark’s public health website.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210111123210/https://www.schengenvisainfo.com/news/denmark-temporarily-bans-from-entering-citizens-of-all-countries/    From 5:00 p.m. on 9 January 2021 through 7 February 2021, Denmark has instituted a flight ban on the transport of passengers, including Danish citizens, who are unable to present a negative COVID-19 test taken within 24 hours before departure.   https://archive.vn/eOv2R
notes_C4: On a press conference on October 23rd the prime minister announced new restrictions which are implemented from October 26rd. As part of these restrictions you are no longer allowed to be in groups with more than 10 people both in private homes and public places.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201030113153/https://coronasmitte.dk/overblik
notes_C1: All students have been sent home and transferred to 'distanced learning' as part of the new heightened lockdown which will last until at least the 17th Jan and some measures until the 28th Feb.     Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210108132053/https://coronasmitte.dk/overblik
notes_H6: The Danish Ministry of Transport and Housing issued a press release that as of 22 August 2020, all passengers aged 12 or more must wear face masks or shields on all means of public transport, on ferries and in taxis. Customer-facing staff must also wear face masks or shields.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200826184752/https://politi.dk/en/-/media/mediefiler/corona/genaabning/face-masks-or-shields-required-on-all-forms-of-public-transport-from-22-august-2020.pdf?la=en&hash=3438F39C3B8F72E5FA2BE5BC514308FF091C910C
notes_C2: All businesses that are non-essential (groceries, take-out food, medical purposes) must be closed.    Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210108132053/https://coronasmitte.dk/overblik
notes_E2: Tax payment postponements, better access to loans in order to cover for fixed costs. Some of these policies have been in place longer, but this adjustment to the earlier economic measures mention the postponement of payments explicitly for the first time and hence it is coded on that day.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504131438/https://fm.dk/nyheder/nyhedsarkiv/2020/april/regeringen-og-alle-folketingets-partier-er-enige-om-at-justere-og-udvide-hjaelpepakker-til-dansk-oekonomi/
notes_E1: The compensation schemes for salary and revenue loss will continue until 31 January.    "The government and a broad majority of the parliamentary parties have just entered into an agreement that extends the aid packages until 31 January. "    There are also measures in place for self-employed and freelancers affected by restrictions.    http://web-old.archive.org/web/20201124093950/https://em.dk/nyhedsarkiv/2020/oktober/covid-19-ny-aftale-udvider-hjaelpepakker-til-dansk-erhvervs-kultur-og-idraetsliv/    https://archive.vn/xmKCO
notes_C3: New restrictions limit public gatherings to 5 people.     Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210108132053/https://coronasmitte.dk/overblik
notes_C6: Socialising and activities outside the house are not recommended. Guidance is to reduce seeing people as much as possible.     Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210108132053/https://coronasmitte.dk/overblik
notes_C5: Is public transportation operating? Yes  Public transport passengers are required to wear face masks or shields.
notes_H7: A, B:    Denmark begins vaccinating against COVID from 27 December.    Vulnerable people and front-line health sector workers will be the first to receive it    https://web.archive.org/web/20210106171203/https://covid19.ssi.dk/overvagningsdata/vaccinationstilslutning    https://web.archive.org/web/20201217144136/https://www.thelocal.dk/20201217/coronavirus-denmark-hopes-to-begin-vaccine-programme-on-december-27th

name: Dominican Republic
notes_H1: The "National Plan for Orientation" was released 2nd March, to "provide information on the coronavirus and how to prevent it." [https://web.archive.org/web/20200518101326/https://www.resumendesalud.net/60-infectologia/19800-cronologia-del-coronavirus-en-rep-d]
notes_H3: "I also want to invite the entire population to follow the recommendations of experts and health authorities.  This means taking the necessary hygiene measures to prevent the Coronavirus: washing your hands frequently, keeping your distance if you have a cough or sneeze, and seeking medical attention in case of fever or respiratory distress.  Likewise, we must bear in mind that the health authorities will request that people who have been in contact with infected patients also remain isolated, even if they are asymptomatic." http://web.archive.org/web/20201116073439/https://coronavirusrd.gob.do/2020/03/12/gustavo-montalvo-comision-de-alto-nivel-dara-seguimiento-permanente-para-respuesta-a-coronavirus/
notes_H2: Testing available to:  - People who have been in countries with circulation of the virus in the last 15 days or who have traveled on cruise ships. • People with two or more symptoms associated with the virus. • People who have been in contact with other people infected by the virus.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201116070448/https://www.cnss.gob.do/index.php/noticias/item/853-gobierno-dispone-cierre-operaciones-presenciales-sector-privado-ofrece-servicios-no-esenciales
notes_C7: No policy about movement restrictions found. Nothing was found regarding restrictions on intercity or interprovincial travel.  "Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel?  No"  https://web.archive.org/web/20201009190715/https://do.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Temporary ban on flights from UK until atleast January 10th.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210111181700/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/419531/dominican-republic-authorities-ban-all-commercial-passenger-flights-to-and-from-the-uk-until-jan-10-2021-update-22    "International TravelCommercial passenger flights to and from the UK are currently suspended in response to the spread of a new strain of COVID-19 discovered in the UK. Cargo, mail, technical, and medevac flights, as well as commercial overflights, are exempt. International travel to locations outside the UK is continuing. All travelers must complete an entry and exit form, which combines the traveler's Health Affidavit, Customs Declaration, and International Embarkation/Disembarkation forms; the form can be completed up to 72 hours before arrival or departure, as the case may be. Currently, travelers may complete a physical or digital form; however, effective Jan. 1, the digital e-ticket form will be mandatory. Authorities do not require arrivals to present a negative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test; however, travelers arriving by air may be randomly selected for rapid testing upon arrival at the airport. Persons testing positive will be required to enter quarantine"    https://web.archive.org/web/20210110135748/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/427551/dominican-republic-authorities-extend-state-of-emergency-extend-nationwide-curfew-and-other-restrictions-until-jan-26-due-to-covid-19-activity-update-24
notes_C4: No policy change
notes_C1: State of emergency declared on Mar 19 and extended through to April 30th - includes school closures. "Teaching at all educational levels, from basic to university, was suspended until April 13."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200426081828/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/332541/dominican-republic-curfew-and-state-of-emergency-extended-nationwide-through-april-30-update-5; https://web.archive.org/web/20200426081843/https://presidencia.gob.do/noticias/danilo-medina-prorroga-por-un-plazo-de-17-dias-contados-partir-de-manana-el-estado-de  http://web.archive.org/web/20201113160010/https://www.elperiodico.com/es/internacional/20200318/republica-dominicana-estado-emergencia-coronavirus-7894492
notes_H6: Masks are required in all public spaces in the Dominican Republic    https://web.archive.org/web/20201013111157/https://www.osac.gov/Content/Report/adbb9cbf-f780-4f58-a8bf-189496d34504
notes_C2: From May 20, some sectors have been authorised to re-open their workplaces. The tourism industry will remain closed.  "Spokespersons for the Ministry of Economy, Planning and Development (MEPyD) indicated that the first phase of the de-escalation, which will come into effect on Wednesday 20, will include almost all economic sectors, except those that by their nature involve crowds of people. This means that from that day on, any type of company -except bars and discos, cinemas, gyms, gambling venues, hotels, shopping centers and restaurants, which only with delivery or take-out services can open to the public, always that they respect the permitted attendance percentages."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200601141424/https://www.diariolibre.com/actualidad/mas-de-600-mil-empleados-vuelven-manana-a-sus-puestos-de-trabajo-en-rd-ID18933830
notes_E1: Launch the “Stay at Home” program to subsidize 1.5 million Dominican households, identified as poor or vulnerable and that are mainly informal. The program will transfer RD $ 5,000 pesos per month to 811,003 families that currently benefit from “Eating is First”. In addition, coverage will be increased to include 688,997 new homes, during a period of 2 months. The program will also make an additional transfer reaching up to RD $ 7.00 to those households with a member over 60 years of age or with a health precondition that makes them vulnerable to COVID-19. This targeted intervention will involve resources for RD $ 16,981.7 MM.    Create the Employee Solidarity Assistance Fund (FASE), which will transfer RD $ 8,500 per month to formal employees who have been suspended from their work. FASE will impact more than 754,000 families, representing an injection of liquidity to the economy of up to RD $ 15,000 million.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201115135417/https://www.hacienda.gob.do/gobierno-lanza-un-paquete-historico-de-ayuda-economica-para-proteger-a-la-republica-dominicana/
notes_C3: All public events forbidden: "In the same way, following the WHO protocols and the practices in place in different countries, events and concentrations of all kinds are suspended for 15 days.  This includes national and international events, public shows, cultural, artistic, and sporting events, as well as activity in bars and discos, among others."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200427180440/https://www.msp.gob.do/web/?p=6627
notes_C6: "Beginning December 31, the government of the Dominican Republic has issued a curfew nationwide.  Failure to follow the curfew, including for U.S. citizens, may result in arrest and/or fines.  Full details on the curfew can be found at https://presidencia.gob.do/            December 31:  Curfew will begin at 7pm.              January 1-10 (M-F):  Curfew from 5pm to 5am, with a grace period for transit until 7pm each day.              January 1-10 (Sa-Sun):  Curfew from 12pm to 5am."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210103135354/https://do.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: "On May 20, some public transportation services, including buses, metro trains, and cable cars will restart with social distancing guidelines and reduced schedules."   http://web.archive.org/web/20200521092913/https://do.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/  The public transport has been opened to provide transport coverage to workers. Passengers must follow strict sanitary measures. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528033058/https://cnnespanol.cnn.com/video/dominicana-reactivacion-economica-transporte-publico-coronavirus-jessica-hasbun-lkl-perspectivas-mexico/

name: Algeria
notes_H1: Government communication on covid-19 appears to have been forthcoming: https://web.archive.org/save/http://www.premier-ministre.gov.dz/fr/mediatheque/videos/pm-djerad-30-03-2020.html
notes_H3: The government statement says that it aims to -     Strengthen epidemiological surveillance by conducting in-depth investigations, especially about people in contact, in order to break the chain of spread of infection. In this context, the human and material means necessary to implement these investigations will be provided by placing land and air transport at the disposal of the Ministry of Health in order to enable it to intervene quickly and effectively to resolve the problems raised across all states of the country      https://web.archive.org/web/20200707001319/http://www.premier-ministre.gov.dz/ar/premier-ministre/activites/com-29-06-2020-ar2.html
notes_H2: Although I cannot find any specific testing policy, the government have spent $100mn on more testing devices, and case numbers were quickly rising, so I assume from this point at least a 1 for testing policy.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200509150237/http://www.premier-ministre.gov.dz/fr/premier-ministre/activites/com-22-03-2020-fr.html
notes_C7: "All vehicle travel between the 29 provinces listed below as being impacted by a curfew has been prohibited for one week as of July 10: (...) Algiers, where the curfew is from 8pm to 5am.  The other provinces covered by the curfew are:  Boumerdes, Souk Ahras, Tissemsilt, Djelfa, Mascara, Oum El Bouaghi, Batna, Bouira, Relizane, Biskra, Khenchela, M’sila, Chlef, Sidi Bel Abbes, Médéa, Blida, Bordj Bou Arreridj, Tipaza, Ouargla, Bechar, Constantine, Oran, Sétif, Annaba, Bejaia, Adrar, Laghouat, El Oued (...)"    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200816105319/https://dz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: President Abdelmadjid Tebboune announced in a televised speech on Tuesday, March 17, the closure of all land borders and the suspension of all air and maritime links - except for those transporting goods - to limit the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19).    The decision follows the announcement that all travel via air and sea to and from Europe will be suspended from Thursday, March 19. Air Algerie is scheduled to arrange flights for citizens returning from France. The airline will also temporary suspend its flight services to and from Tunis, Cairo, Dubai, Doha, and Amman from March 17. Prime Minister Abdelaziz Djerad had previously announced the suspension of flights to several African destinations including Senegal, Mali, Niger, Mauritania, Cote d'Ivoire, and Burkina Faso from March 19.    Link - http://web.archive.org/web/20200611151823/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/323986/algeria-government-closes-land-borders-and-suspends-air-and-sea-transport-due-to-covid-19-march-17-update-6
notes_C4: There is a nationwide ban on family gatherings of any kind, including marriages. https://web.archive.org/web/20200826015744/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/algeria/coronavirus
notes_C1: No change in policy. Schools are open with precautionary measures in place.    https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse
notes_H6: The wearing of facemasks became mandatory on 24 May in all public spaces, including when using public transport, and within private cars and taxis.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200910153722/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/algeria/coronavirus
notes_C2: In mid-November, the Algerian government imposed mandated 3:00pm daily closures on some businesses, including salons, home goods stores, and commercial centers, in the 32 wilayas, including Algiers.  Restaurants and cafes are also subject to the 3:00pm closure requirement and offer only carry-out or delivery services.  It is expected that the Algerian government will review these restrictions in mid-December.  The lifting of restrictions will be gradual and dependent on the evolution of COVID-19 cases in Algeria.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214081917/https://dz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: A supplementary finance law (SFL) was enacted on June 4. In response to the economic impact on household and enterprises of the lockdown measures, the authorities also announced that: (i) the declaration and payments of income taxes for individuals and enterprises have been postponed, except for large enterprises; and (ii) contractual deadlines would be relaxed and penalties for companies that experience delays in completing public contracts would be suspended.      https://web.archive.org/web/20200707002837/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: It was decided after consultation with Mr. President of the Republic that eff. June 14, with regard to exceptional paid leave in the economic sector: - The lifting of the measure of exceptional paid leave of 50% of the workforce in the public and private economic sector, for companies that can transport their staff, and meet the health protection conditions specific to their activity.   With regard to exceptional paid leave in public institutions and administrations:  - The lifting of the measure of exceptional leave with pay of 50% of the staff of public institutions and administrations, while maintaining this measure for the benefit of pregnant women and those raising children under 14 years of age.  The measure was therefore lifted partially, and will affect only certain groups hereon.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200709105027/http://www.premier-ministre.gov.dz/fr/premier-ministre/activites/com-13-06-2020-fr.html
notes_C3: "Mosques with a capacity of more than 1,000 worshipers can reopen from August 15, through Friday prayers, which attract larger numbers of people, will remain banned throughout the country. The government will also allow the reopening of beaches and entertainment venues, as well as restaurants, cafes, and hotels. It said social distancing and protection masks would be compulsory, and warned any violation of preventive measures against the novel coronavirus would prompt it to reimpose more restrictions"    Source: https://africa.cgtn.com/2020/08/09/algeria-eases-more-covid-19-restrictions/
notes_C6: The government lifted the full lockdown in Blida on 24 April and replaced it with curfew between 14:00 to 07:00. Night time curfews in other provinces to continue.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200426141624/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/335791/algeria-authorities-ease-covid-19-restrictions-for-ramadan-april-24-update-12
notes_C5: Public and private transportation between the 29 provinces listed below as being impacted by a curfew has been prohibited.  Public transportation (and depending on the province, private transportation) may be suspended on Fridays and Saturdays in the provinces affected by a curfew.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201115073533/https://dz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Ecuador
notes_H1: The government launches the official website on all COVID-19 related information. Retrieved from: https://web.archive.org/web/20200409110834/https://coronavirusecuador.com/
notes_H3: Governement is struggling to systematically contact trace https://web.archive.org/save/Source:%20https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(20)30851-5/fulltext
notes_H2: From 19 March, the Ministry of Public Health announced three laboratories that will be approved to conduct COVID-19 tests. The cost of the test will be USD 80 for people with a prescription from a public doctor and USD 120 for those with a prescription from a private doctor.    Moreover, the tests will only be conducted in people's households.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200903171132/https://www.primicias.ec/noticias/sociedad/laboratorios-coronavirus-prueba-salud/
notes_C7: https://web.archive.org/web/20201218161840/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/coronavirus
notes_C8: Upon arrival, passengers will be required to sign a declaration form with their itinerary and local contact details. They must also present a negative Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) test for COVID-19, taken up to 10 days prior to their arrival in the country.  Quarantine for 10 days is only for travelers who test positive at the airport.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210104164610/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/entry-requirements
notes_C4: Public gatherings prohibited   https://web.archive.org/web/20201218161840/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/coronavirus
notes_C1: Pilot projects for the restart of face-to-face lessons is suspended until re-evaluation of the epidemic on 9th Februrary. All classes continue with distance learning until 9th February.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118170421/https://twitter.com/Educacion_Ec/status/1351213623557959689
notes_H6: The national Emergency Operations Committee (COE) ruled this Monday, April 6, 2020, a new resolution to contain COVID-19 . According to the resolution, each Municipal Decentralized Autonomous Government (GAD) must issue an ordinance of mandatory use of masks to circulate in public spaces.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200915204754/https://www.elcomercio.com/actualidad/mascarilla-obligatoria-espacios-publicos-covid19.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20200915204809/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-04/08/c_138956755.htm
notes_C2: According to the UK embassy website, pubs, nightclubs and children playgrounds remain closed until 12 September.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200907022153/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/coronavirus
notes_E2: The Ministry of Energy and Non-Renewable Natural Resources ordered that all the electricity and water distribution companies in the country not cut service to residential users who have unpaid bills.  /web/20200503195024/https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/2020/03/15/nota/7783146/emergencia-sanitaria-no-se-cortaran-servicios-agua-o-electricidad    13-apr. A Law Project has been sent to Congress to forbid evictions but this has not yet been approved  /web/20200503195220/https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/2020/04/13/nota/7812147/ley-inquilinato-emergencia-covid-19-arriendos-inquilinos-defensoria
notes_E1: From 1 April, the Government announced the program "Bono de Contigencia", that will support more than 250.000 low-income families. The program consists of two payments of USD 60 each.    https://archive.vn/o38yY
notes_C3: Ministry María Paula Romo announced that from March 13, massive public events throughout the country are suspended indefinitely. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200411180934/https://www.metroecuador.com.ec/ec/noticias/2020/03/12/medidas-del-gobierno-ante-coronavirus-en-ecuador-se-suspenden-eventos-masivos.html
notes_C6: From 4th January 2021, curfew restrictions are no longer in place, though local municipalities able to impose tailored regulations  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110181815/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/coronavirus
notes_C5: Inter-provincial bus transport operation has been authorised by local municipalities, at 75% capacity, from/to bus terminals. Accredited tourist transport vehicles are not subject to any mobility restriction.  Public transport, bus terminals and interstate and tourist transport can operate at a maximum 50% capacity.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201218161840/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador/coronavirus
notes_H7: A (healthcare workers)  on the 21st Jan the vaccination campaign has officially started. Healthcare workers are being vaccinated with the Pfizer vaccine across different Hospitals in the country.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210124212558/https://www.salud.gob.ec/en-ecuador-inicio-la-vacunacion-contra-la-covid-19/

name: Egypt
notes_H1: The Egyptian government has launched an information campaign 'Stay at Home' to raise awareness about COVID-19 urging citizens to follow the social distancing advice. The Ministry of Health has also established a dedicated COVID-19 hotline to answer any queries from the public.    Source (in Arabic):https://web.archive.org/web/20200528220904/https://news.un.org/ar/story/2020/03/1051932
notes_H3: Start-date unclear. "Egypt’s strong disease surveillance system and contact tracing efforts have proven effective in controlling managing sporadic and clusters of cases before they can spread." (https://web.archive.org/web/20200411202711/http://www.emro.who.int/media/news/who-delegation-concludes-covid-19-technical-mission-to-egypt.html)  LINK: https://web.archive.org/web/20200411202711/http://www.emro.who.int/media/news/who-delegation-concludes-covid-19-technical-mission-to-egypt.html
notes_H2: 20 May 2020     Egypt signalled an expansion of testing for the new coronavirus on Wednesday, announcing that all the country’s 320 general hospitals would offer testing to people showing symptoms of the illness.   https://uk.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-egypt/egypt-to-offer-coronavirus-testing-in-all-general-hospitals-idUKKBN22W2UI
notes_C7: Prime Minister Moustafa Madbouly told a news conference on Tuesday that the 11-hour nationwide curfew from 7pm to 6am (17:00-04:00 GMT) would go into effect on Wednesday, during which all public and private transportation would be suspended. http://web.archive.org/web/20200426113329/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/03/egypt-imposes-week-nightly-curfew-slow-coronavirus-spread-200324174007399.html
notes_C8: The Egyptian Government has announced that all passengers travelling to Egypt (including Egyptians) must be in possession of negative PCR test certificate for COVID-19, taken at a maximum of 72 hours before their flight departure time.  However, passengers travelling from Japan, China, Thailand, North America, South America, Canada, London Heathrow, Paris, and Frankfurt will be allowed to provide the test certificate performed at a maximum of  96 hours prior to flight departure, due to the long travel and transit period from these airports.   Are U.S. citizens required to quarantine? No    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109104301/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: The Government of Egypt has canceled all public New Year’s celebrations. All indoor weddings, funerals, festivals, or other mass gatherings are canceled indefinitely.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210102074443/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: The Ministry's plan for the 2020/2021 academic year is based on maintaining social distancing, sufficient ventilation and regular disinfection at schools, while raising awareness of students and parents about the pandemic and necessary precautions, reports Xinhua news agency. There will also be temperature checks for students, teachers and visitors before entering schools.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109104003/https://www.nationalheraldindia.com/international/egypt-reopens-schools-amid-anti-coronavirus-measures#bypass-sw    The academic year for public schools and universities will begin on October 17, and the Ministry of Higher Education announced that universities will begin the academic year using a “hybrid” education model. International schools are not required to adhere to the October 17 timeline so they may open earlier or have a different operating status.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109104301/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: The Government of Egypt has announced that commencing Sunday, January 3, 2021, individuals who do not adhere to precautionary measures such as wearing a mask indoors may be subject to an immediate fine or prosecution.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210117105308/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: Reuters reported that, on the 19th of March, Egypt said it would shut all cafes, shopping malls, sports clubs and nightclubs from 7 p.m. until 6 a.m. local time every night until March 31. However, the government said supermarkets, pharmacies, bakeries and neighbourhood corner stores were exempt from the closure. It has also moved to cut the number of public sector employees reporting to work in an effort to discourage crowding and slow the spread of the disease.  (http://web.archive.org/web/20200506222304/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-egypt/egypt-to-shut-all-cafes-malls-sports-clubs-in-evenings-until-march-31-idUSKBN2163H8)    Furthermore, according to Alarabiya Markets, 10 out of 17 multinational or Egyptian companies listed in the Egyptian Stock Exchange are preparing their staff to transition to work from home. (http://web.archive.org/web/20200506222422/https://www.alarabiya.net/ar/aswaq/companies/2020/03/16/????-?????????-???????-???????-?????-?????-??????.htm)    Similarly, across the public sector, the government has started to reduce the capacity of staff. For example, the Parliament has asked 50% of its staff to work from home. (http://web.archive.org/web/20200506222503/https://www.shorouknews.com/news/view.aspx?cdate=16032020&id=ba52ec71-1704-48e1-8ced-eae713ff507f)    "This includes the closure of schools, universities, cafes, and restaurants; a ban against travel, tourist activities, and major sporting events; and reduced work in the public sector, which employs over 5 million Egyptians."  (http://web.archive.org/web/20200506222713/https://atlanticcouncil.org/blogs/menasource/the-coronavirus-crisis-highlights-the-unique-challenges-of-north-african-countries/)
notes_E2: Individual life, medical and car insurance policyholders are given a grace period to meet their financial obligations. Mortage and financial leasing companies are to grant a six month grace period without imposing any delay fines. See Financial Regulatory Authority document, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200823154518/http://www.fra.gov.eg/jtags/efsa_en/media/Initiatives.pdf
notes_E1: Pensions have been increased by 14 percent. Expansion of the targeted cash transfer social programs, Takaful and Karama, are also being extended to reach more families. A targeted support initiative for irregular workers in most severely hit sectors has been announced, which will entail EGP 500 in monthly grants for 3 months to close to 1.6 million beneficiaries.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109105435/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: The Ministry of Awqaf of Egypt is one of the ministries in the Egyptian government and is in charge of religious endowments. The Ministry has decided on the 21st of March to suspend public prayers (including Friday prayers) in all the mosques of the country for two weeks.     Similarly, the Coptic church of Egypt has announced the closure of all churches across the country for a period of two weeks starting from the 21st of March.    (http://web.archive.org/web/20200506223019/https://www.bbc.com/arabic/middleeast-5198811)
notes_C6: Restaurants, cafes, sports clubs and movie theaters are currently allowed to operate at 50 percent capacity.  Restaurants and cafes are required to close by midnight, while other shops, including grocery stores, are required to close by 10:00 pm.  Public parks and beaches remain closed.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109104301/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: Is public transportation operating? Yes  Masks are required.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109104301/https://eg.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/

name: Eritrea
notes_H1: Information and guidelines is provided by the Ministry of Health using traditional media. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200605211101/http://www.shabait.com/news/local-news/30299-ministry-of-health-additional-public-announcement-on-covid-19
notes_H3: The Ministry of Health noted on October 12 2020 that "targeted testing of quarantined individuals, febrile and other patients with COVID-19 symptoms in all clinics and hospitals throughout the country; as well as Aggressive Contact Tracing continue to constitute the three key pillars of the Preventive Strategy." - source https://web.archive.org/web/20201115163833/https://us.embassyeritrea.org/2020/03/28/covid-19/
notes_H2: A program of random population testing for Covid was announced on May 16 2020 to "gauge the spread of COVID-19 in the country in a comprehensive and more reliable manner". Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201115164748/https://shabait.com/2020/05/17/first-phase-of-random-and-extensive-covid-19-testing-launched/     The Ministry of Health noted on October 12 2020 that "targeted testing of quarantined individuals, febrile and other patients with COVID-19 symptoms in all clinics and hospitals throughout the country; as well as Aggressive Contact Tracing continue to constitute the three key pillars of the Preventive Strategy." - source https://web.archive.org/web/20201115163833/https://us.embassyeritrea.org/2020/03/28/covid-19/"    Tests are generally taken at one of the Eritrean government’s 82 testing center and are free-of-charge. All testing samples are sent to Asmara’s Central Lab for evaluation. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201115141839/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Restriction on all movement, with a ban on the use of private cars unless by key workers. https://web.archive.org/web/20200605224007/http://www.shabait.com/news/local-news/30407-guidelines-from-the-high-level-task-force-on-covid-19
notes_C8: All borders are officially closed, as is Asmara international airport. There is no indication of when the airport will re-open. Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200915213606/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/eritrea/entry-requirements
notes_C4: All gatherings of over 10 people are prohibited without a government permit. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201115141839/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: The US Embassy in Eritrea reports that per guidelines issued by the Eritrean High Level Task Force on Covid 19, "University and SAWA [military academy] students can attend training and classes. All other students are to remain at home." - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104222039/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    It is not entirely clear on which date this guidance went into effect (guidenlines were issued on 12/22, clarified on 12/16, and the Embassy web page last updated on 12/29) but it seems reasonable that the Government intended them to take effect on 12/22.
notes_H6: No change. Those providing services must wear a mask as well as all those in schools and health facilitates, including students and patients.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201019200757/https://er.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: According to the government guidance from December 22, 2020:    "With the exception of trade services related to the daily livelihood of people, all other trading enterprises will be closed.  The former will close at 8-00 pm every evening."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210124165045/https://shabait.com/2020/12/21/guidelines-from-the-high-level-task-force-on-covid-19-5/
notes_E2: In a clarification to the guidelines issued on December 21. the Eritrean High Level Task Force on Covid-19 is reported by the US Embassy in Eritrea to have announced that "Payment of electricity, water and telephone bills will be suspended." https://web.archive.org/web/20210104214528/https://er.usembassy.gov/december-26-announcement-from-the-eritrean-government-on-clarification-of-covid-19-guidelines/
notes_C3: All public gatherings, sport and cultural events that assemble a crowd of more than 10 people are prohibited.  Cinemas and night-clubs to remain closed until further notice. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200605214149/http://www.shabait.com/news/local-news/30342--ministry-of-health-public-guidelines-no-3
notes_C6: In a "clarification" to the guidelines issued on December 21. the Eritrean High Level Task Force on Covid-19 is reported by the US Embassy in Eritrea to have announced that "Except those who work in activities related to development, safety, and essential services, everyone must avoid unnecessary movement and remain at home. Except for emergency cases or food purchases, all movement done – whether by foot, bicycle, cart, or car – is prohibited." - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104214528/https://er.usembassy.gov/december-26-announcement-from-the-eritrean-government-on-clarification-of-covid-19-guidelines/
notes_C5: All public transport (buses, minibuses and taxis) in all the cities stopped from 6 am 27th of March. Use of trucks for public transport deemed illicit and punishable by law. All public transport services from one region to another, with the exception of those with a special permit granted by competent authority, stopped.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200605220452/http://www.shabait.com/news/local-news/30367-ministry-of-health-public-announcement-no-5

name: Spain
notes_H1: Following the coronavirus outbreak in China, the Government of Spain has promoted a number of public information channels for gathering all the relevant information from the various ministerial departments. The purpose is to allow anyone interested in this topic to access information from reliable expert sources.  /web/20200430102339/https://www.lamoncloa.gob.es/lang/en/gobierno/news/paginas/2020/20200131info-coronavirus.aspx
notes_H3: 24th Feb- first person tests positive in mainland spain. Catalan health authorities have isolated 25 people with whom she came into contact and are carrying out tests to see if they have the virus.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200408121902/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/02/1000-tourists-tenerife-quarantine-coronavirus-diagnosis-200225115101427.html
notes_H2: "Early detection of Covid-19 infection will be done by performing a PCR (or any other molecular diagnostic technique considered adequate) to ALL CASES SUSPECTED of infection in the first 24 hours." Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200511201542/https://www.mscbs.gob.es/profesionales/saludPublica/ccayes/alertasActual/nCov-China/documentos/instruccionesPruebasDiagnosticasEmpresas.pdf
notes_C7: According to Royal Decree 926/2020 of 25 October declaring an alarm status to contain the spread of infections caused by SARS-CoV-2(Abre en nueva ventana), the entry and exit of persons from the territory of each autonomous community and each city with a Statute of Autonomy is restricted except for those trips, which are adequately justified.    https://archive.vn/4wu6B
notes_C8: Borders have been opened for EU flights only. Screening protocols in place in all airports.     Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200626011838/https://www.infobae.com/america/mundo/2020/06/21/espana-abre-sus-fronteras-y-apuesta-al-turismo-para-maquillar-su-peor-tragedia-economica-desde-la-guerra-civil/
notes_C4: According to Royal Decree 926/2020 of 25 October declaring an alarm status to contain the spread of infections caused by SARS-CoV-2(Abre en nueva ventana), public and private gatherings are limited to six people.    https://archive.vn/4wu6B
notes_C1: According to this article, it is not even recommended that schools should close:  "the Health Ministry does not believe the rising trend will impact the return to school, which has already happened in some regions, and will begin on Monday in others. When asked about the possibility of closing schools on Thursday, health official María José Sierra replied: “We do not recommend it.”  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110182152/https://english.elpais.com/society/2021-01-08/coronavirus-cases-in-spain-officially-top-two-million.html
notes_H6: Masks are required for everyone age six or older in enclosed spaces and public areas and on public transport.    https://archive.vn/vYbV5
notes_C2: On August 14th, “The Ministry of Health and the regional governments have unanimously agreed, at the Inter-territorial Council held on an extraordinary basis, to coordinated public health actions to respond to the increase in cases of COVID-19”. “Nightlife is currently the origin of the epidemic spikes with the largest number of associated cases - an average of 31 - and moreover, these are the spikes that are the origin of a large number of community transmissions at this time and of cases in several autonomous regions. Accordingly, one of the measures consists of the closure of nightclubs, dance halls and late night bars with and without live music.” See the Gobierno de España website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200819194108/https://www.lamoncloa.gob.es/lang/en/gobierno/news/Paginas/2020/20200814_coordinatedactio.aspx
notes_E2: Economic assistance measures approved which  1) bans electricity, gas and water shutoffs to all households during the coronavirus health crisis  2) Provides rent and housing support, including:   "Suspension of evictions: once the state of emergency has ended, and for the next six months, it is suspended for all those people who are in a vulnerable situation and are pending eviction.  Microcredits: banks will offer tenants microcredits without interest or commissions guaranteed by the state. Who is eligible? People who have lost their jobs, who are under an ERTE, who have had to reduce their working hours and self-employed who cannot make their payments. These microcredits may be repaid in six years and may be extended by another four years.  Extraordinary extension: leases that expire during the next two months after the entry into force of this rule are extended to six months.  Moratorium on payment: when the owner of the housing, physical or legal person, has an investment fund, the tenant may request a moratorium on payment of rent as long as the state of emergency is in effect. On the other hand, tenants may also apply for specific public aid."   ARCHIVED:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200522185146/https://www.mitma.gob.es/el-ministerio/sala-de-prensa/noticias/mie-01042020-0735  https://web.archive.org/web/20200522185152/https://www.shbarcelona.com/blog/en/coronavirus-crisis-how-will-it-affect-rents-in-spain/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200522185157/https://smartwatermagazine.com/news/smart-water-magazine/spain-bans-water-shutoffs-during-coronavirus-pandemic
notes_E1: The government announced a New Social Agreement that maintains until 30 June the support to furlough/unemployment insurance to the workers of those enterprises who will not be able to get back to work due to force majure.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200511211456/https://www.lamoncloa.gob.es/presidente/actividades/Paginas/2020/110520-acuerdo-social.aspxhttps://www.lamoncloa.gob.es/presidente/actividades/Paginas/2020/110520-acuerdo-social.aspx
notes_C3: According to Royal Decree 926/2020 of 25 October declaring an alarm status to contain the spread of infections caused by SARS-CoV-2(Abre en nueva ventana), public and private gatherings are limited to six people.    https://archive.vn/4wu6B
notes_C6: According to Royal Decree 926/2020 of 25 October declaring an alarm status to contain the spread of infections caused by SARS-CoV-2(Abre en nueva ventana), there is a curfew in place from 23:00 to 6:00.    https://archive.vn/4wu6B
notes_C5: Spain’s Government to Allow 100% Passenger Occupation on Public & Private Transport from Monday June 8. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200611033954/https://www.euroweeklynews.com/2020/06/06/spains-government-to-allow-100-passenger-occupation-on-public-private-transport-from-monday-june-8/
notes_H7: A, C:      The plan's first stage "includes residents and staff in homes for seniors and the disabled, healthcare workers and adults with dependencies who are not in institutions."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210108111541/https://english.elpais.com/society/2020-12-29/more-than-350000-doses-of-the-covid-19-vaccine-arrive-in-spain-as-mass-immunization-campaign-begins.html

name: Estonia
notes_H1: On March 12th, 2020, the Government called together a special Committee tasked with resolving issues arising from events related to spreading of the coronavirus, public health and the economy. This is the first time an emergency situation has been called out in Estonia after regaining its independence. The committee provides information and updates about the virus: https://www.kriis.ee/en/emergency-situation-estonia
notes_H3: Estonia's coronavirus exposure notification app "HOIA" launches today (August 20) and is now available to download. The purpose of the free app - which is optional and not mandatory - is to inform close contacts of those infected with the coronavirus and to provide them with initial instructions on how to proceed. Its aim is to limit the spread of coronavirus. In this way, the user can quickly find out about possible close contact with a COVID-19 infected person, allowing them to take steps to protect their own health and the health of others.    Since this amounts to at least a limited effort of contact tracing, upgraded to 1 on review.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200924200214/https://news.err.ee/1125119/feature-estonia-launches-coronavirus-exposure-notification-app-hoia  https://web.archive.org/web/20200927101653/https://e-estonia.com/trace-covid-19-while-respecting-privacy/
notes_H2: Staring April 8th, family doctors can refer to testing anyone with symptoms indicative of coronavirus regarding whom a reasoned suspicion of presence of the virus exists, regardless of their age and accompanying illnesses. https://web.archive.org/web/20200412141213/https://www.baltictimes.com/1_609_coronavirus_tests_carried_out_in_estonia_in_past_day__new_cases_number_23/
notes_C7: "As of tomorrow, the restriction on freedom of movement will be lifted, people can travel feely between the islands and the mainland Estonia, and from one island to another, regardless of their place of residence. Since the risk of spreading the coronavirus due to movement between the islands and the mainland has decreased considerably, lifting the movement restriction is a proportional response." (http://web.archive.org/web/20200604215302/https://www.kriis.ee/en/news/special-notice-tomorrow-movement-restrictions-between-islands-and-mainland-estonia-will-be)
notes_C8: Estonia re-establishes border controls and bans travel to Estonia for non-essential purposes, with the following exceptions:  - Citizens and residents of the European Union, the Schengen area, the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, Andorra, Monaco, San Marino and Vatican, and individuals with a long-stay visa and their family members if they show no symptoms.   - Persons who are asymptomatic and who arrive from a country not listed in clauses 101 and 121 but published on the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and who are said country’s residents pursuant to the laws of said country (currently Australia, Canada, Georgia, Japan, New Zealand, Rwanda, South Korea, Thailand, Tunisia and Uruguay)    Citizens from countries not listed above may enter Estonia only "for the purpose of work or for the purpose of studies in an educational institution registered in Estonia." Although this is a "soft ban," it still will ban the majority of citizens from those countries and is hence coded as 3.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200927094118/https://www.riigiteataja.ee/en/eli/ee/VV/k/514092020001/consolide
notes_C4: From the 16th of November, the Government has announced that the 2+2 rule will apply in service halls and public areas of commercial enterprise. 2 people may move together, and a distance of 2m minimum must be kept from others, except for families.  There must be a 2m distance between groups of people in catering and entertainment establishments with a maximum of 10 people per group. This does not apply to families and other exceptions including children's playgroups.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201114191537/https://www.kriis.ee/en/news/government-announced-new-measures-stop-spread-coronavirus
notes_C1: On January 7, the government decided to resume contact education in general education schools, vocational schools and universities outside Harju County and Ida-Viru County as of January 11.     In Harju and Ida-Viru County, 1-4th, 9th and 12th grade students will return to in person teaching. The remaining grades will remain online.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210117193919/https://www.hm.ee/en/spread-covid-19-recommendations-educational-institutions
notes_H6: On the 10th of November, the government announced recommendations that would come into place on the 12th of November. These included:  -A requirement to wear a face covering on the nose and mouth in public transport, in the service halls and public areas of commercial enterprises, at conferences, concerts, theatres and cinemas. Carriers/event organisers/ employers are asked to monitor this. Excepts are allowed e.g those with asthma.   -Carriers are asked to put up signs asking passengers to wear face coverings.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201114191537/https://www.kriis.ee/en/news/government-announced-new-measures-stop-spread-coronavirus
notes_C2: From the 12th of December, in Ida-Viru County, entertainment and accommodation facilities, museums and exhibitions must be closed to visitors. All sports facilities must be closed. This does not apply to professional sports activities. All sales and service halls of catering companies must be closed. Food takeaway and related courier service will be allowed.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201210173303/https://www.valitsus.ee/en/news/government-approved-new-national-restrictions-and-restrictions-ida-viru-county
notes_E2: Grace periods can be applied to corporate loans, mortgage loans, leases, as well as consumer credit agreements. The length of the grace period is up to 12 months for mortgage loans and up to six months for leases and consumer loans. The common regulations for the grant of grace periods arising from the emergency situation will step into force on April 27 and they will be published on the web page of the Estonian Banking Association. https://web.archive.org/web/20200502105248/https://news.err.ee/1082058/banks-agree-on-common-rules-for-grace-periods
notes_E1: Salary subsidy no longer extended, hence downgraded to 0.
notes_C3: Harju and Ida-Viru counties -  Public meetings and events, including conferences, theatre performances, concerts and movie screenings, are prohibited indoors. Outdoors, they can be attended in groups of up to ten people, with no contact between groups allowed. A public outdoor event must be over by 10 p.m.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210123122241/https://www.themayor.eu/en/a/view/estonia-eases-some-covid-19-restrictions-7025
notes_C6: While there is no specific information on stay-at-home measures, from the fact that most schools and workplaces reopened it is possible to infer that all stay-at-home measures were lifted. There is also no evidence of recommending stay-at-home requirements. However, the government does urge individuals to wear masks whenever going out and to practice general safety measures. (http://web.archive.org/web/20200604212301/https://www.kriis.ee/en/emergency-situation-and-covid-19)
notes_H7: In the first two weeks of vaccination, 10,197 people have received the first dose of coronavirus vaccine at 100 healthcare facilities in Estonia.    The first dose has been given to most of the staff of family medicine centers, approximately 30 percent of the staff of the hospitals in the hospital network, as well as the staff and residents of the first care homes, the Ministry of Social Affairs said.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210123120628/https://www.baltictimes.com/more_than_10_000_people_in_estonia_have_received_1st_dose_of_coronavirus_vaccine/    A,B

name: Ethiopia
notes_H1: From the ministry of health and Ethiopian Public Health Institute. For example, see: http://web.archive.org/save/https://www.facebook.com/ephipage/?ref=nf&hc_ref=ARRual-vb-0bHTsHys3NU-8N4iOccXLMtg1BLfDFVz2GTNcrFJUcdKKzGiDbgiC6Etc
notes_H3: The latest Public Health bulletin describes a comprehensive contact tracing program that includes "rumor collection, verification, investigation and information provision via toll free call center, active case detection by house to house search, contact listing, tracing and follow-up of persons who had contact with confirmed cases."     https://web.archive.org/web/20201121151925/https://www.ephi.gov.et/images/novel_coronavirus/EPHI_PHEOC_COVID-19_Weekly_Bulletin_27_English_11022020.pdf
notes_H2: 14th Feb     WHO Ethiopia Country Office “Ethiopia now has the capacity to conduct confirmatory laboratory test for COVID-19”  http://archive.vn/mrlzZ/image
notes_C7: Ethiopia’s northern Tigray regional state on Thursday, March 26, announced a region-wide state of emergency as a means of combating the coronavirus pandemic. Under the 15-day emergency rule: all travels within the state is banned.  See:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200426142829/https://www.africanews.com/2020/04/24/ethiopia-s-coronavirus-rules-crowd-ban-free-transport-regulate-essentials-etc/
notes_C8: http://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ethiopia/entry-requirements
notes_C4: No Policy Change   http://web.archive.org/web/20210117225729/http://www.moh.gov.et/ejcc/sites/default/files/2020-10/Registerd%20COVID-19%20Directive%202013.pdf
notes_C1: Schools announced to reopen provided they meet safety criteria.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201109162755/https://www.globalcitizen.org/en/content/ethiopia-schools-covid-19-child-marriage-labor/
notes_H6: On 8 April, the Government of Ethiopia declared a State of Emergency to help limit the spread of coronavirus. The State of Emergency will last for five months and gives the Federal Government and security forces increased power to impose limitations. One of the measures include making mandatory the wearing of face masks in all public places.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200902161503/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ethiopia/coronavirus
notes_C2: It was noted on 18 June that nightclub and entertainments outlets must remain closed. Per guidance issued on October 5th, the hospitality industry (cafes, bars, restaurants and coffee shops) may offer service to up to 3 people per table, with social distancing, mask wearing, provision of ventilation and PPE, disinfection procedures. Nightclubs may operate with limited capacity and social distancing and other measures. Sports tournaments are permitted, but without spectators. Cinemas, thaters and art gallers are permitted to open with mandated cleaning protocols, provision of PPE, reduced capacity. Details are contained in Part 8, "Cautionary Measures To Be Complied with By Recreations, Hospitality Services, and Sport Tournaments" of Directive No 30/2020, "A DIRECTIVE ISSUED FOR THE PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF COVID-19 PANDEMIC" issued on October 05, 2020 by the Ethiopian Public Health Institute. https://web.archive.org/web/20201016015706/https://www.ephi.gov.et/images/Registerd-COVID-19-Directive-2013_Final_051020.pdf
notes_E2: No household support provided.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200505235808/https://institute.global/policy/economic-policy-response-covid-19
notes_C3: The following guidance came into effect on October 5, 2020:    "It is recommended, as much as possible, not to hold holidays in a public square involving too many people until the prevalence of the pandemic is stabilized."     https://web.archive.org/web/20201121145133/https://www.ephi.gov.et/images/Registerd-COVID-19-Directive-2013_Final_051020.pdf
notes_C6: No curfew is in place.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201109160856/https://et.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: On a directive that came into effect on the 5th of October, Public transport is allowed to operate in full capacity while observing mask-wearing   http://web.archive.org/web/20210117225729/http://www.moh.gov.et/ejcc/sites/default/files/2020-10/Registerd%20COVID-19%20Directive%202013.pdf

name: Finland
notes_H1: Covid Coordination group announced on Feb 27th https://vnk.fi/en/article/-/asset_publisher/hallitus-sai-laajan-katsauksen-koronavirustilanteesta-ja-paatti-lisakoordinaatiosta; dedicated, regular info from government maintained as of 24 April: https://web.archive.org/save/https://thl.fi/en/web/infectious-diseases/what-s-new/coronavirus-covid-19-latest-updates
notes_H3: 28th Feb Contact tracing “Officials said they will contact such persons individually who may have been exposed” from new case.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200408214223/https://yle.fi/uutiset/osasto/news/new_coronavirus_infection_confirmed_in_helsinki/11234516
notes_H2: THL recommends coronavirus testing at a low threshold with symptoms. However, they don’t test persons who are asymptomatic, since it does not always provide reliable results. Virus testing currently has a capacity of over 13,000 tests per day.
