As the policy was set to end on 16th April and as no further policy announcements have been found, it is assumed that the stay at home requirement for persons under 18 years of age ceased after 16th April.  Hence the code of "0".

name: South Korea
notes_H1: http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/en/
notes_H3: Extensive public information campaign, most notably location tracing apps. The Corona 100m (Co100) app launched on February 11 and, using government data, alerts users when they come within 100 metres of a location visited by an infected person. Coronamap website shows the travel histories of confirmed COVID-19 patients and Coronaita aims to function “like a search engine” for information on coronavirus-hit areas.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200330202823/https://www.smartcitiesworld.net/news/news/south-korea-to-step-up-online-coronavirus-tracking-5109   https://web.archive.org/web/20200330202916/http://www.korea.net/NewsFocus/Society/view?articleId=183129
notes_H2: KCDC- The newly developed diagnostic will be available at the 50 designated health facilities from 7 February. The improved real-time PCR can detect the novel Coronavirus within six hours.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200406091812/https://www.cdc.go.kr/board/board.es?mid=a30402000000&bid=0030  BBC- South Korea managed to get testing centres up and running 17 days after the 1st case (20th of January)  https://web.archive.org/web/20200406084319/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-51836898
notes_C7: The two weeks from September 28 to October 11, when the Chuseok holiday begins, are planned to be set as a special quarantine period for the whole country and strengthen quarantine management in consideration of the high risk aspect. In religious facilities, all religious activities, including worship, mass, and court, should be conducted non-face-to-face, and that all face-to-face meetings, events, and group meals should be refrained.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201003225816/http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=360146&contSeq=360146&board_id=&gubun=ALL   http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=359862&contSeq=359862&board_id=&gubun=ALL (link can’t be archived)
notes_C8: South Korea said on December 23, 2020, it will suspend flights leaving for and arriving from United Kingdom until the end of the year (December 31) over concerns about a new strain of the novel coronavirus. The country will also place all international arrivals from United Kingdom in a 14-day quarantine and conduct an additional virus test at the time of the quarantine being lifted, according to health authorities. The measure takes effect immediately, according to health authorities.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201226075508/https://en.yna.co.kr/view/AEN20201223004400320
notes_C4: Previous directive of Stage 2.5 in metropolitan areas and Stage 2 in non-metropolitcan areas will be extended for two further weeks until January 17. In addition, measures to ban private gatherings from 5 people will be expanded nationwide and implemented for the two weeks.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210102055818/http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=362858&contSeq=362858&board_id=&gubun=ALL
notes_C1: On December 24, "The Gyeonggi Provincial Office of Education has decided to extend distance learning for all kindergarten, elementary, middle and high school students until the end of February. (...) Schools in the province were set to resume face-to-face classes in January."  Source: https://archive.vn/PAPc9
notes_H6: Facemasks are compulsory in public places and on public transport. Failure to wear a mask can result in a fine of up to 100,000 Korean Won (£66).    South Korea is currently at level 1 on its five-level national social distancing scale. Under this level facemasks are compulsory in most public places and on transport, and local authorities are able to impose their own restrictions in some circumstances.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109100146/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/south-korea/coronavirus
notes_C2: A three-stage system is designed by assuming life quarantine (stage 1), regional outbreaks (1.5, 2nd stage), and national outbreaks (2.5, 3rd stages), and up to stage 2, which is a local epidemic, steps centered around the outbreak zone. Currently, Step 1 is the status quo, with metropolitan areas having less than 100 cases on a daily average, other areas having less than 30, and Gangwon and Jeju less than 10.     At Step 1, it is recommended to implement an appropriate ratio for each institution and department (e.g., 1/5 of the total number of employees).    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109103001/http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=360602&contSeq=360602&board_id=&gubun=ALL
notes_E2: On March 17, 2020, the National Assembly Strategy and Finance Committee made an announcement on the “Amendment to the Restriction of Special Taxation Act” to minimize and to overcome the economic impact due to COVID-19.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200618215120/https://www.rsm.global/korea/tax-benefits-due-covid-19-korea  South Korean authorities in March 2020 approved tax relief in an effort to address the impact of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200618215233/https://home.kpmg/us/en/home/insights/2020/04/tnf-korea-tax-relief-includes-reduced-rates-temporary-increased-deductions.html
notes_E1: Quotation: "President Moon Jae-in announced Monday during a meeting with a special task force that the government will pay about $820 to all households except for those in the top 30% income bracket, bringing the total amount to $7.4 billion."  Link: https://www.voanews.com/science-health/coronavirus-outbreak/s-korea-offer-emergency-payments-help-ease-impact-covid-19
notes_C3: New Year events and holiday parties organized by in facilities such as hotels, ballrooms, and guesthouses are prohibited.    https://archive.vn/TmagY    In Busan, singing practice halls, indoor concert halls, and direct sales promotion halls are banned after 9pm starting today, December 1st.    https://archive.vn/d29d7
notes_C6: The two weeks from September 28 to October 11, when the Chuseok holiday begins, are planned to be set as a special quarantine period for the whole country and strengthen quarantine management in consideration of the high risk aspect. In religious facilities, all religious activities, including worship, mass, and court, should be conducted non-face-to-face, and that all face-to-face meetings, events, and group meals should be refrained.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201003225816/http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=360146&contSeq=360146&board_id=&gubun=ALL   http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=359862&contSeq=359862&board_id=&gubun=ALL (link can’t be archived)

name: Kuwait
notes_H1: From 18 Feb, the government has ramped up its public information activities in a coordinated manner.  On 18 Feb, the Ministry of Health allocated a hotline for citizens to answer any queries. A protocol of cooperation between Kuwait National Guard and Ministry of Health media office was activated on the same day to enhance awareness of the National Guard.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504120433/http://www.arabtimesonline.com/news/hotline-allocated-to-answer-inquiries-on-coronavirus/  On 12 March, the government launched a website with all the latest updates and information.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504120229/https://www.kuna.net.kw/ArticleDetails.aspx?id=2877656&Language=en  The Kuwait Ministry of Health has also been also providing regular updates in Arabic and English on its Twitter feed.
notes_H3: /web/20200409143715/https://twitter.com/KUWAIT_MOH/status/1236360623921008647  Screening to all people in contact with travelers.
notes_H2: 'The Ministry of Health is randomly testing citizens and residents daily as part of its measures to curb COVID-19. Detailed instructions will be sent to those selected for a COVID swab via text message.'    https://web.archive.org/web/20201013195918/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: U.S Embassy in Kuwait reports that no restrictions currently exist in relation to inter-city and inter-state travel.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201017080651/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: "On entry to Kuwait you will need to self-isolate for 14 days in your home," as well as supply a PCR test conducted 96 hours before entry.   Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200831221604/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kuwait
notes_C4: Kuwait reopens mosques after months of coronavirus closure.  http://archive.fo/muGeK
notes_C1: On Feb 26, the Ministry of Education announced universities and schools would be suspended for a period of 2 weeks starting 01 March. /web/20200409075927/https://twitter.com/MOEKUWAIT/status/1232659575565885447  Kuwait has further extended the closure of schools and universities, with the latest update on 20 March when the government announced suspension until August 4.  Education Minister Saud Al-Harbi said the decision applies to public and private schools, and that teachers will be paid with full salaries in the duration of the suspension.  The minister said the next school year will begin in December 2020."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200426194131/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1644186/middle-east
notes_H6: 18th May 2020, Kuwait imposes mandatory wearing of masks in public, the country’s health ministry has revealed those who fail to adhere to the strict guidelines could be looking at up to three months in prison or be hit with fines of up to $16,200 (5,000 dinars).    https://web.archive.org/web/20200915055927/https://www.arabianbusiness.com/culture-society/446880-kuwait-imposes-mandatory-wearing-of-masks-in-public
notes_C2: Kuwait began the second phase of easing Covid-19 restrictions across the country on June 30, with malls, restaurants and cafes, and public parks reopening after a closure of more than three months.Public and private sectors can operate with a maximum of 30 per cent capacity.
notes_E2: Suspension of loan payments  https://www.zawya.com/mena/en/business/story/Loan_payment_collection_postponed_in_Kuwait_for_six_months-SNG_173867630/  postpone social security contributions for 6 months for private sector companies;    (ii) remove government fees on selected sectors provided that savings are passed on to customers;  https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: "3. Establishing a mechanism to secure the minimum income that ensures facing the cost of living for workers affected by the current crisis and linked to contracts    4. Support the salaries of those under Chapter 5 in social Security in the affected sectors.    5. Assist owners of small, medium, industrial and agricultural projects by postponing the installments funded by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprises Development and the agricultural finance portfolio in the Industrial Park    6. Providing loans on concessional and long term to small and medium enterprises, through joint financing from local banks and the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise (SME) Development"  https://web.archive.org/web/20200501022530/https://www.kuna.net.kw/ArticleDetails.aspx?id=2882522&Language=en
notes_C3: https://gulfbusiness.com/kuwait-begins-phased-plan-to-reopen-economy-over-a-million-expats-remain-in-lockdown/ mosques reopen but Friday prayers are not allowed. Public events remained cancelled
notes_C6: July 28 2020 onward, Kuwait Authorities announce third phase of COVID-19 reopening of economy.    It is imperative that all activities asses their ability to work remotely and that these activities adhere to this throughout the pandemic period, regardless of the overall risk level. If you are not able to work completely remotely, you can apply working remotely partially.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200810225430/https://corona.e.gov.kw/Re-Open-PhaseIII-En.pdf
notes_C5: July 28 2020 onward, Kuwait Authorities announce third phase of COVID-19 reopening of economy.  Reopening Taxi Services (Permitted to One Passenger Only).    https://web.archive.org/web/20200810225430/https://corona.e.gov.kw/Re-Open-PhaseIII-En.pdf
notes_H7: Everyone can sign up for the vaccine for free, but the elderly, healthcare workers and clinically vulnerable people are given priority.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210105002053if_/https://gulfnews.com/world/gulf/kuwait/kuwait-all-citizens-to-get-covid-19-vaccine-for-free-1.75488993  https://web.archive.org/web/20210105002646/https://gulfnews.com/world/gulf/kuwait/covid-19-more-than-1000-people-vaccinated-on-1st-day-in-kuwait-1.76123900

name: Laos
notes_H1: The Prime Minister Exective order mentions about public awareness  through departments and official media. The Exective order implementation is from 30th March.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200618220009/https://www.norway.no/en/vietnam/norway-vietnam/news-and-events/order-of-laos-prime-minister//
notes_H3: Appears to be comprehensive: https://web.archive.org/web/20200619232042/https://laotiantimes.com/2020/04/12/laos-confirms-19th-case-of-covid-19-infection/ http://web.archive.org/web/20200619232100/https://www.who.int/news-room/feature-stories/detail/support-for-lao-pdr-s-response-to-covid-19
notes_H2: The WHO report shows that the testing capacity is enhanced. Tests are being conducted everyday and there are no reports of laboratory or case reporting backlogs.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.who.int/laos/internal-publications-detail/covid-19-situation-report-for-lao-pdr-12-21---27-august-2020
notes_C7: "The government has lifted travel restrictions to enable people to travel freely around the country as Laos eases more Covid-19 prevention measures to minimise the impact on livelihoods and the economy." https://web.archive.org/web/20200526102008/http://www.vientianetimes.org.la/freeContent/FreeConten_Travel_93.php
notes_C8: All land border crossings and international flights to/from Laos remain closed with the exception of sporadic international flights (often to Seoul, South Korea) and weekly UN humanitarian flights (Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia). Domestic flights continue.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201129203136/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: https://web.archive.org/web/20200714024005/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/laos/coronavirus  FCO travel advice  Social gatherings, weddings and traditional events are now permitted as long as COVID-19 prevention measures and social distancing of 1m are in place.
notes_C1: schools/universities are open    http://web.archive.org/web/20201129203136/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Facial masks are mandatory required when stepping out of house  Social distancing of one to two meters must be observed    Reference:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201024141830/http:/www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-09/30/c_139409766.htm
notes_C2: Covid-19 prevention measures in place since July will continue until 31 August, including the closure of entertainment venues such as karaoke bars, nightclubs, and internet cafes.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200812103542/https://laotiantimes.com/2020/07/31/laos-updates-covid-19-prevention-measures-grounds-charter-flights/
notes_E2: Recent mitigation policies include income tax exemption for both civil servants and employees of private sector with income less than 5 million kip per month for three months; profit tax exemption for microenterprises with annual income between 50-400 million kip for three months; duty fee exemption for imports of goods to be used towards the outbreak; deferring tax collection from tourism related businesses for three months; postponing mandatory contribution to social security by affected businesses for three months and extending the submission of the 2019 financial report (annual tax filing) by two months and road tax payment by three months.    Measures include, establishing a separate task force to address the economic impact of COVID-19. A new electricity tariff, to ensure supply of electricity, in effect from May 1, 2020 through December 31, 2025, is in place.     https://archive.vn/SIeH1
notes_E1: The government has agreed to compensate 60 percent of workers’ salary, who currently participates in the Social Security Scheme, and has had their work suspended during May and June 2020.  https://archive.vn/SIeH1
notes_C3: Public transportation has resumed operation. Restaurants, grocery stores, and schools/universities are open, and large gatherings and religious ceremonies are permitted. Entertainment venues such as karaoke lounges are opened.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201129203136/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Everyone is now allowed out, but face-masks must be worn and everyone must "maintain a physical distance of at least one meter from each other". https://web.archive.org/web/20200526095640/https://www.thestar.com.my/news/regional/2020/05/05/laos-reopening-businesses-after-no-virus-cases-for-23-consecutive-days
notes_C5: Under the latest announcement, all forms of interprovincial public transport by land, water and air may resume operation, as well as trading and services businesses.    LinKhttps://web.archive.org/web/20200606105442/https://sigma.com.mt/latest-news/casinos-remain-closed-as-laos-eases-lockdown-measures/

name: Lebanon
notes_H1: I could not find a specific date for an official public campaign beginning, but given that on Mar 6 the Health Minister stated "Lebanon is no longer in Coronavirus containment stage", and that on the same day the first domestic restrictions got into place, this seems like the proper time point.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504213031/https://www.lbcgroup.tv/news/d/news-bulletin-reports/505703/health-minister-hassan-lebanon-is-no-longer-in-cor/en
notes_H3: https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.middleeastmonitor.com/20200221-lebanon-confirms-first-case-of-coronavirus-2-more-suspected/
notes_H2: Lebanon has a mixed approach to testing with symptomatic and eligible ppl able to access testing + population level random testing of ppl without symptoms or eligibility to attempt to estimate the population level of infection.     /web/20200608224645/https://www.executive-magazine.com/economics-policy/healthcare/coronavirus/testing-for-covid-19-in-lebanon On April 20, the Ministry of Public Health began population screening or what they called “random testing” (though it is not so random, see below) in different areas of Lebanon. "
notes_C7: From 21st August 2020, Lebanon has reinstated a nationwide curfew from 1800-0600 daily, during which internal movement will also be restricted (with the exception of travelling to and from the airport).   https://web.archive.org/web/20200826165912/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Authorities plan to resume commercial flights at Beirut-Rafic Hariri International Airport (BEY) beginning July 1 but with a reduced operating capacity of 10 percent compared to that of July 2019. Private flights to and from BEY are scheduled to resume June 24. Passengers will be tested for COVID-19 upon arrival and notified of their test result within 24 hours. In the event of a positive test result, affected travelers will be required to self-quarantine in accordance with instructions from the Ministry of Health. Non-residents traveling to Lebanon are required to have a valid health insurance policy for the duration of their trip. Passenger travel at BEY, regional airports, and all seaports was initially suspended March 18. It is unclear if regional airports and seaports will also resume passenger travel July 1.  web/20200709165814/https://www.worldaware.com/covid-19-alert-lebanon-plans-reopen-nightclubs-public-parks-flea-markets-beginning-june-21
notes_C4: A nationwide lockdown will come into effect in Lebanon from 5am on Saturday 14 November 2020, until 5am on 30 November to prevent the spread of COVID-19. Hospitality businesses will be closed and public and private gatherings banned.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114120947/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lebanon/coronavirus    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114121008/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: A nationwide lockdown will come into effect in Lebanon from 5am on Saturday 14 November 2020, until 5am on 30 November to prevent the spread of COVID-19. Public institutions and schools will close.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114120947/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lebanon/coronavirus    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114121008/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Fabric masks covering the mouth and nose must be worn when outside the home and in vehicles (unless travelling alone, or exercising).    Masks are required outdoors in all public spaces.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114121008/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114120947/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lebanon/coronavirus
notes_C2: From 21st August 2020, malls, gyms and restaurants will be closed, although restaurants will be permitted to make deliveries 0600-1800. Grocery stores will be allowed to operate from 0600-1700.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200826165912/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: Extension of deadlines for paying taxes and utility bills, banks are allowed to extend 5yr no interest loans./web/20200611013320/https://www.hrw.org/news/2020/04/08/lebanon-direct-covid-19-assistance-hardest-hit
notes_C3: From 21st August, all public events are banned.  2020https://web.archive.org/web/20200826165912/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: "Lebanon has declared a state of emergency from 14 – 25 January 2021 due to the rise in number of COVID-19 cases. A total curfew will be in place from 5am on 14 January until 5am on 25 January. Movement is completely prohibited – you must not leave your accommodation. All hospitality businesses and public institutions will close. There are some exemptions for essential work. Food delivery services will be allowed to operate between 5am and 5pm.    "The Lebanese government have introduced an online system where you can request an exemption from the curfew for essential purposes e.g. going to a pharmacy. "  Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118232851/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lebanon/coronavirus
notes_C5: Is public transportation operating? Yes, with limits on capacity.  Masks are required at all times outdoors and in public spaces.    Movement of personal and public vehicles on roadways will be restricted due to lockdown starting from 14 Nov 2020. Taxi services will remain open though you are advised to book ahead.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114120947/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lebanon/coronavirus    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114121008/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Liberia
notes_H1: No change in policy, however there is no evidence of a coordinated public campaign. The Ministry of Health Facebook page hasn't posted about COVID-19 since August.  https://www.facebook.com/moh.gov.lr
notes_H3: "Liberia, hard hit by the Ebola epidemic in 2014, was one of the first countries to start screening for Covid-19 at airports and to adopt other control measures, such as rapid testing, complete contact tracing and quarantine."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210111204228/https://www.wsj.com/articles/which-countries-have-responded-best-to-covid-19-11609516800
notes_H2: "For all non-travelers, sample collection is free."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210111202132/http://moh.gov.lr/
notes_C7: The Revised Declaration (July 23rd)  (See C2 note for additional context) does not have any restrictions on internal movement. [1] Nor is there any reference to internal movement restrictions on the Ministry of Health website [2] or any proclamations from the President since the state of emergency expired on July 21st, 2020.     [1] https://web.archive.org/web/20210104065732/http://moh.gov.lr/press-release/2020/revised-covid-19-declaration-of-national-health-emergency-by-the-ministry-of-health/  [2] https://web.archive.org/web/20210104203113/http://moh.gov.lr/
notes_C8: Quarantine Information:  Are U.S. citizens required to quarantine? No  All arriving passengers who have not been tested at point of departure will be required to take a rapid test and a PCR swab at the airport upon arrival in Liberia.  In the event of a positive rapid test result, the passenger will be taken to a government-designated Precautionary Observation Center (POC) pending the final PCR test result.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201018193504/https://lr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: LARGE GATHERINGS INCLUDING PARTIES OF MORE THAN 10 PEOPLE, SPORTING EVENTS, WEDDINGS, AND FUNERALS ARE ALLOWED PROVIDED PERSONS IN ATTENDENCE FOLLOW THE HEALTH PROTOCOLS LISTED IN COUNT 1 ABOVE.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201018192601/https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=1026786474444887&id=699881103802094
notes_C1: Schools reopened on Dec 1, and after a brief closure for elections, classes resumed on Dec 10.     School session began on Dec 1.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201222082442/http://moe-liberia.org/ministry-of-education-releases-revised-academic-calendar-for-2020-2021-school-year/
notes_H6: On April 24, on the advice of health professionals, the president extended the stay-at-home order’s application period and geography (to all 15 counties in the country). During this time, residents may leave their homes only to procure food or health items, an activity limited to one person per household for a maximum of one hour, so long as the person does not venture out of his or her local area. Anyone in public must wear a face-mask. See: https://blogs.loc.gov/law/2020/05/liberia-government-measures-to-contain-the-spread-of-covid-19/ (accessed 14th September 2020, web archive unavailable)
notes_C2: State of emergency extended for 2 more weeks. The President said restaurants, stores selling food commodities, dry goods, building materials and electronic appliances, will be allowed to open, provided they take in 25% of their full occupancy at a time while observing social distancing.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200603170556/https://www.liberianobserver.com/news/compulsory-covid-19-testing-for-curfew-violators/     https://web.archive.org/web/20200603171219/https://www.liberianobserver.com/news/state-of-emergency-extended-for-yet-another-two-weeks/
notes_C3: Still in place.    SPORTING EVENTS, WEDDINGS, AND FUNERALS ARE ALLOWED PROVIDED PERSONS IN ATTENDENCE FOLLOW THE HEALTH PROTOCOLS LISTED IN COUNT 1 ABOVE.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201018192601/https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=1026786474444887&id=699881103802094
notes_C6: The Revised Declaration (July 23rd)  (See C2 note for additional context) specifies that people must stay home when sick, but does not recommend the general public stay home. [1] Additionally, the ministry of health website does not include healthy people staying home as a recommendation to prevent catching COVID-19. [2]    [1] https://web.archive.org/web/20210104065732/http://moh.gov.lr/press-release/2020/revised-covid-19-declaration-of-national-health-emergency-by-the-ministry-of-health/  [2] https://web.archive.org/web/20210104203113/http://moh.gov.lr/
notes_C5: 17th March    To ensure public safety, the Ministry of Transport and LNP have agreed that the full enforcement of the preventive measures shall commence effective on March 17, 2020.    Public Transport- taxis should carry no more than two passengers in the back and one in the front. motorbike/pempem should carry only one passenger.      https://web.archive.org/web/20200603180000/https://www.liberianobserver.com/news/mot-announces-preventive-measures-for-public-transport/    https://web.archive.org/web/20200603175325/https://emansion.gov.lr/doc/COVID-19%20Declaration%20of%20National%20Health%20Emergency%20-%20MoH.pdf

name: Libya
notes_H1: 24th March        National Centre for Disease Control publishes advice on coronavirus on website  http://web.archive.org/web/20200607170234/https://ncdc.org.ly/Ar/coronavirus-covid-19/  http://archive.vn/gKdkM
notes_H3: Coding change as I am unable to find any contract tracing info for Libra. Prior notes from coders refers to testing labs and not contact tracing
notes_H2: 21 March 2020 - WHO confirms coronavirus testing in Libya is conducted properly  http://archive.vn/HmFOD
notes_C7: Libya's land, sea, and air borders are closed to all except essential traffic.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201221144124if_/https://visalist.io/emergency/lockdown/libya-country
notes_C8: Libya resumes flight to Turkey on 27 July.    http://archive.vn/xONCB
notes_C4: The Libyan Presidential Council of the Government of National Accord (GNA) has announced a curfew across Libya starting March 22 from 6.00 p.m. to 6.00 a.m. over concerns about Coronavirus possible outbreak. "All mosques, education institutions, cafes, restaurants, wedding halls, parks, clubs and shops will be closed and funerals and weddings as well as public transports will be banned."   http://archive.vn/xQyIN
notes_C1: Schools are fully open with precautionary measures in place.    https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse (link is not getting archived)
notes_H6: Wear a mask to keep your nose and mouth covered when in public settings.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201108111919/https://wwwnc.cdc.gov/travel/notices/warning/coronavirus-libya    It is mandatory to wear face masks when out in public. Fines will be given to those who do not comply.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201108112323/https://visalist.io/emergency/lockdown/libya-country
notes_C2: The total lockdown in Tripoli was scheduled to end on 8 Oct. Given the next day that mosques in and around the Libyan capital city have been authorised to reopen, the complete lockdown should not have been extended.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201010160547/https://www.worldaware.com/warning-alert-authorities-libya-maintaining-varied-levels-covid-19-related-restrictions
notes_C3: Public, cultural, sports and social events are banned.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201108112323if_/https://visalist.io/emergency/lockdown/libya-country
notes_C6: Libya's Tripoli-based internationally recognized Government of National Accord (GNA) has regularly imposed complete lockdowns of varying durations - typically four to seven days - in the capital city due to a rise in COVID-19 cases. Further similar measures could be imposed in the coming days and weeks, depending on the disease activity. Authorities have also regularly ordered the closure of stores, except those that provide essential goods and services. When no lockdown is in effect, officials impose implement a nightly 2100-0600 curfew during the week, with a 24-hour curfew on Fridays and Saturdays.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201216234250/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/416711/libya-various-levels-of-coronavirus-related-restrictions-remain-in-effect-as-of-dec-16-update-19
notes_C5: 22nd March The Libyan Presidential Council of the Government of National Accord (GNA) has announced a curfew across Libya starting March 22 from 6.00 p.m. to 6.00 a.m. over concerns about Coronavirus possible outbreak. "All mosques, education institutions, cafes, restaurants, wedding halls, parks, clubs and shops will be closed and funerals and weddings as well as public transports will be banned.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200812112702/https://www.libyaobserver.ly/news/curfew-600-pm-600-am-announced-gna-libya-amid-coronavirus-fears http://web.archive.org/web/20200812112648/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/latest-on-coronavirus-outbreak/libya-confirms-first-death-from-covid-19/1790439

name: Sri Lanka
notes_H1: From 14 March, Sri Lanka announcements start increasing. Since then the President and Ministry of Health have been quite active on social media. This continued throughout the nationwide curfew which started on 20 March.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200504162625/http://www.epid.gov.lk/web/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=225&Itemid=487&lang=en  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504163456/https://twitter.com/gotabayar  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504163534/https://twitter.com/moh_srilanka  https://web.archive.org/web/20200408194539/https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/coronavirus-sri-lanka-bans-public-events-as-cases-rises-to-8/article31069806.ece  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504143121/https://www.deccanherald.com/international/coronavirus-sri-lanka-to-lift-nationwide-curfew-on-april-27-829717.html
notes_H3: Government issues initial testing and contact tracing protocols. https://web.archive.org/web/20200329223450/http://www.epid.gov.lk/web/images/pdf/Circulars/Corona_virus/revisionsummary.pdf
notes_H2: LKA updates testing policy, lists a number of cases for tests. Confirmed contact or prior travel to risk region no longer required for tests. https://web.archive.org/web/20200408202059/http://www.epid.gov.lk/web/images/pdf/Circulars/Corona_virus/scan164.pdf
notes_C7: Traveling in and out of industrial zones within the country seem to have targeted movement restrictions:  Nov 02, 2020: www.newsfirst.lk: "Sri Lanka Police introduced a Quarantine Curfew Pass application to be filled by those who require passes in order to resume operations at factories and other production centers"  sources:  - https://web.archive.org/web/20201115210122/https://www.newsfirst.lk/2020/11/02/quarantine-curfew-pass-application-for-industries-available-for-download/    other Govt. notices:  - https://covid19.gov.lk/news/economy/issuing-of-curfew-passes.html (WaybackMachine was returning a 502 error when archiving this website)  - https://covid19.gov.lk/news/economy/issuing-of-curfew-passes-export-processing-zones.html (WaybackMachine was returning a 502 error when archiving this website)    However, internal movements across Sri Lanka, in general, seem to have no other concrete measures.  On Nov 9, according to an AP new report, "Passenger trains resumed operating after nearly two weeks and the government lifted a curfew that had been in effect in the capital, Colombo, and its suburbs."  source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201115204723/https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-sri-lanka-asia-arrests-colombo-0511a1a54f569364f2e8bdb901f42c79
notes_C8: "Sri Lanka has decided to ban all flights from the United Kingdom in a bid to prevent the new variant of Covid-19 spreading across South England. President’s Media Division (PMD) said the move will be in effect from today (22 Dec 2020)."  - https://web.archive.org/web/20201223042306/http://www.adaderana.lk/news/70148/sri-lanka-bans-flights-from-uk-over-new-covid-19-variant    - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104110647/https://www.newindianexpress.com/world/2020/dec/22/sri-lanka-on-alert-amid-reports-of-new-coronavirus-strain-2239737.html
notes_C4: Pockets of Sri Lanka continue to be under lockdowns and isolation orders:     Sources:  - AP reported on Nov 09: "[...] the government lifted a curfew that had been in effect in the capital, Colombo, and its suburbs.. Only pockets where infections are high will remain under isolation with no one permitted to enter or leave the area.", https://web.archive.org/web/20201115204723/https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-sri-lanka-asia-arrests-colombo-0511a1a54f569364f2e8bdb901f42c79  - The Hindu, a daily newspaper in India reported on Nov 8, 2020: https://web.archive.org/web/20201115213247/https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/coronavirus-sri-lanka-to-lift-capital-district-lockdown-on-monday/article33052113.ece  "“The curfew which was in force on the Western province will be lifted at 5 a.m. tomorrow”, Army Commander Shavendra Silva, who heads the national operations center to prevent COVID-19, said. However, Silva said that several areas in the province would still be under isolation.  The capital city and the adjoining Gampaha district was under quarantine curfew continuously over the last 10 days."
notes_C1: "**Schools re-open today except in Western Province, isolated areas**  Education Minister Prof. G. L. Peris yesterday said that schools will be reopened for grade 2–13 students in all parts of the country today except schools in the Western province and isolated areas. He said that the Ministry arrived at this decision after taking all measures to ensure the health security of the students. Addressing a press conference in Colombo yesterday, the Minister said that reopening of schools from Grade 2 – 13 will take place today on a plan made by the Ministry."    - https://web.archive.org/web/20210119024202/https://dailynews.lk/2021/01/11/local/238439/schools-re-open-today-except-western-province-isolated-areas-minister
notes_H6: "Everyone needs to have their personal hand sanitation bottle and their masks worn at all times outside the house. "    https://archive.fo/Fiv2b    http://web.archive.org/web/20200830173154/https://hpb.health.gov.lk/media/pdf/wearing-masks.pdf
notes_C2: Targeted lockdowns continue in Sri Lanka, with closures schools, workplaces, public gatherings and restriction on the number of people who can gather, and curfew-style stay-at-home restrictions.     "Dec 17 2020: COLOMBO: Nazeerwatte in the Wellawatte Police Area has been placed under isolation with immediate effect to stop the spread of Covid 19."  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104103453/https://www.newsfirst.lk/2020/12/17/nazeerwatte-in-wellawatte-placed-under-isolation/    "Dec 24 2020: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka (AP) — Sri Lankan authorities on Thursday imposed lockdown on three towns on the outskirts of the capital to contain the spread of COVID-19 during the festive season.  Kosgama, Awissawella and Ruwanwella, about 60 kilometers (37 miles) east of Colombo, were locked down from Thursday noon.  Lockdowns have been applied in dozens of towns and villages since a resurgence of the coronavirus in the Indian Ocean island nation in October. Schools and key public offices have been closed, public gatherings banned and restrictions imposed on public transport.   The two clusters that emerged in October — one centered on a garment factory and other on a fish market — account for most of Sri Lanka’s outbreak. The confirmed cases from the two clusters have grown to 34,959 on Thursday. Sri Lanka’s total since March is about 38,600."  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104102936/https://apnews.com/article/sri-lanka-coronavirus-pandemic-asia-colombo-asia-pacific-18179ff86b01754480fb3bd2beff8f9b    Other location-specific lockdown press releases (from the middle of December through early January):  - notes_E2: MONETARY AND MACRO-FINANCIAL  The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has reduced monetary policy rates by 100 basis points since March. The required reserve ratio on domestic currency deposits of commercial banks has been lowered by one percentage point, the liquidity coverage ratio and net stable funding ratios have been reduced to 90 percent and the rate at which CBSL grants advances to commercial banks has been lowered by 500 basis points. Commercial banks cannot declare dividends, share buy backs or increase payments to directors until end-2020. The President announced a debt repayment moratorium, which includes a six month moratorium on bank loans for the tourism, garment, plantation and IT sectors, and small & medium industries, with reduced rate working capital loans and investment-purpose loans for these sectors. There will also be a three-month moratorium on small-value personal banking and leasing loans. The interest rate on credit cards will be capped, for transactions up to a certain amount, with a reduction in the minimum monthly repayment. Financial institutions are also requested to reschedule non-performing loans. Lower capital conservation buffer requirements and a relaxation of loan classification rules have been announced. In addition, state-owned institutions will invest in treasury securities to stabilize the money market rate at 7 percent.    http://archive.fo/nKJdw
