notes_C2: Poland will close restaurants and bars for two weeks.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201027185141/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia
notes_E2: According to the announcement of the Polish government:  - 90% reduction rents for tenants of premises and the so-called islands in shopping malls, as long as these facilities are prohibited from operating normally;  - exemption from charging contractual penalties for - related to the epidemic - delays in the execution of tenders;  - enabling municipalities to refrain from charging real estate tax on companies that have lost their liquidity due to the coronavirus epidemic.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200507081400/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/tarcza
notes_E1: Note: New 2020 budget - Wage subsidies for employees of affected businesses and self-employed persons. Businesses, regardless of their size, may apply for a three-month subsidy in the event of work stoppages or reduced working time. This subsidy covers social insurance contributions, and it ranges from 50 to 90 percent of the minimum wage for each employee, depending on recorded decrease in turnover in 2020. The subsidy includes furloughed employees. See: [web archive unavailable, accessed 28th September 2020]
notes_C3: https://web.archive.org/web/20201027185141/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia
notes_C6: The following restrictions will come into effect on Saturday, October 24:     - The entire territory of Poland will become a 'red' zone;     - Restaurant activity will be limited for two weeks to serving only takeaway food;    - Grades four to eight in elementary schools will switch to remote learning;     - Secondary schools and higher learning institutions will switch to remote learning.    - Between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m., children under the age of 16 will be allowed to leave their homes only in the company of an adult;    - Spectators will be banned from sporting events;    - There will be a 25-percent cap on audiences at all cultural events;    - Swimming pools, aquaparks and fitness clubs will be closed;    - Sanatoria will be closed;    - The number of people at retail premises of up to 100 square metres will be capped at five per checkout;     - The number of customers in retail premises above 100 square metres will be limited to one person per 15 square metres;    - Public transport will be limited to 50 percent of seating capacity or 30 percent of total capacity;    - Gatherings of more than five people will be banned, except for people living together in one home;    - Persons aged 70 and above are to encouraged to stay at home, apart from performing their professional activities, meeting their essential daily needs and participating in religious ceremonies.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201027185141/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia
notes_C5: https://web.archive.org/web/20201027185141/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia
notes_H7: The Polish Vaccine roll out begins on the 30th of December. Medics, social workers, uniformed services, teachers and senior citizens are the first groups to get the jab (groups A and C). The current vaccination on offer is the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccination.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210101162924/https://www.thefirstnews.com/article/poland-receives-first-covid-19-vaccines---pm-18660

name: Puerto Rico
notes_H1: Public information campaigns were publicized by the Department of Health of Puerto Rico since March 2:  https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=661482714669484  The videos are available in the Facebook account of the Department: https://web.archive.org/web/20200803151642/https://www.facebook.com/deptsaludpr/?__tn__=kC-R&eid=ARC3Vwj74KwE9-GMzQeZkNJ_1hj5gfYxoCy6PtAVUUgwqza0HttA5YBU6Bn8XwEhMGWbFm6Eaj8qlUsQ&hc_ref=ARSt2fHLxygDFAEJ6R6xPuHgB7pbLLqLKkxYPNo6ooSUNKrodY5H2fiX7V8m8blvv44&fref=nf&__xts__%5B0%5D=68.ARC8cC1Mns5OgVSuEFm1KM7WD1VZ3NRbP6GB8cATeggM5F_JHj3snzo05ASvH6WeMq3aXI5vca0EXWjF89QAXgAgkgyCkGlFXOaQHXJQr3qUJhZigCB18Va7y2quZ2EAZbOkPAX4Jft_ILwqn_1JLK0NrztGTBnFBlC7sE9avFXurNkCvBV7V5mbkFZyjAV1H9sjCAqkGnGYqw9mZpMHt70Xl7syN-EKGK-mMDeTSSd6MaW3-aWWFhm_lVSaDDIySJ4lP81CMdYZyE8ji5omB-NCVZH4bOK4vEwdWaGo29iZEocbzl7aeHdDEoF4Xmj5NyrMj72vF01Kl-oWjUJWp6t6mA Another example from April 5, here: https://web.archive.org/web/20200803151927/https://www.telemundopr.com/fotosyvideos/asi-fue-la-campana-de-prevencion-contra-el-covid-19/2067138/
notes_H3: Protocol for contact tracing prepared by the Task Force by the end of March. See pages 23 - 38. https://web.archive.org/web/20200506105240/https://covid19tf.rcm.upr.edu/wp-content/uploads/sites/45/2020/04/INFORME-DEL-GRUPO-DE-TRABAJO-DE-VIGILANCIA-EPIDEMIOL%C3%93GICA-DEL-COMIT%C3%89-EJECUTIVO-DEL-ASESOR%C3%8DA-M%C3%89DICA_COVID-19-4.16.20.pdf
notes_H2: In a sharp change from earlier policy, Puerto Rico now has free roadside testing available that explicitly targets asymptomatic people. This service is only available on weekends.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201108143315/https://www.nbcnews.com/news/latino/puerto-rico-will-provide-free-covid-testing-toll-booths-n1246836
notes_C7: No evident policy change. Some internal transport services are reserved for locals only. Ferry service to Vieques remains available to residents only.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201116183439/https://www.discoverpuertorico.com/info/travel-guidelines
notes_C8: I would disagree with the previous coding, noting that international restrictions are applied at the Federal level, and that travelers from other states are not banned from entering; they are, however, required to present evidence of a negative test.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201130004557/https://www.discoverpuertorico.com/info/travel-guidelines
notes_C4: No evident policy change.  All mass activities, both in open and enclosed spaces, including parades, caravans and analogous activities that propose the crowding of people are disallowed under penalty of non-compliance with the provisions of this Order.  (translated using Google Translate)    Amount of people considered a "crowding" is unclear.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201116194236/https://www.estado.pr.gov/en/executive-orders/  OE-2020-077 Seccion 13ra  OE-2020-080 Seccion 15ta
notes_C1: Verified and recoded Lucy Goodfellow’s original data:  “School closures announced, Saturday 14th March, technically in place 16th March (14th, 15th are weekend).”    https://web.archive.org/web/20200803090527/https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/15/us/coronavirus-puerto-rico.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20200415124929/https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/live-blog/coronavirus-updates-live-house-approves-coronavirus-aid-bill-n1158821/ncrd1158961
notes_H6: Everyone must wear a mask, scarf, or cloth face covering when visiting any establishment that is authorized to be open to the public. Failure to comply may result in a misdemeanor, a penalty of imprisonment not to exceed 6 months, or a fine of no more than $5,000, or both.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200925064345/https://www.astho.org/StatePublicHealth/Rundown-of-State-and-Territorial-COVID-19-Mask-Requirements/07-09-20/
notes_C2: As part of the Executive Order 2020-062 (20 August), the Governor announced a the start of a 24-hour lockdown every Sunday until 11 September. During these days, only pharmacies, grocery stores, gas stations, and hardware stores will be allowed to open.  * Official decree (see 2020-062, page 37) http://web.archive.org/web/20200831194511/https://www.estado.pr.gov/en/executive-orders/  * Other sources http://web.archive.org/web/20200831184222/https://cnnespanol.cnn.com/video/puerto-rico-decreta-cuarentena-total-los-domingos/
notes_E2: Since March 16: “Payment plans moratorium. Taxpayers economically affected by COVID-19 and the closure order will not be required to follow the terms of a payment plan between the period March 16, 2020, and April 30, 2020. The PRTD will not be imposing interest and penalties for non-compliance with the payment plans. If there is a notice for interest and penalties, the taxpayer may submit a request to eliminate such charges.”  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501022500/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/puerto-rico-tax-developments-in-response-to-covid-19.html  Since March 23: “From Monday, March 23 through June 30, 2020, no income tax shall be withheld on payments for services rendered as required under Section 1062.03 of the PR IRC related to services rendered by residents of Puerto Rico carried out. This exemption will apply regardless of whether the recipient has a total or partial release of this withholding tax. AD 20-10 clarifies that this withholding exemption does not exempt the recipient from any income tax on the amounts received and the withholding agent of the reporting requirements for the amounts paid”. Here's the link:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501020455/https://www.hlb.global/puerto-rico-tax-and-financial-measures-associated-with-covid-19/  Sine March 23: “No penalties will be imposed for missing or insufficient estimated tax payments, which are required by individuals and corporations for tax year 2020; the penalties will not be imposed if the first and second installment payments are timely made in equal amounts by the due dates of the next two estimated installments, together with the corresponding estimated income tax payments due. Withholding agents are not required to do the 10% income tax withholding at source on payments for services performed, but the service provider may choose to have the withholding continue; the waiver from the withholding is temporary during the period from 23 March 2020 to 30 June 2020.” Here's the link:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501022937/https://www.ey.com/en_gl/tax-alerts/puerto-rico-s-treasury-department-announces-additional-extensions-for-various-returns-and-payments-and-provides-special-cash-flow-tax-relief-measures-because-of-covid-19  “"The Electric Power Authorities (PREPA) and the Aqueduct and Sewer Authority (AAA) cannot suspend the electricity and water service while the executive orders for the emergency are in force by COVID-19.”  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501023705/https://www.efe.com/efe/usa/puerto-rico/normativa-prohibe-el-corte-de-la-luz-y-agua-durante-emergencia-covid-19/50000110-4218441
notes_E1: "Direct payments (“recovery rebates”) to low- and middle-income families. Because Puerto Rico maintains its own tax system,[10] Puerto Rico’s Treasury Department — rather than the U.S. Treasury — will distribute the payments under a plan that the U.S. Treasury approved on May 1.[11] (Puerto Rico will use the same eligibility criteria as the federal government, providing payments of $1,200 for most adults and $500 for children under age 17, with these payments phasing out at higher income levels"     https://web.archive.org/web/20200803155143/https://www.cbpp.org/research/economy/long-in-recession-puerto-rico-needs-more-than-just-covid-19-relief-to-overcome-its
notes_C3: "Section 13 of the Executive Order provides that proposals for virtual concerts and theater activities may be submitted for the approval and authorization of the Governor’s Chief of Staff.     Mass gatherings where the crowding of persons is encouraged are unauthorized by the Executive Order. "    Starting on July 17th, and within permissible curfew hours, only individual sports and recreational training that do not entail physical contact are allowed. Competitive activities of any kind, professional or non-professional, are not allowed during the effectiveness of the Executive Order.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200725085640/http://www.mcvpr.com/newsroom-publications-Executive-Order-EO-2020-054    https://web.archive.org/web/20200725085640/http://www.mcvpr.com/newsroom-publications-Executive-Order-EO-2020-054
notes_C6: As part of the Executive Order 2020-062 (20 August), citizens are allowed to leave their houses to practice exercise and outdoor activities from Monday to Saturday (in non-curfew hours). On Sundays, people are required to stay at home.    * Official decree (see 2020-062, page 33)  http://web.archive.org/web/20200831194511/https://www.estado.pr.gov/en/executive-orders/    * Other sources  http://web.archive.org/web/20200831201234/https://www.elpais.cr/2020/08/19/decreto-de-gobernadora-de-puerto-rico-cierra-playas-por-covid-13/
notes_C5: At latest report, urban transportation remains in operation in Puerto Rico. Some ferry services are reserved for locals only.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201108171318/https://www.discoverpuertorico.com/info/travel-guidelines#:~:text=Travelers%2520entering%2520Puerto%2520Rico%2520must,result%2520or%2520they%2520must%2520quarantine.

name: Portugal
notes_H1: https://twitter.com/DGSaude/status/1221389443623505920    From 26th january on the social medias from Portuguese government have been posting about COVID-19, the symptons and cases when people have to inform the government about returning from a trip.
notes_H3: No updates on how this is being carried out since March.
notes_H2: https://www.americanprogress.org/issues/security/news/2020/04/10/482998/migrant-model-follow-portugals-response-coronavirus/  https://www.themayor.eu/en/porto-opens-first-coronavirus-drive-thru-testing-centre-in-portugal
notes_C7: Individuals should only travel between the islands (Madeira and the Azores) for essential purposes. If one has to travel from São Miguel or Terceira to any of the other islands in the archipelago (Azores), a negative RT-PCR COVID-19 test from, at most, 72 hours before travelling and completing a passenger questionnaire before depart are required.     In mainland Portugal, there are no specific restrictions on mobility to cross land borders but the Government recommends only leaving home only for essential travel (T flag applied since the travel restrictions do not apply).    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210118230326/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/portugal/coronavirus-  http://web.archive.org/web/20210118153435/https://www.visitportugal.com/en/content/covid-19-measures-implemented-portugal
notes_C8: https://www.publico.pt/2020/03/10/economia/noticia/governo-suspende-voos-territorio-italiano-causa-coronavirus-1907157    Portugal suspends flights to Italy.     Bans flights from and to Spain.
notes_C4: In mainland Portugal:  - All public gatherings of over 5 people are prohibited, including in commercial spaces, and cafes. - A maximum of 6 people per group in restaurants are allowed, unless from the same household.  Madeira : A ban on gatherings of more than 5 people is still is in place.  Azores: The government announced that measures of the new state of emergency - in place between November 24 and December 28 - will now apply to the Azores, which was not previously the case. One of the measures included in the decree is the ban on gatherings of more than 6 people, unless they belong to the same household.    Sources:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210119011455/https://observador.pt/2020/11/24/medidas-do-novo-estado-de-emergencia-aplicam-se-nos-acores/ https://web.archive.org/web/20201205203200/https://pt.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/ http://web.archive.org/web/20210119005829/https://www.dnoticias.pt/2020/11/4/222597-proibidos-ajuntamentos-de-mais-de-cinco-pessoas/
notes_C1: "The Regional Government of the Azores announced that it will implement a close off (close off/cerca sanitária in the municipality of Rabo de Peixe, in São Miguel Island, from December 3 at midnight until January 8 at 11:59pm. The announcement was made after a press release that confirmed that schools would close starting on Wednesday, Tuesday, December 2."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210118150604/https://observador.pt/liveblogs/lewis-hamilton-infetado-pelo-novo-coronavirus-vai-falhar-a-proxima-corrida/
notes_H6: I propose to change the coding to 3G since the use of masks outside is mandatory when social distancing is not possible.   Mandatory use of protective masks in closed public spaces.  Mandatory use of protective mask inside workplaces.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201221134211/https://pt.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: No evidence of general closing found.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201221101820/https://covid19estamoson.gov.pt/new-state-of-emergency-measures/
notes_E2: The Portuguese government has approved a moratorium on bank loan repayments for families and companies affected by the coronavirus outbreak and a recent extension until end-September 2021.     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201105150539/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19    The Government will support all families, irrespectively of their income, during the general lockdown (that started on Friday, January 15), by paying 10% of their electricity bills. The measure will cost between 20 and 25 million euros (monthly). For low income families, the reduction in the electricity bill might reach 40%.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210118164726/https://eco.sapo.pt/2021/01/12/governo-apoia-familias-com-cerca-de-10-da-fatura-da-luz/
notes_E1: Government implements an extraordinary income support scheme to workers who need to stay home to take care of dependants and to those who had lost their income due to reduction in economic activity. This is caped at 50% of the income or the minimum wage for informal workers (700 euros per month).    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509072543/http://www.seg-social.pt/apoio-extraordinario-a-reducao-da-atividade-economica-de-trabalhador-independente  "É criado um apoio financeiro excepcional aos trabalhadores por conta de outrem que tenham de ficar em casa a acompanhar os filhos até 12 anos, no valor de 66% da remuneração base (33% a cargo do empregador, 33% a cargo da Segurança Social). Para os trabalhadores independentes, é criado um apoio financeiro excepcional aos que tenham de ficar em casa a acompanhar os filhos até 12 anos, no valor de 1/3 da remuneração média, bem como um apoio extraordinário à redução da atividade económica de trabalhador independente e diferimento do pagamento de contribuições"
notes_C3: No guidance found. But it seems that public events are not taking place.
notes_C6: The Council of Ministers approved stricter measures for three counties in the North region - Lousada, Felgueiras e Paços de Ferreira - that have registered a significant increase in the number of cases. The approved measures include: suspension of visits to care-homes, prohibition of events, duty to stay at home and mandatory teleworking. Rules take effect on Friday, October 23, at midnight.     Citizens should remain at home and refrain from circulating in public spaces and roads, except when the trips are authorized. Individuals are allowed to go out for grocery shopping, work (when teleworking is not possible), health reasons, to assist vulnerable people, attend school, physical activity in open spaces, cultural events, pet walk, among others.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201028111350/https://expresso.pt/coronavirus/2020-10-22-Semi-confinamento-em-Lousada-Felgueiras-e-Pacos-de-Ferreira.-Eis-como-vai-ser--regra-a-regra-
notes_C5: Limits in the number of passengers in public transport to 1/3 of capacity  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509093853/https://www.portugal.gov.pt/download-ficheiros/ficheiro.aspx?v=3f8e87a6-3cf1-4d0c-b5ee-72225a73cd4f     "O estabelecimento da redução do número máximo de passageiros por transporte para um terço do número máximo de lugares disponíveis, por forma a garantir a distância adequada entre os utentes dos transportes"
notes_H7: A,C:      Portugal begins vaccinating frontline health workers on 27 December. News reports and government immunisation dashboard shows that frontline workers and elderly are the two eligible groups currently.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210111135939/https://www.publico.pt/2020/12/23/sociedade/noticia/portugal-recebe-70200-doses-vacina-covid-28-dezembro-1944109    https://archive.vn/m1Bk9

name: Paraguay
notes_H1: Since March 23 the Ministry of Health published campaign materials about COVID::  https://www.mitic.gov.py/noticias/coronavirus-covid19-materiales-de-comunicacion-para-empresas-y-organizaciones   See videos published by the Ministry of Health  here:  https://www.facebook.com/ministeriodesaludparaguay/videos/
notes_H3: As informed previously, the government has kept doing limited contact tracing.
notes_H2: Testing of those who are symptomatic (defined as possessing present three or more symptoms related to the disease: fever, cough, nasal congestion, sore throat, shortness of breath, headache, nausea or vomiting, loss of smell and taste, extreme fatigue or tiredness, or diarrhoea).	  Also welcome to be tested are close contacts of a positive case, regardless of whether they have symptoms.    Source: https://archive.vn/B3rJQ
notes_C7: From 5 October, the government’s announcement ending the ‘social’ and ‘smart’ quarantine phases comes into force. The government has introduced new flexible quarantine measures on a nationwide level.  Inter-departmental circulation is allowed without restrictions.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201019214004/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/paraguay/staying-during-coronavirus
notes_C8: Those entering Paraguay must present a negative COVID-19 PCR test completed within 3 days of entering the country (antibody tests not accepted). The mandatory quarantine for travelers ended on November 16.   source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221212445/https://py.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C4: Social events in the home are limited to 12 people only. Cultural and creative events can have a maximum of 75 people together at one time.   source:  https://archive.vn/Pdt9e
notes_C1: The Minister of Education has?announced?in-person classes will be suspended until December 2020.?? Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200902145858/https://py.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_H6: Beginning 27 Nov 2020, masks are required indoors or outdoors, in public or in private, when 1.5 metre distance cannot be maintained.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201129225824/https://www.mspbs.gov.py/portal/22236/en-vigencia-ley-de-uso-obligatorio-de-mascarilla.html
notes_C2: Non-essential businesses opened provided that health protocols are followed.  source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221212445/https://py.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_E2: No evidence of a policy change.
notes_E1: Ñangareko is a program of monetary transfers of G. 500.000 for the purchase of food and hygiene products. The target population were people with needs (workers or not) and those who did not benefit from other social programs such as Tekopora and pensions for the elderly. The population that started receiving the transfers since March 31. Until April 26, 328.045 individuals were notified of their inclusion in the programme. The monetary assistance was been transferred to 224.001 families.  With the programme the government is replacing less than 50% of lost salary of workers. Here’s the links of the news reports that explain the programme:   http://web.archive.org/web/20200504191513/https://www.lanacion.com.py/pais/2020/03/30/manana-inicia-transferencia-del-programa-nangareko/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200504183917/https://www.abc.com.py/edicion-impresa/suplementos/economico/2020/04/26/asistencia-social-y-la-experiencia-en-el-uso-de-medios-de-pago-electronicos-en-programas-nangareko-y-pytyvo/
notes_C3: Updated webarchive link for original note by Natalia Espinola: Cancelation of public and private events that could result in large gatherings.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200519043603/https://www.presidencia.gov.py/articulo/37709-coronavirus-gobierno-establece-medidas-para-evitar-la-propagacion-.html
notes_C6: In nationwide Phase 2: "The existing isolation order for all persons in Paraguay to remain in their homes except for necessary travel to obtain food, medicine or cleaning supplies is otherwise still in effect."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200626105822/https://py.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C5: Public transportation is operating.All travelers must wear a mask to board public buses.?   The Paraguayan government has authorized up to four persons to travel together in private cars and SUVs and two persons by motorcycle.? This information is still in effect. Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200902145858/https://py.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/

name: Palestine
notes_H1: The state of emergency declaration marks the beginning of a coordinated public information campaign at Mar 5. Quoted from the C19 Response Plan document by the PA (unable to archive, original link attached): "The GoP immediately declared a State of Emergency when the first cases in the State of Palestine were diagnosed on 5 March 2020 and launched robust national containment measures, supported by an evidence-based communications campaign to encourage our citizens to protect themselves and follow government guidance."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200430102006/http://english.wafa.ps/page.aspx?id=ctGcj9a115309634715actGcj9  http://www.emro.who.int/images/stories/palestine/documents/Palestine_Authority_COVID-19_Response_Plan_Final_26_3_2020.pdf?ua=1
notes_H3: "The GoP has quarantine facilities in each of the governorates and conducts testing at the Central Health Laboratory. Individuals suspected to have COVID-19 are home quarantined until symptoms develop or they have a positive test: all in-coming travellers are placed in government quarantine for two weeks. Individuals with positive samples or symptoms are cared for in government hospitals. There are contact and trace units in each governorate."  https://web.archive.org/save/https://reliefweb.int/report/occupied-palestinian-territory/state-emergency-palestine-s-covid-19-response-plan
notes_H2: Gaza Strip: Since 1  December,  although testing  for  people displaying COVID-19  type  symptoms continues, those who  have been in contact with confirmed positive cases are only tested if they are above 50 yearsof age, and for younger people,only if they have known underlying health conditions    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118165002/https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/sitrep_25-17-30_dec_2020.pdf
notes_C7: Melhem also announced a full ban on public and private transportation between the Governorates, with the exception of medical staff and the staff of the Ministry of Education.  A full ban on movement of individuals and on transportation will apply from 7 pm to 6 am every day.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118162449/https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/122854
notes_C8: Entering via Israel: Israel is in full lockdown from 8 January 2021. During this time international travel is prohibited with some exceptions.  The Israeli authorities have announced that with effect from 23 December, foreign nationals will not be permitted to enter unless they are citizens of Israel, with some limited exemptions. If you’re eligible for entry, you will need to complete an entry form. All travellers will be required to quarantine for 14 days. This may be shortened to 10 days upon the completion of two negative coronavirus tests (one upon arrival and one after 9 days). The minimum time required between the two tests is at least 24 hours.  Restrictions also apply at land crossings between Israel and Jordan, and between the Occupied Palestinian Territories and Jordan    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118163854/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/the-occupied-palestinian-territories/entry-requirements    Source: UK foreign office
notes_C4: Weddings, funerals, and any crowds in any places remain strictly prohibited, under penalty of legal responsibility and financial penalties.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118162449/https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/122854
notes_C1: Government spokesman Ibrahim Melhem said in a press statement that all universities and institutes of all levels will have to switch to home-based e-learning while allowing some administrative staff to arrive to their workplaces. Meanwhile, schools of grades 7-11 will return to normal working schedule but with strict safety restrictions, including social distancing and wearing masks.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118162449/https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/122854
notes_H6: Recommendations on the Ministry of Health website to wear a face covering.  Switching to recommended category.
notes_C2: Ministries and government agencies will be working at an emergency pace, and are asked to reduce the number of staff working at their premises to a maximum of 30 percent.  Sports clubs, barbershops, indoors recreational facilities, restaurants and cafes are allowed to work at an emergency pace with no more than 30 percent of their staff.  Private and civil institutions should be operating at an emergency pace, and are asked to reduce the number of active staff to no more than 30 percent.  Productive sectors are allowed to work with no more than 50 percent of their staff to prevent overcrowding.  Commercial places operate during the weekly working days according to the strictest preventive measures in terms of social distancing, wearing of masks and sterilization.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118162449/https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/122854
notes_E2: https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/sitrep_21_covid_19.pdf
notes_C3: Weddings, funerals, and any crowds in any places remain strictly prohibited, under penalty of legal responsibility and financial penalties.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118162449/https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/122854
notes_C6: A full ban on movement of individuals and on transportation will apply from 7 pm to 6 am every day.  A full lockdown will also apply to any Governorate, village, city or refugee camp where there is a high number of COVID-19 infections.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118162449/https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/122854
notes_C5: Melhem also announced a full ban on public and private transportation between the Governorates, with the exception of medical staff and the staff of the Ministry of Education.  A full ban on movement of individuals and on transportation will apply from 7 pm to 6 am every day.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118162449/https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/122854

name: Qatar
notes_H1: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528231507/https://twitter.com/MOPHQatar/status/1243993841935491074
notes_H3: Those who shared accommmodations with the patients, or had contact with them, have been quarantined and are being tested to ensure they are free from infection  https://web.archive.org/web/20200528231023/https://www.moph.gov.qa/english/mediacenter/News/Pages/NewsDetails.aspx?ItemId=95
notes_H2: Drive-through testing available   https://web.archive.org/web/20200528221018/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/05/qatar-drive-testing-understanding-virus-200512092746551.html
notes_C7: https://web.archive.org/save/https://qa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-11/
notes_C8: https://web.archive.org/save/https://qa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-11/
notes_C4: According to the COVID-19 Qatar National Response Plan, Qatar enters into the phase 3 on July 28th . the regulation allows limited gatherings of up to 10 people indoors, 30 people outdoors.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200801154507/https://covid19.moph.gov.qa/EN/Documents/PDFs/ENG%20PHASE%20III.pdf
notes_C1: Public and private schools in Qatar will reopen tomorrow, September 1, introducing a new concept of “blended learning” where students will attend school up to a maximum of 2 days a week and rest of the learning will be done online. With a maximum of 30% of children in school each day,in addition to supporting preventive measures, we are confident that everything is in place to enable children to safely return to schools. https://web.archive.org/web/20200902131549/https://menafn.com/1100724840/Qatar-More-than-98-of-educational-sector-workers-free-from-Covid-19-Official  At Qatar University, face-to-face teaching on campus will start on 1/09/20 for graduate courses. Undergraduate teaching 'will continue to be online except for students enrolled in some specific courses'. https://web.archive.org/web/20201204134738/http://www.qu.edu.qa/coronavirus/educational-process
notes_H6: June 4th - The strict measures on mask wearing outside were eased, meaning it is now allowed to exercise outside without wearing a mask.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118163947/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/6/3/qatar-announces-easing-of-coronavirus-restrictions
notes_C2: Qatar is currently in the third phase of its four-phase reopening plan with hotel facilities, shopping malls, and many of the country’s health clubs and salons now open for business, with precautions in place.  Cinemas are allowed to screen movies from today, September 1, onwards with a capacity of 15%. The cinemas have to follow precautionary measures and only people above 18 years are allowed entry.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200902131747/https://www.ttrweekly.com/site/2020/09/qatar-covid-proofs-its-restaurants-and-malls/
notes_E2: According to the IMF website, Qatar’s QAR 75 billion package to reduce the effects of COVID-19 was announced on March 16. The program aims at shoring up small businesses and hard-hit sectors (hospitality, tourism, retail, commercial complexes, and logistics), including through six-month exemptions on utilities payments (water, electricity). Logistics areas and small and medium industries are exempt from rent payments for six months.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200801202755/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: On 28th March, the Qatari Ministry of Administrative Development, Labor and Social Affairs (MADLSA) published a guidance note on the treatment of workers and the rights of employees, stating that 'All workers in isolation, quarantine or receiving treatment will still be paid their basic salary and receive their allowances irrespective of whether they are entitled to sick leave benefits.'  http://web.archive.org/web/20200430142500/https://www.clydeco.com/insight/article/covid-19-middle-east-employment-an-update-on-new-government-initiatives http://web.archive.org/web/20200430142642/https://www.marhaba.qa/covid-19-update-qatar-health-and-employment-guidelines-for-workers/
notes_C3: "Qatar bans gatherings, deploy patrols to contain coronavirus"  https://web.archive.org/web/20200406200517/https://uk.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-qatar/qatar-bans-gatherings-deploy-patrols-to-contain-coronavirus-idUKKBN2180VZ
notes_C6: https://web.archive.org/web/20200506195057/https://www.gco.gov.qa/en/briefing-room/second-press-conference-for-the-supreme-committee-for-crisis-management/  https://qatar.vcu.edu/coronavirus-updates
notes_C5: Qatar resumed bus and rail services on Tuesday for the first time since March, with reduced capacity and tough restrictions to limit the risk of coronavirus spreading between passengers.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200909161144/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/qatar/coronavirus
notes_H7: On December 23rd teh vaccine rollout began, with three priority groups in the first back to recieve Pfizer-BioNTech jabs.  "vaccines will be prioritized for three key population groups: older people, people with certain chronic conditions and key healthcare workers."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210118165327/https://covid19.moph.gov.qa/EN/Covid19-Vaccine/Pages/Priority-groups.aspx    https://web.archive.org/web/20210108102708if_/https://www.deccanherald.com/international/qatar-dubai-roll-out-pfizer-biontech-covid-19-vaccine-930770.html

name: Romania
notes_H1: Starting on 25/02/2020, an online information campaign was launched on the official Government of Romania Facebook page on the "Prevention and limitation of eventual infection with coronavirus". New, updated information has since been provided daily on the facebook page (https://web.archive.org/web/20200812130651/https://www.facebook.com/guv.ro)  On the 24/02/2020, this campaign was announced: "The information campaign of the population regarding the infection with COVID-19 will be extended, as well as the individual and collective prevention measures which should be taken and a daily newscast will be drafted regarding the development at international level and possible additional measures taken by the Romanian authorities" (https://web.archive.org/web/20200812130808/https://www.nineoclock.ro/2020/02/24/pm-designate-orban-urges-romanians-to-learn-about-coronavirus-from-official-sources-only/)
notes_H3: An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://archive.fo/thRdi and https://archive.fo/FUhtr
notes_H2: 1. Symptomatic persons, including medical staff according to the case definition;   2. Symptomatic close contacts of confirmed cases;   3. Asymptomatic patients before the transplant procedure and donors of hematopoietic organs, tissues and stem cells before donation; patients with transplants of hematopoietic organs, tissues and stem cells undergoing immunosuppressive therapy, before each hospitalization during the post-transplant monitoring period - 2 tests at 24-hour intervals;   4. Asymptomatic patients with immunosuppression in the context of the disease or drug-induced hospitalization - 2 tests at 24-hour intervals;   5. Asymptomatic cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy and / or radiotherapy - twice a month;   6. Asymptomatic cancer patients before surgery or invasive interventions;   7. Symptomatic haemodialysis patients;   8. Asymptomatic haemodialysis patients contacts with a confirmed case, 2 tests at 6-7 days interval between them; during this period they will be dialyzed in separate sessions from the rest of the patients;   9. Symptomatic institutionalized individuals;   10. Asymptomatic pregnant women in quarantine/home isolation or close contact with a confirmed case;   11. Staff of residential centres/long-term care facilities – twice a month;   12. Asymptomatic healthcare personnel who have been in direct contact with a confirmed case, in the 6th or 7th day since the last contact.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200608103644/https://www.cnscbt.ro/index.php/1697-definitii-de-caz-si-algoritm-de-testare-pentru-covid-19-actualizare-28-04-2020-1/file
notes_C7: According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, in all localities in Romania, it is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). Also, the Ministry of Interior published the list of quarantined localities.  Link: https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf and https://archive.fo/1JWbz
notes_C8: "On 5 October 2020, the Romanian Government issued an updated list of countries for which COVID-19 travel restrictions are in place.    From midnight on 7 October 2020, travellers arriving into Romania from the UK must quarantine for 14 days on arrival. If however, after 8 days of quarantine, you present no specific COVID-19 symptoms and take a COVID-19 test which returns a negative result, you may leave quarantine after 10 days.      Travellers planning to stay in Romania for 3 days or less are exempt from quarantine, as long as they provide evidence of a negative COVID-19 test, taken within 48 hours before entering the country."  http://web.archive.org/web/20201019133449/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/romania/entry-requirements    "Are U.S. citizens permitted to enter? No, unless they meet one of the exceptions for entry listed in the Government Decision of August 16.  U.S. citizens are not permitted to enter Romania unless they meet one of the specified exceptions.  U.S. citizens wishing to know if they meet an exception for entry may consult the Ministry of Foreign Affairs’ website here or the Ministry of Interior’s website here (Romanian language only). They are also advised to contact the Romanian Embassy in their country of origin or the Romanian Border Police prior to departure.  The Government of Romania also implemented non-European Economic Area (EEA) travel requirements reflecting the Council of the European Union’s (EU’s) June 30th recommendations, which prohibit non-essential EU travel for U.S. residents.  Travelers may consult the European Commission’s webpage called “Re-open EU” for more information regarding travel restrictions throughout Europe."  http://web.archive.org/web/20201019133540/https://ro.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: Social events such as weddings and funerals are limited to 10 guests.  Link: https://archive.fo/kYCaw
notes_C1: "According to the ministerial order 5972/8.11.20, starting on 9.11.20, the teaching activities that require the physical presence of preschoolers and students in preschool, primary, secondary, high school and post-secondary education units are suspended for a period of 30 days. The teaching activities will be carried out online, according to the Framework Methodology on conducting teaching activities through technology and the Internet, as well as for the processing of personal data, approved by order of the Ministry of Education and Research 5545/2020."    Source: https://archive.fo/7GMr0
notes_H6: According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces, regardless the value of the cumulative incidence rate of cases in the last 14 days (as it previously of this decision was).  Link: https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf
notes_C2: Restaurant are required to close at 10 PM nationwide. Restaurant and hotels are subject to periodic ongoing health inspection. Only six people are allowed at one table in restaurants.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201106191444/https://ge.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-on-georgia/ and https://archive.fo/kYCaw
notes_E2: On 22nd of October, the government approved the application of the simplified alternative procedure for granting payment rescheduling for a maximum of 12 months. Beneficiaries of the simplified staggering facility are all taxpayers.  According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://archive.fo/hVM21.
notes_E1: A Government Emergency Ordinance (GEO 30/2020) has been published, outlining social protection measures during the state of emergency due to COVID-19. The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 come into force on 21 March 2020.  'The Labor Code provides that employers can decide unilaterally to suspend individual employment agreements of their employees and place the employees in technical unemployment. The employer is required to ensure from its own funds the payment of a minimum allowance of 75% of the employee’s base salary. However, if the employers meet one of the following criteria, during the state of emergency, the technical unemployment allowance can be supported by the Unemployment Insurance Budget up to the limit of 75% of the average gross salary provided for under the law for the social insurance budget for 2020'.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200502180616/https://home.kpmg/ro/en/home/insights/2020/03/social-protection-measures-during-the-state-of-emergency.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20200812125709/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, the meetings on public holidays, public and/or private parties in closed and/or open spaces are prohibited.  Link: https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf
notes_C6: The Ministry of Interior published the list of quarantined localities. Also, the Ministry of Health published the recommendations for preventing the spread of coronavirus (working from home where it is possible, people should avoid crowded areas and limit to the maximum any direct contact with other people, other than those who are part of the same family). Also, according to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, in all localities in Romania, it is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance).  Link: https://archive.fo/cUlEp, https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf and https://archive.fo/1JWbz
notes_C5: According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces. Also, to avoid the congestion of public transport, it is proposed to all public institutions and all economic operators to organize work schedule (where telework is not possible) into at least two groups to start/finish the activity at a difference of at least two hours.  Link: https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf
notes_H7: Second stage of the vaccination campaign started on 15th of January and is aimed at people over 65 age, people with chronic diseases (regardless of age) and key staff working in key areas. The coordinator of the National Committee for the Planning of COVID-19 Vaccination in Romania, announced how the appointments of people over 65 years of age and those with chronic diseases can be made. (Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines are used).  Link: https://archive.fo/wip/IzHsa and https://archive.fo/wip/qeZ7F

name: Russia
notes_H1: Prime Minister announces a plan to roll out a public information campaign about the coronavirus progression in the near future. (http://web.archive.org/web/20200505222301/https://www.kommersant.ru/doc/4290524)
notes_H3: Although the specific date of initiation of contact tracing is difficult to pinpoint, the government has closely tracked individuals who returned from abroad since March 5th. In tracking, they have also taken note of who these individuals have come in contact with. (http://web.archive.org/web/20200505223551/https://www.kommersant.ru/doc/4285154?from=doc_vrez)
notes_H2: Government begins administering tests remotely, in people's homes. (http://web.archive.org/web/20200504225607/https://ria.ru/20200406/1569622220.html)  Russia's health watchdog Rosdravnadzor has developed an "express" coronavirus test that can test at 94% accuracy within 40 minutes, the Industry and Trade Ministry said. (http://web.archive.org/web/20200514122052/https://www.interfax.ru/russia/702742)
notes_C7: In Moscow, The requirement asking People aged 65+ must stay home until the end of November. Working pensioners are advised to take leave or switch to remote work. Free travel for Moscow residents aged 65+ who must stay at home is suspended. People with chronic diseases and pregnant women must also stay home. Has been extended to the 15th of January.  People in risk groups are kindly requested to refrain from seeing their relatives who live in separate households and to ask younger family members to do the shopping. If necessary, they are allowed to go to shops and pharmacies, take out the trash, and walk their pets, but only wearing masks and gloves. Taking walks is allowed.http://web.archive.org/web/20210108222859/https://www.mos.ru/en/city/projects/covid-19/
notes_C8: From at least 17 November, the Government of the Russian Federation banned the entry of foreign nationals, including American citizens, with a few exceptions.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201122205355/https://ru.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: Some jurisdictions place limitations on large gatherings and mass events. See: https://ru.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/ [accessed 12th October 2020, web archive unavailable, webpage last updated 6th October 2020]
notes_C1: 23 June     Moscow moves out of one of the strictest lockdowns in the country, and will launch the third stage of lifting restrictions imposed to curb the spread of coronavirus on June 23. Restaurants, gyms and pre-schools are operating again. Stage 3 lifting restriction means that across the country preschools are able to reopen. Unable to find evidence showing that full lockdowns still in place in other regions (Moscow’s strict lockdown seems to feature most prominently in the media) so coded as ‘require closing for some sectors’.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200624101856/https://tass.com/society/1170515    UNESCO Education Response Tracker shows on 23 June 2020 that Russian Federation has localised school closures.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200624062013/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse    Universities are recruiting new applicants remotely online, suggesting they are still closed.   http://archive.vn/hrZQm    Moscow on March 5 introduced an alert system to help manage its response to the COVID-19 outbreak: http://archive.vn/uQlIE
notes_H6: No Policy Change   http://web.archive.org/web/20210108222859/https://www.mos.ru/en/city/projects/covid-19/
notes_C2: Starting May 12th, there is an ease on working restrictions (http://web.archive.org/web/20200521232328/https://www.themoscowtimes.com/2020/05/21/coronavirus-in-russia-the-latest-news-may-21-a69117). The degree of ease varies depending on region. In Moscow, for example, companies involved in industry and construction will be able to return to work despite the continued lockdown through May 31st.     According to President Putin: "The period of non-working days is over, but this does not mean the end of the fight against the epidemic".     The regime has been in force since March 30 and assumed the preservation of wages for employees. However, whether these wages were sustained in reality is highly unclear (the government did not provide subsidies to corporations to guarantee the continuous payment of wages)    The heads of regions retain the right to limit and suspend the work of enterprises if all sanitary requirements cannot be observed there. At the same time, employees should receive a salary.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200519082414/https://www.rbc.ru/society/11/05/2020/5eb9615e9a794774be6aa275
notes_E2: The government does not guarantee debt/contract relief. Rather, as they inform "A citizen who has difficulties with payments on loans or borrowings due to a decrease in income, first of all, should inform his creditors about this and request an option for debt restructuring".   In accordance with the law, citizens can apply for a grace period for payments (credit holidays) if their income in the month preceding the date of application has decreased by at least 30% compared to the average monthly income in 2019. You can also apply for a credit vacation if the size of the loan (loan) taken does not exceed the maximum amount established by the Government of the Russian Federation.  -> this measure is only for "the most needy segments of the population". Moreover, Russian citizens often complain that the procedure is complex, and it is often impossible for them to provide officials with supporting document. I believe that the E2 indicator should be 1 - Narrow for the entirety of the Corona crisis period.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200910160910/https://xn--80aesfpebagmfblc0a.xn--p1ai/faq/?tags=33
notes_E1: To maintain the income of citizens who have lost their jobs, the maximum amount of unemployment benefits has been increased to the size of the subsistence minimum - 12,130 rubles. In regions where the regional coefficient is established, the unemployment benefit is increased by the size of the regional coefficient. The minimum unemployment benefit has been increased from 1,500 to 4,500 rubles from May 1 to August 1.    Link: http://archive.vn/yG0p6
notes_C3: The U.S embassy on Russia indicates "some jurisdictions place limitations on large gatherings and mass events". However, no specific policies were found associated with this indicator.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200831224047/https://ru.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Moscow mayor strongly encouraged anyone vulnerable or those over 65 years old to self-isolate and not leave the home as of now.  https://www.themoscowtimes.com/2020/10/01/moscow-orders-remote-work-amid-very-dangerous-coronavirus-spike-a71620
notes_C5: No measures found relative to closing transports on the RF's coronavirus official website nor in the news, other than masks are mandatory in some cities.
notes_H7: C:    Vaccination against COVID-19 has started in Moscow. The City Government is regularly extending the groups of residents who can sign up for vaccination. Currently, these groups include:    Muscovites over 60 (they are at the highest risk of severe COVID-19 and complications);  People with chronic conditions who are required to stay at home during the pandemic;  College and university students aged 18 and older.    Also, people aged 18 and over who work in the following fields and organisations can get vaccinated. In the future, it will be available to all Moscow residents.    As this is not yet available across all of Russia, I have coded this as a 1 for group C elderly groups, until more evidence emerges that this is accessible country wide    http://web.archive.org/web/20210108222859/https://www.mos.ru/en/city/projects/covid-19/

name: Rwanda
notes_H1: The Rwandan government hastened safety measures against coronavirus and were consistent in reminding Rwanda citizens to be more vigilant on preventing novel coronavirus.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200430191424/https://www.afro.who.int/news/rwanda-hastens-safety-measures-against-novel-coronavirus   https://web.archive.org/web/20200430185258/https://www.primature.gov.rw/index.php?id=40  https://web.archive.org/web/20201120191729/https://www.newvision.co.ug/news/1516513/coronavirus-rwanda-closes-churches-schools
notes_H3: no mention found on their pages https://web.archive.org/web/20210118204935/https://www.primature.gov.rw/index.php?id=147
notes_H2: Testing available to all but limited in terms of number and cost https://web.archive.org/web/20201101114219/https://www.atlanticcouncil.org/blogs/africasource/rwandas-successes-and-challenges-in-response-to-covid-19/  Scaled up over the following period until truly comprehensive (see later dates)  Health screenings for coronavirus were reported to have begun at Ports of Entry in Rwanda on 11 February 2020. Health and Safety measures were scaled up with screening occurring at all borders from 22 March 2020, to prevent the spread of the virus.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200430191424/https://www.afro.who.int/news/rwanda-hastens-safety-measures-against-novel-coronavirus   https://web.archive.org/web/20200430193209/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/rwanda-steps-up-efforts-to-beat-coronavirus/1774728  https://web.archive.org/web/20200430185258/https://www.primature.gov.rw/index.php?id=40   https://web.archive.org/web/20201120191855/https://www.osac.gov/Country/Rwanda/Content/Detail/Report/56a32804-d525-4cca-9e99-17f14692b376  https://web.archive.org/web/20201120193308/https://www.primature.gov.rw/index.php?id=40&no_cache=1&tx_drblob_pi1%5BdownloadUid%5D=779
notes_C7: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118204935/https://www.primature.gov.rw/index.php?id=147
notes_C8: Arriving and departing passengers at Kigali International airport must present a negative COVID -19 PCR test taken within 120 hours prior to departure and should comply with health guidelines.     Domestic and international tourism will continue however tourists must have valid reservations and possess valid negative COVID – 19 test results.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201104065504/https://www.primature.gov.rw/index.php?id=2
notes_C4: Church Weddings & Funerals are limited to 75. Attendance at a wake/vigil (Ikiriyo) should not exceed 15 people at any one time. Civil marriage ceremonies will continue but should not exceed 15 persons.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118204935/https://www.primature.gov.rw/index.php?id=147
notes_C1: schools were gradually reopened & restrictions are not based on covid but on teacher shortages - https://web.archive.org/web/20210118205400/https://www.mineduc.gov.rw/updates/news-details?tx_news_pi1%5Baction%5D=detail&tx_news_pi1%5Bcontroller%5D=News&tx_news_pi1%5Bnews%5D=10069&cHash=900002f81bbc25329fe6f1d4671464c9
notes_H6: Masks must be worn properly in public at all times. Exceptions are noted.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210118204935/https://www.primature.gov.rw/index.php?id=147
notes_C2: All bars including those in restaurants and hotels will remain closed. Gym and Swimming pools remain closed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118204935/https://www.primature.gov.rw/index.php?id=147  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118204935/https://www.primature.gov.rw/index.php?id=147
notes_E2: 18/03 announced  National Bank of Rwanda announced easing of loan repayment conditions for borrowers affected by the Covid-19: banks are exceptionally allowed to restructure outstanding loans of borrowers temporarily facing cash flow challenges due to Covid-19: https://web.archive.org/web/20200507084813/https://www.cnbcafrica.com/east-africa/2020/03/23/central-bank-of-rwanda-takes-measures-to-mitigate-the-economic-impact-of-covid-19/    The Rwandan Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning has announced a series of tax exemptions as part of efforts to support different sectors of the economy to recover from the effects of COVID 19 pandemic. Pay As You Earn (PAYE) will be waived for a period of six months from April to September for teachers in private schools earning up to 150,000 Rwandan francs net salary (about 161 U.S. dollars), a statement issued by the ministry said. The waiver will also apply for a period of three months from April to June for employees of companies operating in the tourism and hotel sector who earn up to 150,000 Rwandan francs net salary, the statement said. PAYE waiver lasts till September for teachers, and till June for everyone else. The government also exempted masks made in Rwanda to prevent COVID-19 spread from paying Value Added Tax (VAT).  https://web.archive.org/web/20200825035927/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-05/10/c_139045597.htm
notes_E1: Full IMF statement: As of November 4, 2020 "Tax deferral and relief measures include the following: (i) suspension of down payments on outstanding tax for amicable settlement, (ii)softening of enforcement for tax arrears collection, (iii) extension of the deadline for filing and paying CIT, (iv) fast-tracking of VAT refunds to SMEs, (v) CIT and PIT payments based on current year transactions, (vi) PIT exemption for private school teachers and tourism and hotel employees earning less than RWF 150,000/month, and (vi) VAT exemption for locally produced masks."    Main impact on indicator is cash transfers to casual workers  https://web.archive.org/web/20200904183810/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19  PIT exemption for private school teachers and tourism and hotel employees earning less than RWF 150,000/month - as per the update on 10th Sept 2020  https://web.archive.org/web/20200914124848/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: Mass gathering are prohibited except with special permission and events must not exceed 30% of venue capacity. Applications to host essential events will be granted by local authorities and RDB upon fulfillment of health requirements. https://web.archive.org/web/20210118204935/https://www.primature.gov.rw/index.php?id=147
notes_C6: none mentioned https://web.archive.org/web/20210118204935/https://www.primature.gov.rw/index.php?id=147
notes_C5: Public transportation will continue with buses operating at full capacity for seated passengers and at 50% for standing passengers.  Bicycle taxis (Abanyonzi) will resume in permitted areas of operation in accordance with COVID-19 preventive measures as well as other precautionary safety measures including wearing helmets. Motos are permitted to carry passengers except in areas under lockdown. Strict hygiene must be observed and masks worn at all times.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118204935/https://www.primature.gov.rw/index.php?id=147

name: Saudi Arabia
notes_H1: The Ministry of Health conducts campaigns that target citizens and residents (in Arabic, English, Hindy, Tagalog, among others) reporting the number of cases and recommending people how to take preventative measures. https://web.archive.org/web/20200608033137/https://twitter.com/SaudiMOH/status/1244341052196163585
notes_H3: In February, the Saudi Center for Disease Prevention and control released a comprehensive set of Coronavirus Health Guidelines. The guidelines instruct the public health team or rapid response team to conduct a number of measures for a patient that has the virus, including filling out a contact tracing form (Appendix  3 in the guidelines) https://www.moh.gov.sa/CCC/healthp/regulations/Documents/Coronavirus%20Disease%202019%20Guidelines%20v1.1..pdf
notes_H2: "The ministry highlighted that the new phase will not include COVID-19 examination inside houses or by visiting residences. Instead, the ministry will provide different outlets and options to conduct the tests. It will establish drive-through centers for testing people inside their cars in several cities while also offering testing services at primary health care centers, and allow citizens and residents to book appointments to collect their own test samples through an online application."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200608034049/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1677726/saudi-arabia
notes_C7: "There are currently no curfew or movement restrictions in effect within the country (...)"    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20200819124650/https://sa.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: In response to the spread of a new strain of COVID-19, on 20 December 2020, the Ministry of Interior announced the suspension of all international flights for travellers entering and leaving the Kingdom (except in exceptional cases). On 3 January 2021, the Saudi Government announced that the suspension of entry into the Kingdom would be lifted from 11am on Sunday 3 January.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210103105442/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/saudi-arabia/entry-requirements  https://web.archive.org/web/20210104223316/https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/international/saudi-arabia/saudi-arabia-reopens-borders-closed-due-to-coronavirus/articleshow/80081770.cms
notes_C4: With Hajj over, the guidelines are still generally at limits of 50 people to a social gathering.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200810132047/https://sa.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: The Ministry of Education determined schools and universities would close to stop the spread of the virus. https://web.archive.org/web/20200608023056/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1638606/saudi-arabia
notes_H6: On 30 May, face masks become mandatory in public places. Non-compliance is fined with up to SR1,000 ($266).     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200831214012/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1686821/saudi-arabia
notes_C2: Most commercial services and activities are currently available, though crowd size is limited to no more than 50. Grocery stores remain well stocked, and restaurants, malls, shops, and private entities are open, though some may only offer limited services.  https://archive.vn/TgWZq#selection-2855.0-2855.256    All commercial activities are back to normal and public and private sector companies allowed to resume work from office under strict health guidelines  https://archive.vn/58NAr#selection-1257.0-1257.150    Cannot find any information about recommended workplace closing or working from home, so coding as 0.
notes_E2: Eligible people (social insurance beneficiaries, orphans and the disabled) were waived from paying rent for 3 months. https://web.archive.org/web/20200414205607/http://saudigazette.com.sa/article/591775/SAUDI-ARABIA/Social-insurance-beneficiaries-orphans-and-disabled-exempted-from-paying-rent-for-3-months
notes_E1: Saudi Government has announced to pay 60% of the salaries of Saudi employees working in the Private sector for a period of three months with a ceiling of USD 2.39 billion. The Compensation will be paid in accordance with the conditions stipulated in the unemployment insurance system (SANID)  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221220947/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/saudi-arabia-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_C3: No mention of public events, but given that gatherings over 50 are still prohibited, I think this should still be coded as a 2G.  "Saudi Arabia has allowed social events — including wedding receptions and other celebrations — to be held from Thursday, with up to 50 people, ensuring guests must wear face masks and abide by the social distancing protocol."  Source  https://web.archive.org/web/20200729161532/https://gulfnews.com/world/gulf/saudi/saudi-arabia-allows-social-events-weddings-with-up-to-50-people-1.1593635688372
notes_C6: Cannot find any government guidance that recommends to people to stay at home, including the source used for the previous 1G coding.
notes_C5: "Domestic air travel and travel within the country by bus, train, and other means of transportation has resumed (...)"    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20200819124650/https://sa.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: Saudi Arabia began inoculating people in the kingdom with a COVID-19 vaccine on Thursday, becoming the first Arab country to roll out the Pfizer-BioNTech jab    Citizens aged 65 and above, professionals at higher risks of COVID-19 exposure, as well as people with immune deficiency and chronic disease will be first recipients of the vaccine    https://web.archive.org/web/20210104223950if_/https://uk.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-saudi-idUKKBN28Q347    https://web.archive.org/web/20210107165728/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/12/17/saudi-arabia-kicks-off-coronavirus-vaccination-campaign

name: Sudan
notes_H1: Information campaigns are poorly updated on government websites. (Previous score of indicator might be too optimistic).    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201008194415/http://www.fmoh.gov.sd/  https://web.archive.org/web/20201008194713/https://www.facebook.com/Fmohsd/
notes_H3: The Ministry of Health's Case Management and Protocols outlines protocols for contact tracing here:    https://web.archive.org/web/20201107164200/http://fmoh.gov.sd/index.php/files/index/116
notes_H2: Swab tests are given to symptomatic patients at increased risk of needing oxygen or ventilation.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201116150327/http://fmoh.gov.sd/index.php/files/index/116
notes_C7: No change.  All COVID-19 restrictions have been lifted.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201214183456/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/sudan/coronavirus-
notes_C8: Sudanese authorities removed bans of travels from the UK, Netherland and South Africa. The visitors will have to show a negative Covid test report and quarantine for 14 days.     Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118123231/https://www.hindustantimes.com/lifestyle/travel
notes_C4: Reducing coding from 3G to 0G based on the following info from UK Gov foreign travel advisory:    "The Sudanese authorities have now removed all COVID-19 restrictions. There remains the possibility of curfews, travel restrictions or other measures being re-introduced at short notice. You should comply with all local COVID-19 restrictions imposed by the Sudanese authorities."    Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201104053026/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/sudan/coronavirus-
notes_C1: Schools are closed due to COVID-19.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210104181017/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse
notes_H6: It seems that there are preventive measures outlined by the government as evident from the lack of adherence as cited by this article.     ""We observed that the majority of citizens and officials appear to have given up on wearing face masks and regular hand sanitization," the doctors said in a statement issued Friday evening, adding that "most public institutions, shopping, and medical centers are no longer providing handwashing facilities or sanitizers at entrances or within the buildings."  The doctors also expressed concern about public noncompliance with COVID-19 prevention measures amid laxity in enforcing coronavirus prevention measures across the country."    I also found a a post from the Sudan Ministry of Health showing a face mask embedded in an image with Arabic text - https://web.archive.org/web/20201104062249/http://fmoh.gov.sd/index.php/posts/post/1686    Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201104061947if_/https://in.news.yahoo.com/south-sudan-warned-surge-covid-163044351.html
notes_C2: Many cafes, restaurants and markets continue to operate.    Mosques and other places of worship may be open to the public with social distancing and other preventive measures in place.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201221232157/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/sudan/coronavirus-
notes_E2: Can't find any current measures, other than: "The government has drafted regulations on forbearance of loan repayments for three months to ease the pressure on private sector."    http://web.archive.org/web/20200727103923/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: The Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning (MoFEP) has also been working on different options to support the population during the COVID-19 lockdown. Among the activities, the MoFEP developed a plan to scale up financing to the health sector and provide cash transfers to 80 per cent of the population–more than 30 million people–most of them informal sector workers whose livelihoods will likely be affected by the restrictions. Each person will receive SDG500,00 (around US$9,00) per month, according to the Ministry. In addition, the MoFEP informed it would carry out a civil service salary reform to help those on fixed incomes; cushion the private sector through tax and customs exemptions; and it is also evaluating possible support for exporters and other productive industries affected by exchange rates and depreciation.    https://web.archive.org/save/https://reliefweb.int/report/sudan/sudan-situation-report-7-may-2020
notes_C3: No change.  The Committee for Public Health Emergencies announced that the state of health emergency continues and reminded the community of the importance of observing health measures necessary to limit the transmission and spread of the epidemic  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201123170521/https://sd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Sudanese authorities announced that the 18:00 - 06:00 (local time) curfew in Khartoum state will be lifted from Saturday, September 26, amid the easing of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) restrictions in the country. The curfew was previously extended on July 8, due to a rise in the number of COVID-19 cases in the state.     Contrasting info on exact date - may be Sept 16.    Link:     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201008194924/https://www.worldaware.com/intelligence-alert-sudan-restrictions-nationwide-upd-13  https://web.archive.org/web/20201008194900/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/383506/sudan-authorities-lift-curfew-in-khartoum-state-as-of-september-26-update-17  https://web.archive.org/web/20201008195301/https://sd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20201008195324/https://allafrica.com/stories/202009170251.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20201008195351/https://allafrica.com/stories/202009170954.html
notes_C5: Is public transportation operating? Yes.    Effective August 15, 2020, the Government of Sudan has allowed public transportation to operate between cities and states.  Intercity public transportation is available outside of curfew hours    https://web.archive.org/web/20200910223157/https://sd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Senegal
notes_H1: The president calls on religious authorities to support the government with adopted measures.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200518002240/http://www.sante.gouv.sn/Actualites/covid-19-les-decisions-de-son-execellence-monsieur-macky-sall-president-de-la-republique
notes_H3: The latest daily report indicates that community transmission is outpacing contact tracing efforts, with 174 recorded cases of community transmission and only 114 contacts traced.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210111200728/https://www.facebook.com/santegouvsenegal/posts/2769362986636921
notes_H2: "Individuals in Senegal may obtain COVID-19 testing at the following locations. The cost is FCFA 40,000 per test."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210111200501/https://sn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: The motorways between the international airport and Thiès and between the airport and Mbour are closed between 8pm and 6am.    The Government of Senegal has advised that the airport will remain open and existing flight schedules will not change. People can still travel to the airport during curfew if they are passengers arriving and departing or the driver (no other people accompanying passengers are allowed). All of these people must carry a copy of their passport and plane ticket, which will allow for movement to the airport or to their accommodation. If you are arriving into Senegal at the airport in curfew hours, you should contact the person or taxi company you have arranged to collect you in advance to make sure they can still access the airport and have all the necessary paperwork    https://web.archive.org/web/20210111195006/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/senegal/coronavirus  https://web.archive.org/web/20210111195523/https://www.facebook.com/TOURISMETRANSPORTSAERIENSSENEGAL/posts/3567643523343404
notes_C8: Starting from 5 July, borders re-opened for international flights, though land and sea borders remain closed and the majority of international airlines have resumed commercial routes. "EU citizens are not allowed entry into Senegal following the principles of reciprocity. Only passengers who meet the following conditions will be allowed on flights to Senegal.   - Residents of countries that are not affected by the temporary restriction of non-essential movement to Senegal or have not imposed restrictions on the movement of Senegal nationals  - Nationals of members states of the West African Economic and Monetary Union (UEMOA) and from Economic Community of West (CEDEAO)  - Third-country nationals regularly established in Senegal and holding a residence permit issued by the competent services of the Republic of Senegal    All passengers except children under two years old must present an original negative COVID-19 PCR test certificate dating less than seven days from the date the test was taken. The certificate must be issued by a laboratory approved by the state or an internationally recognised health organisation."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200729081816/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/senegal/coronavirus  https://web.archive.org/web/20200729081959/https://www.emirates.com/english/help/faqs/travel-advisory-senegal
notes_C4: Country-wide restrictions on "gatherings in public spaces" remains in effect.     Additionally, in the regions of Dakar and Thies, private meetings including baptisms, weddings, receptions and religious events are prohibited.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210111193453/https://www.msn.com/fr-xl/afrique-de-l-ouest/other/covid-19-manifestations-et-rassemblements-interdits-temporairement-%C3%A0-dakar-et-thi%C3%A8s/ar-BB1cz5Ln
notes_C1: Schools reopened in Senegal on November 12th. Students are required to wear masks, and distancing is encouraged.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201221221105/http://nouvelhorizon.sn/index.php/2020/11/12/le-fait-du-jour-rentree-des-classes-sous-le-signe-du-racket-des-ecoles-privees/    https://web.archive.org/web/20201221222443/https://www.facebook.com/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fsnmen%2Fposts%2F2906065296280444    https://web.archive.org/web/20201221222738/https://www.facebook.com/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fsnmen%2Fposts%2F2931551557065151
notes_C2: Effective December 10th, the Ministere de l'interieur banned gatherings in the following locations:  - pools  - sports fields  - public spaces  - "salles de spectacle" which i think refers to theatres in general, including concert venues and movie theatres    https://web.archive.org/web/20201221224345/http://nouvelhorizon.sn/index.php/2020/12/10/deuxieme-vague-de-coronavirus-le-ministre-de-linterieur-depoussiere-les-interdits/
notes_E2: Previous note referred to this note    "One million households receive food aid (FCFA 69 billion) and utility payments for (for water and electricity) for poorer customers were suspended for a 2-month period (FCFA 18,5 billion)."
