"From Monday, when one steps out of one's home to buy basic essentials, he or she must wear a mask and maintain the social distancing guideline as recommended by health officials," said Paul Makonda, the Dar es Salaam regional commissioner.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200928212558/https://masks4all.co/what-countries-require-masks-in-public/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200928212645/http://www.china.org.cn/world/Off_the_Wire/2020-04/18/content_75949009.htm
notes_C3: According to the IMF website, effective June 1, 2020, the authorities allowed the opening of upper-secondary and tertiary schools and the resumption of sport activities and events. On June 29, 2020 all other educational institutions reopened. As a result, all the restrictions due to Covid-19 have been lifted by July 2020.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200928023258/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

name: Uganda
notes_H1: video prevention campaign: @MinofHealthUG   appeals to the general public to remain vigilant and look out for the symptoms of #Coronavirus. (https://twitter.com/MinofHealthUG/status/1223616070080245760)
notes_H3: While contact tracing is being carried out, the MOH website lists that 2,828 contacts completed follow up while 44, 575 are under follow up - indicating that contact tracing might not be incredibly effective    https://web.archive.org/web/20201019184349/https://www.health.go.ug/covid/
notes_H2: first report referring to testing (might have been in place earlier but I did not find when it started) testing is from now on mainly associted with people traveling to Uganda from affected regions. screenings and follow ups are used and testing facilities in place. https://web.archive.org/save/https://reliefweb.int/report/uganda/status-uganda-s-preparedness-2019-coronavirus-outbreak
notes_C7: No restrictions on intercity or interstate travel.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201220163807/https://ug.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-page/
notes_C8: public transportation says that "Travel outside the country is currently banned." but international travel sites (e.g. US Uganda embassy does say that you can fly into / out Uganda)   https://web.archive.org/web/20210118194953if_/https://www.health.go.ug/covid/project/guidelines/?perPage=50
notes_C4: According to the US Embassy in Uganda, gathering of about 200 people can go on with social distancing measures. Please see:   https://web.archive.org/web/20201123004030/https://ug.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-page/
notes_C1: "Despite rising coronavirus infections across the country, schools in Uganda reopened on Thursday after a seven-month break.  The government has allowed schools to resume finalist and candidate classes for now, with no date announced yet for the return of other students.  Schools were ordered to ensure COVID-19 safety measures before reopening, including handwashing facilities, temperature guns, and availability of face masks.  Some institutions that failed to meet requirements will remain closed, according to the Education Ministry."  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201202000345/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/uganda-reopens-schools-despite-virus-fears/2007193
notes_H6: Public transport notes "Not every traveller should have a face mask. ONLY those with symptoms of flu and cough MUST put on masks while travelling in public service vehicles to avoid infecting others. " https://web.archive.org/web/20210118194953if_/https://www.health.go.ug/covid/project/guidelines/?perPage=50
notes_C2: "Shopping arcades, hairdressers and salons will be open from 22 July. Shopping malls, supermarkets and pharmacies are open. Hotels and restaurants are open with social distancing measures in place and food delivery services (such as Jumia) remain operational outside of curfew hours." Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200820114638/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/uganda/staying-during-coronavirus "Museveni said business arcades must have temperature checks and traders must wear masks, ensure social distancing, and follow other safety guidelines" Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200820114007/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/businesses-to-reopen-as-uganda-eases-virus-lockdown/1918466
notes_E2: There seems to be no new information concerning this placeholder.
notes_C3: According to the US Embassy in Uganda, gathering of about 200 people can go on with social distancing measures and wearing of masks. Please see:   https://web.archive.org/web/20201123004030/https://ug.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-page/
notes_C6: guidelines for quarantine are published if sick or caring for sick - https://web.archive.org/web/20210118194953if_/https://www.health.go.ug/covid/project/guidelines/?perPage=50
notes_C5: According to the US Embassy in Uganda, public transport is generally allowed at half-capacity and all passengers are required to wear masks.  Please see:   https://web.archive.org/web/20201123004030/https://ug.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-page/

name: Ukraine
notes_H1: The Ukrainian Government has created a special information page with all relevant information in addition to daily briefings by the chief medical officer and government officials: https://web.archive.org/web/20200414005009/https://covid19.gov.ua/en
notes_H3: On 7 May the Parliament passed a law providing for large scale free obligatory testing of those who have symptoms, have been in contact with infected patients or are in at-risk groups (e.g. medical workers, police).     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200608203532/https://www.oecd.org/eurasia/competitiveness-programme/eastern-partners/COVID-19-CRISIS-IN-UKRAINE.pdf
notes_H2: Note: COVID-19 tests are widely available at the expense of the individual. Average cost of a PCR test is 60 USD. See: https://ua.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/ [web archive unavailable, accessed 28th September 2020]
notes_C7: Interregional passenger transportation (buses, cars) resumes.   Rules:  - In regions where quarantine is weakened, the number of passengers on the bus should be equal to the number of seats.  - When entering areas with a high number of infections - only 50% of seats are allowed for passengers.    From June 4, the gradual resumption of train traffic will begin. Rules:  - It is necessary to enter the train in protective masks.  - Conductors will perform temperature screening when checking tickets on Intercity trains and boarding the car on night trains.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200608202511/https://covid19.gov.ua/karantynni-zakhody
notes_C8: On 29 September, the Ukraine opened its borders for international travel. Countries are divided into green and red categories. "Green" countries do not have to take any measures, whilst "red" countries can choose from the following three options: 1. Observation in specialized isolators;    2. 14 days self-isolation at the place of residence for persons who have agreed to undergo it using the "Diy Vdoma" mobile app;    3. Pass the COVID-19 test using the PCR method after crossing the state border.    Link: https://archive.fo/XBDLg
notes_C4: Ukraine government implements extended quarantine measures as announced on 9th December 2020. The enhanced measures will be in place from 00:00 on the 8th January 2021 until 00:00 on the 25th January 2021. These measures refer to the closing of all schools across Ukraine, the closing of most workplaces, and banning all public events.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210110165940/https://moz.gov.ua/article/news/operativna-informacija-pro-poshirennja-koronavirusnoi-infekcii-2019-cov19    https://web.archive.org/web/20210110170949/https://moz.gov.ua/article/reform-plan/maksim-stepanov-vidsogodni-v-ukraini-vstupili-v-diju-posileni-karantinni-obmezhennja
notes_C1: Ukraine government implements extended quarantine measures as announced on 9th December 2020. The enhanced measures will be in place from 00:00 on the 8th January 2021 until 00:00 on the 25th January 2021. These measures refer to the closing of all schools across Ukraine, the closing of most workplaces, and banning all public events.    For the period of enhanced quarantine measures it is prohibited to visit educational institutions of any form of ownership, except kindergartens.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210116223522/https://moz.gov.ua/article/news/maksim-stepanov-vidsogodni-v-ukraini-vstupili-v-diju-posileni-karantinni-obmezhennja  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110165940/https://moz.gov.ua/article/news/operativna-informacija-pro-poshirennja-koronavirusnoi-infekcii-2019-cov19  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110170949/https://moz.gov.ua/article/reform-plan/maksim-stepanov-vidsogodni-v-ukraini-vstupili-v-diju-posileni-karantinni-obmezhennja  https://web.archive.org/web/20210116221348/https://ua.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: "When in public buildings, and while travelling on public transport and in taxis, you must wear a protective mask covering your nose and mouth."    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210104212108/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ukraine/coronavirus    Restricted: "stay in public buildings and structures, public transport without wearing personal protective equipment, including respirators or protective masks that cover the nose and mouth, including self-made" [machine translation from Ukranian].    NB The English language version of this document on the https://www.kmu.gov.ua/ website shortens this directive to "Staying in transport and public places without a mask"    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201216120435/https://www.kmu.gov.ua/npas/pro-vstanovlennya-karantinu-ta-zaprovadzhennya-obmezhuvalnih-protiepidemichnih-zahodiv-1236-091220
notes_C2: Ukraine government implements extended quarantine measures as announced on 9th December 2020. The enhanced measures will be in place from 00:00 on the 8th January 2021 until 00:00 on the 25th January 2021. These measures refer to the closing of all schools across Ukraine, the closing of most workplaces, and banning all public events.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210110165940/https://moz.gov.ua/article/news/operativna-informacija-pro-poshirennja-koronavirusnoi-infekcii-2019-cov19    https://web.archive.org/web/20210110170949/https://moz.gov.ua/article/reform-plan/maksim-stepanov-vidsogodni-v-ukraini-vstupili-v-diju-posileni-karantinni-obmezhennja
notes_E2: The Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine adopted Resolution No. 247 “On the Provision of Housing Subsidies”, which provided for simplification of the procedure for granting housing subsidies and introduced additional compensation for utility costs. This decision significantly strengthens the program of housing subsidies and social support for the least protected categories of citizens:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200817102229/https://cis-legislation.com/document.fwx?rgn=123781
notes_E1: The amount of payments for persons receiving the minimum unemployment benefit without taking into account wages and length of service has been raised from UAH 650 to UAH 1,000 for the quarantine period. The Decree applies from the beginning of the quarantine announcement, ie from March 12, and will be valid for 30 calendar days after the quarantine ends: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430222447/https://www.kmu.gov.ua/news/minimalnu-dopomogu-po-bezrobittyu-pidvishcheno-z-650-grn-do-1000-grn-minekonomiki
notes_C3: Ukraine government implements extended quarantine measures as announced on 9th December 2020. The enhanced measures will be in place from 00:00 on the 8th January 2021 until 00:00 on the 25th January 2021. These measures refer to the closing of all schools across Ukraine, the closing of most workplaces, and banning all public events.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210110165940/https://moz.gov.ua/article/news/operativna-informacija-pro-poshirennja-koronavirusnoi-infekcii-2019-cov19    https://web.archive.org/web/20210110170949/https://moz.gov.ua/article/reform-plan/maksim-stepanov-vidsogodni-v-ukraini-vstupili-v-diju-posileni-karantinni-obmezhennja
notes_C6: President Zelenskyy stated in an address "I strongly recommend that all people stay home, except for the need to buy food or pharmaceuticals." This is a development from three days earlier in which only those over 60 were advised to stay home.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200407160742/https://www.president.gov.ua/en/news/zvernennya-glavi-derzhavi-shodo-protidiyi-koronavirusu-60181
notes_C5: According to the map provided by the Ministry of Health, 3 cities in western Ukraine have been classified as 'red zones', meaning that there are prohibitions on:    operation of accommodation establishments (hostels, tourist bases, etc.), except hotels;  - operation of entertainment facilities, restaurants at night;  - scheduled hospitalisations;  - gyms, fitness centres, cultural institutions;  - new shifts in children's camps;  - restrictions for public events: 1 person per 20 square meters and no more than 100 people.  - operation of public transport;  - visiting educational institutions;  - activities of shopping malls, cafes and restaurants."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200803180310/https://reachinitiative.maps.arcgis.com/apps/webappviewer/index.html?id=b8ea3d22c51246528abb47ef94f20edb

name: Uruguay
notes_H1: Website with al relevant information on coronavirus and what the government is doing:  /web/20200430214429/https://www.gub.uy/sistema-nacional-emergencias/comunicacion/noticias/informacion-interes-actualizada-sobre-coronavirus-covid-19-uruguay

notes_H2: Recoded from 1, as testing has actually been incredibly strong.     "Testing is so aggressive that Uruguay is fourth worldwide after New Zealand, Australia and Thailand in the number of tests conducted per new confirmed case. Uruguay conducts 1,610 tests per new case. By comparison, the US and UK conduct only 52 and 21 tests respectively."     "Instead of seeking out only the contacts of confirmed cases, Uruguay sends out special teams to test random city blocks and critical job sectors such as construction workers, carrying out more than 57,000 tests so far – approximately 1.6% of its population of 3.5 million."     https://web.archive.org/web/20200806112817/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/jun/25/uruguay-and-paraguay-buck-latin-america-coronavirus-trend
notes_C7: No restrictions on intercity or interstate travel currently in place.  source:  https://archive.vn/OGM43#selection-2685.109-2685.317
notes_C8: From December 21 to January 10, 2021, border will be closed, entry to the country will be suspended, except for Uruguayans who have purchased their ticket on December 16, and the transport of cargo.  Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201221025342/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/larranaga-garcia-torre-ejecutiva-conferencia  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid   http://web.archive.org/web/20201229065720/https://uy.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20201020201228/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-exterior-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19

notes_C2: Changing value to 2G (at least for 2 Dec to 18 Dec) the below * items noted 1 Dec 2020:    *Implementation of teleworking in public offices, between December 2 and 18, as long as the essential quality of the service is not compromised. (01/12/2020)    Private companies throughout the country are encouraged to implement the voluntary use of teleworking. (01/12/2020)    Between December 2 and 18, bars and restaurants must close their doors at 00.00. and in case of non-compliance they will receive financial sanctions. (01/12/2020)     *Suspension of sports activities in gyms and closed places between December 2 and 18. (01/12/2020)    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214214141/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-trabajo-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19#navegacion-contenido    https://web.archive.org/web/20201202223646/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-sanitaria-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19#navegacion-contenido    https://web.archive.org/web/20201215000942/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-deporte-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19#navegacion-contenido
notes_E2: - The government has postponed maturities of tax payments and credit programs.  - VAT payments have been deferred to be paid in 6 installments without interest.  - Social Security Bank loan quotas for retirees and pensioners have been deferred   /web/20200430214936/https://www.gub.uy/medidas-emergencia-sanitaria
notes_E1: The Ministry of Labour and Social Security announced on July 31 that elderly sickness benefit is extended further until August 31.    In March, the Government decreed that working people over 65 years of age could remain in isolation for a maximum of 30 days and access a sickness allowance. The measure was successively extended during the months of June and July and is extended again, now, until August 31.   The amount received by those who choose to take advantage of this measure corresponds to 70% of all their taxable income (not counting the Christmas bonus), with a ceiling of 44,606 pesos. The subsidy is paid on a monthly basis, starting from the fourth day of certification. Workers who habitually perform tasks from their homes or are able to perform them are excluded from this rule.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200831093431/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/mtss-gobierno-prorroga-subsidio-enfermedad
notes_C3: "This Wednesday government authorities announced at a press conference the decision to apply sanctions, according to the powers granted by current regulations for pandemic contexts, such as fines, closures and criminal complaints to those who violate health provisions.    In recent weeks, several unauthorized mass parties have been detected, which the government considers are the greatest risk ahead and put the transitory health status of the country at risk, stressed the Secretary of the Presidency, Álvaro Delgado.    “The Executive Power through the Ministry of Public Health and according to the legal mandate of the Organic Law of Public Health must adopt, immediately, before the violation of the sanitary provisions, all the measures at its disposal to keep the country harmless or reduce the risks of the effects of the pandemic ”, explained the prosecutor Rodrigo Ferrés.    The fines may range from 37 thousand pesos to one million three hundred thousand. The Executive Power may close establishments and file police and prosecutorial complaints in cases of contempt.    The Minister of Health, Daniel Salinas, explained why the risk of a massive adult party is different than that of a children's party protocolized by the Ministry and other activities that have been devised opening in recent times, such as restaurants, hotels, some shows, and also the Rural del Prado."    (Since not all shows have been authorized I have coded this indicator as 2G)    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201018230001/https://radiouruguay.uy/fiestas-no-autorizadas-se-aplicaran-multas-sanciones-y-denuncias-penales/
notes_C6: According to the government news, the president said that the Government "defends tooth and nail" not to establish a mandatory confinement of the population. "The 'stay at home' is worn out, everyone knows what they can do," said Lacalle Pou. "If people can stay at home, let them stay, but it is not mandatory," which indicates recommended but not required stay-at-home measure.   Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid
notes_C5: Public transportation is open with masks and social distancing measures. To prevent the spread of COVID-19, the measure of limiting passenger capacity in interdepartmental transport units to 50% began to take effect from December 21 through January 10, 2021.   Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201229064206/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/mtop-transporte-distancia-olaizola-protocolo  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid  http://web.archive.org/web/20201229064449/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-transporte-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19

notes_H3: "Contact tracing was used in Seattle and parts of California early on in their coronavirus outbreaks, but as community spread took hold, many cities and states switched to a "mitigation" approach, like closing schools and other social distancing measures." https://web.archive.org/web/20200414010434/https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2020/04/10/831200054/cdc-director-very-aggressive-contact-tracing-needed-for-u-s-to-return-to-normal
notes_H2: First drive-through testing site introduced in New York    https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/new-york-launches-drive-thru-testing-site-for-covid-19    https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/new-york-launches-drive-thru-testing-site-for-covid-19
notes_C7: State by state variation, California starts on 19/03, then others follow  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/03/emergencies-closures-states-handling-coronavirus-200317213356419.html  --------- Financial Times from 23/03/20 -----------    	Please use the sharing tools found via the share button at the top or side of articles. Copying articles to share with others is a breach of FT.com T&Cs and Copyright Policy. Email licensing@ft.com to buy additional rights. More information can be found at https://www.ft.com/tour.  	https://www.ft.com/content/f96ada9f-bd2a-39a7-8b59-c4170f5a1101    	Peter Wells MAR 23, 22:46  More than 42% of the US now under 'stay at home' orders    New Mexico has become the latest state to issue a stay at home order, bringing the proportion of the US population under lockdown now and in coming days to more than 40 per cent.    The order from the southwestern state, which comes into effect at 8am on March 24, means the number of US states ordering residents to stay at their residences more than doubled on Monday to 15. Indiana, Massachusetts, Michigan, Ohio, Oregon, West Virginia and Wisconsin made such announcements earlier in the day.    The 15 states where those orders are effective or about to come into effect cover just over 42 per cent of the population in the 50 states and District of Columbia.    The number of confirmed coronavirus cases in the US has soared to more than 41,000 as of Monday, 579 of whom have died, according to John Hopkins University. That is more cases than any country after China and Italy, and the number of people who test positive is expected to continue to rise rapidly as the US ramps up the ability to test people with symptoms.    New York is the hardest-hit state, with the number of confirmed cases rising by 5,707 in the past 24 hours, Governor Andrew Cuomo announced on Monday, bringing the total number of cases to 20,875.    Some individual cities and counties have issued stay at home orders, even though the states have not. As such, the proportion of the population affected by those restrictions probably exceeds 42 per cent.    Texas, the US's second most-populous state, does not have a stay at home order in place, but local media reported the capital, Austin, was expected to take this route tomorrow, following in the footsteps of Dallas and Waco.  https://www.ft.com/content/f96ada9f-bd2a-39a7-8b59-c4170f5a1101
notes_C8: As of March 2, foreign nationals who have travelled to Iran within the past 14 days are denied permission to enter the US.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200410104600/https://edition.cnn.com/travel/article/coronavirus-travel-restrictions/
notes_C4: Alabama, Idaho, Indiana, Missouri and South Dakota allow gatherings of any size, while other states have very strict measures in place. The most restrictive are New Mexico with max 5 people and Oregon with max 6 people from max 2 households.     Overview (last updated Nov 17): http://web.archive.org/web/20201123193939/https://www.northstarmeetingsgroup.com/News/Industry/Coronavirus-states-cities-reopening-COVID-19-new-cases  New Mexico: http://web.archive.org/web/20201123192402/https://cv.nmhealth.org/public-health-orders-and-executive-orders/frequently-asked-questions/  Oregon: http://web.archive.org/web/20201123193338/https://govstatus.egov.com/OR-OHA-COVID-19
notes_C1: Washington District Shuts Down All Schools to Slow Deadly Coronavirus Outbreak Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20201104100007/https://www.thedailybeast.com/northshore-school-district-shuts-down-all-schools-to-slow-deadly-coronavirus-outbreak
notes_H6: Governor Wolf in Pennsylvania:    Expanding on the business safety order signed by Secretary of Health Dr. Rachel Levine in April that requires the wearing of masks in businesses, Governor Tom Wolf today announced a new order signed by Dr. Levine that takes the mask-wearing directive one step further.    With this order, signed under Dr. Levine’s authority under the Disease Prevention and Control Act, masks must be worn whenever anyone leaves home. The order takes effect immediately.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200923054840/https://www.governor.pa.gov/newsroom/gov-wolf-sec-of-health-signs-expanded-mask-wearing-order/
notes_C2: Several states have rolled back restrictions on business after Thanksgiving holidays, so I’m changing the code to a 2T.     New Mexico transitioned from shutting down all essential businesses to a coding system whereby counties can reopen starting December 2.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201205192217/https://cv.nmhealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/120220-PHO.pdf     In Arizona, businesses can operate at a limited capacity if certain benchmarks are met.     In California, some businesses such as movie theaters and bars are closed. However, other industries such as retail stores can operate at 20% capacity.     In Georgia, gyms, hair salons and movies can operate, with restrictions.     In Idaho and Oregon, businesses can be open but are encouraged to telework when possible.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201205191446/https://www.aarp.org/politics-society/government-elections/info-2020/coronavirus-state-restrictions.html
notes_E2: CARES Act, signed into law on 27 March 2020, implemented targeted debt relief based on Federal jurisdiction (e.g. eviction freezes for federal housing programs, mortgage forbearance for federally-backed mortgages, etc.). Primary source (U.S. House of Representatives, Financial Services Committee, archived link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430040220/https://financialservices.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=406472    Debt/contract relief also implemented at state level (e.g. eviction freezes, rent increase freezes, utility bill late charge waivers, etc.), but case-specific and not captured in this coding scheme.
notes_E1: Unemployment insurance in the U.S. is state-specific, but overseen by the U.S. Dept. of Labor. On average, unemployment insurance replaces ~50% of lost wages for a finite period of time. The CARES Act, signed into law on 27 March 2020, boosted unemployment benefits by supplementing state benefits with $600 per week, and expanding eligibility to individuals that normally don't qualify for unemployment insurance (e.g. gig workers & independent contractors). Secondary source, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430034950/https://www.cbpp.org/research/economy/policy-basics-unemployment-insurance    The CARES Act also established a low-interest, forgivable loan program for small businesses to help keep employees on payroll. Primary source, U.S. Small Business Administration, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430035544/https://www.sba.gov/funding-programs/loans/coronavirus-relief-options/paycheck-protection-program
notes_C3: Statewise-changes and dates are listed in website: https://archive.vn/6NqU4  Oregon: No gatherings of more than 250 people in Oregon for 4 weeks, Gov. Kate Brown says Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200502095403/https://www.oregonlive.com/coronavirus/2020/03/no-gatherings-of-250-or-more-people-in-oregon-for-4-weeks-gov-kate-brown-says.html Washington: Washington Gov. Jay Inslee said he’s banning gatherings of more than 250 people in several counties. Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200502095318/https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/11/washington-state-bans-large-events-to-contain-the-coronavirus-outbreak.html
notes_C6: On Nov 16 Chicago and New Mexico issued a stay-at-home order, under which people are only allowed to leave the house for emergencies or essential needs such as grocery shopping. California has imposed a curfew in most of its counties.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201123192402/https://cv.nmhealth.org/public-health-orders-and-executive-orders/frequently-asked-questions/
notes_C5: Across the country, public transport is operating but at reduced capacity.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201123194911/https://time.com/5869375/public-transit-coronavirus-covid/
notes_H7: A:    First Covid-19 vaccines in US were administered on 14th December 2020. High-risk health care workers are the first in line for inoculations.     New York - http://web.archive.org/web/20201222015252/https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2020/12/14/first-covid-vaccines-new-york/     Michigan - http://web.archive.org/web/20201222015925/https://www.michigan.gov/coronavirus/0,9753,7-406-98158-547433--,00.html     According to the CDC Website - Because the supply of COVID-19 vaccine in the United States is expected to be limited at first, CDC recommends that initial supplies of COVID-19 vaccine be allocated to healthcare personnel and long-term care facility residents.  Hence, coded as Two groups. http://web.archive.org/web/20201222015702/https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/recommendations.html     Code change from zero because according to Forbes, The federal government’s has ordered a total of 200 million doses so far from Moderna, which is enough to immunize 100 million Americans because the vaccine requires two shots. This is more than 20% of the population.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201222024503if_/https://www.forbes.com/sites/joewalsh/2020/12/11/us-ordered-100-million-extra-doses-of-modernas-covid-vaccine/?sh=1666247f3ef3

name: Uzbekistan
notes_H1: Government launched an official website with up-to-date information on fighting Coronavirus: https://web.archive.org/save/https://coronavirus.uz/ru
notes_H3: Those who have been in contact with a person who tests positive for COVID-19 will no longer be automatically quarantined but required to self-isolate for 14-days and subject to medical monitoring.  Link: https://archive.vn/hMl5w
notes_H2: Patients with severe forms of influenza and other acute respiratory diseases, for which, according to clinical and epidemiological indications, there are suspicions of infection with coronavirus, are subject to mandatory diagnosis for this type of virus.  Link: https://lex.uz/ru/pdfs/4720408
notes_C7: From 15 August onwards, restrictions on movement between regions are lifted. See local news agency Gazeta website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20201112100715/https://www.gazeta.uz/ru/2020/08/10/quarantine/
notes_C8: Uzbekistan has barred passengers from 8 countries (Denmark, Germany, Australia, Austria, Italy, the Netherlands, South Africa and the United Kingdom) from entering the country until January 10th. This policy was announced on December 22, I could not find information on when it was put in place.  source:  https://archive.fo/NMcmU
notes_C1: From 11 January, schools and universities are open across the country. The government requires schools and universities to provide health protection to students. Moreover, the government allows continuing online learning for those students who belong to risk groups and have chronic diseases.  Links: https://archive.vn/D52gP https://archive.vn/IgGjB https://archive.vn/9l68x
notes_H6: Masks must be worn in public.  source:  https://archive.vn/eZ6Zt
notes_C2: The Republican Special Commission to Combat Coronavirus announced further easing of quarantine measures starting from 5 September 2020. Catering facilities are allowed to receive guests with social distancing, theatres and cinemas are re-opened, and religious services resumed. See news agency Gazeta website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20201107120830/https://www.gazeta.uz/ru/2020/09/01/quarantine/ AND Ministry of Health telegram announcement, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20201107121041/https://t.me/s/ssvuz/2822
notes_E2: There is no policy was found on debt and contract relief for households.  On the contrary, some regions of Uzbekistan are experiencing a lack of electricity and gas. Moreover, the central government has recently increased the rate/tariff on water and sewerage that has resulted in public discontent.  Links: https://archive.vn/eKp15 https://archive.vn/T1FBQ https://archive.vn/MqjsD
notes_E1: No evidence of income support for those who lost their jobs due to COVID-19 was found.   The President of Uzbekistan has recently stated that “We cannot allow people who lost their jobs due to the pandemic to become poor. Therefore, starting next year, a new system will be introduced that provides a threefold increase in the amount of temporary unemployment benefits".   Link: https://archive.vn/chLCL
notes_C3: According to the US Embassy website, large gatherings and major religious services have been officially discouraged.  Link: https://archive.vn/5bc9e
notes_C6: Uzbekistan reintroduced the lockdown last month due to a surge in cases. The government decides to lift its second lockdown starting from Saturday August 15th, 2020. people are allowed to drive their cars again and some businesses are open. However, the government suggests people to stay at home.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200820001724/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-uzbekistan/uzbekistan-to-start-lifting-lockdown-from-saturday-idUSKCN2581WD
notes_C5: From 15 August onwards, public transport including buses, minibuses and metro reopens. Passengers are required to wear mask and ensure social distancing. See government telegram channel, https://web.archive.org/web/20201112083526/https://t.me/s/koronavirusinfouz/5657 AND news agency Gazeta article, archived https://web.archive.org/web/20201112083701/https://www.gazeta.uz/ru/2020/08/14/public-transport/

name: Venezuela
notes_H1: Stablishment of a national committee for corona, and public campaign to raise awareness https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oq0b_OzXV7w
notes_H2: The "Guideline for management and treatment of Covid-19 patients and contacts" (24/4/20) states that PCR tests should be performed on: suspect cases, patients before hospital/quarantine discharge, a/symptomatic contacts of confirmed cases, people who enter the country and probable cases (See page 3). Priority should be given to severe cases, people with comorbidities, pregnant women and healthcare workers (See page 4).    https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yrv5ec-LAdelzvTIf1RIhstTIduxEp3C/view  See "ESQUEMA TERAPÉUTICO ESPECÍFICO PARA TRATAMIENTO DE PACIENTE" in https://web.archive.org/web/20200406095426/http://www.mpps.gob.ve/index.php/sistemas/descargas
